story: -

Everything has led up to this! 

The critically acclaimed series reaches its epic conclusion!

T-Bird finally confronts the mastermind behind the plot to destroy him while an enemy armada descends upon Centennial City! Past, present, and future collide in T-BIRD & THROTTLE #4!

Also available this campaign: the T-BIRD & THROTTLE Collected Edition trade paperback, collecting all 4 issues plus the #0 prequel.

 

 

***

OVERVIEW

On his road to redemption, an aging former astronaut turned superhero must confront his own demons, a hostile media, and a sinister conspiracy all while trying to raise a teenage daughter.

Inspired by the comics & cartoons of the 80s & 90s, T-BIRD & THROTTLE is story about heroes and villains and what defines them. If you've grown weary of modern comic storytelling, this is the book for you!

***

 

NEED A LITTLE MORE PERSUASION?

Read the 16 PAGE ISSUE #0 PREQUEL for FREE!

Read the entire 60 page FIRST ISSUE for FREE!

 

***

STRETCH GOALS!

 

 UNLOCKED! $18K - "SKETCH ODYSSEY" added to trade paperback.

 

UNLOCKED! - $22K - "ASHCAN" SIZED PIN-UP BOOK  FOR ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS!

 

WHO AM I? 

My name is Josh Howard and I've worked as a professional comic book writer/artist for over 16 years. I am best known for my indie horror series DEAD@17 and BLACK HARVEST published by Image Comics. I've also done illustration work for DC Comics, IDW, and Mattel. This marks my 4th crowdfunding campaign. 

 

Video by Matt King of Corban Video.

story:
Our Story

I'm an aspiring stand up comedian native to the Bay Area looking to expand on a national level.  Upon my graduation from SJSU, I have fallen upon hard times.  I've been unemployed over 18months and had to move back in with my parents in an area outside the comedy scene until I get back on my feet.  Although my finances are in turmoil, I never stopped chasing my dream, no matter how far I have to travel to perform.  I recently advanced to the Quarter Finals of the Laughing Skull Comedy Fesitval, but I am short the funds to make the trip.  I would love to compete in this contest but I can't afford the trip, and that is why I need your help.


The Impact

I'm not getting any younger so I have to strike now while the iron's hot.  Competing in this competition would be a great move for my career and it would be a horrible waste of an opportunity if I missed out.


What We Need & What You Get

Any amount you can donate helps.  I thank you all in advance for your generosity.


Other Ways You Can Help

Visit my website: www.crshowtime.com

Like me on Facebook: www.facebook.com/crshowtime

Follow me on Twitter: twitter.com/ComicCrob

Contact your favorite comedy club and tell them you want to see me at their club.

story:
IL NOCCIOLO DELLA QUESTIONE

Salve a tutti. Questa campagna di Agenzia incantesimi ha lo scopo di compensare la disegnatrice e colorista Teresa Marzia per il suo lavoro di colorazione delle storie di Agenzia Incantesimi. Si tratta di 12 storie per un totale di oltre 200 pagine. Un paio di queste storie sono quelle attualmente in lavorazione, mentre tutte le altre sono le storie precedentemente pubblicate in bianco e nero.

NOTA: le colorazioni di esempio che potete vedere in questa pagina sono ancora in lavorazione, quindi il risultato finale sarà persino migliore.

DOVE ANDRANNO I VOSTRI SOLDI?

Facile: tolte le trattenute di Indiegogo e Paypal, tutti i soldi raccolti andranno a Teresa come compenso per il lavoro!

PRIMO TRAGUARDO: 500 EURO

Il primo traguardo compenserà Teresa per la colorazione delle prime quattro storie: "L'orda infernale" (in lavorazione, disegni di Davide Castelluccio), "I giorni dell'abbandono" (in lavorazione, disegni di Sandro Pizziolo), "I gatti dello zoo di Parigi" (disegni di Teresa Marzia) e "il potere, la gloria e altre sciocchezze" (disegni di Teresa Marzia).

SECONDO TRAGUARDO: 1000 EURO

Con il secondo traguardo verranno pagate a Teresa le colorazioni di altre quattro storie: "Acqua profonde" (disegni di Federico Vicentini), "La sposa promessa" (disegni di Riccardo Randazzo), "C'era una volta una principessa" (disegni di Alessia Vivenzio) e "Myriam di molti mondi" (disegni di Gianluca Cerritelli).

TERZO TRAGUARDO: 1600 EURO

Terzo e ultimo traguardo e ultimo gruppo di storie: "Tutti quanti vogliono Myriam" (disegni di Oscar celestini), "Il dente del drago" (disegni di Luisa Russo), "Terrore dagli abissi" (disegni di Riccardo Lo Giudice) e "La famiglia oscura" (disegni di Michela Cacciatore).

QUANDO POTRETE LEGGERE LE STORIE?

Come potete immaginare, la mole di lavoro è notevole e quindi la colorazione di tutte queste storie richiederà un po' di tempo. Potrete cominciare a leggere le prime storie nella nuova versione a colori a partire dalla primavera del 2016 e poi nel corso dell'anno.

ALTRI MODI IN CUI POTETE AIUTARCI

Se non avete la possibilità di aiutarci economicamente, potete però contribuire segnalando ai vostri contatti l'esistenza di questa campagna e della stessa serie di Agenzia Incantesimi. Allargare il pubblico significa aumentare anche il numero di potenziali finanziatori e quindi anche aumentare le possibilità di produrre nuove storie in futuro.

Come sempre, grazie mille a tutti!

story: I am thrilled to relaunch this campaign for those who missed out on the limited time funding of CYBERFROG: BLOODHONEY, with an exclusive new variant cover for the first part of an EPIC CyberFrog story. I am pouring my heart into this. Having worked at DC COMICS as the artist of GREEN LANTERN, FLASH:REBIRTH, SINESTRO CORPS WAR, and DCU REBIRTH, I can promise the highest quality, and a lot of fun! Did you miss out the FIRST TWO times? Here’s one more chance to hop on board!

story:
DEADSTAR

  Deep in the far reaches of space, in the system surrounding the star Priam 12, lies a cold lifeless planet known as DEADSTAR. 

  Built upon this cold iron waste is a prison. Built deep within the planets crust and extending onto the surface. This facility was meant to cater to only the most violent of prisoners who avoided lawful execution.

  It is here where the brothers Romulus and Remus find themselves, but they are not alone. Joining them are enemies, rivals, friends, strangers and all sort of shadowy creatures.

  "The Great Sting of Orpheus" is what they call it now. Considered the largest criminal indictment in centuries, spanning hundreds of star systems. Crypto Lords, Network Kingpins, Data Smugglers, Gun Weavers, even the unlicensed hotdog brokers out of Yuri 16 got pinched.

  There was a time when this old prison rock was holding just 150 prisoners, now it's being shipped 130,000,000 inmates at minimum. So, like pouring a gallon of gasoline into a thimble there's only one way this will end.

story:
Meaninful Touch!!

We are "Meaningful Touch," a musical improvisation team from Los Angeles and we've been invited to participate in the Del Close Marathon in NYC.  Because most of us are struggling actors/writers, we don't necessarily have the cash to trek all the way to New York and put ourselves up.  This is where we need your help. 

We'd like to think that we're a special breed of improvisers.  Not many teams are dong musical improv.  It's rare, it's challenging and it's incredibly fun.  Our team really brings that fun and joy to our audiences.  After meeting in a class, taught by Tara Copeland, we had an immediate bond and decided to build on these friendships by starting a team together.  It's not only been a pleasure to improvise and sing together BUT in the short time we've performed together, we have been invited to play in several improv shows, the LA Indie Improv Festival and The Del Close Marathon.

However, we're still at the very early stages where income is not plentiful.  This is indeed the nature of the beast when you are a performer, a beast which we are willing to face daily so to pursue our passions.  But it certainly would be nice if we could expand on our dream of doing comedy in New York with other great comedians and improvisors.  More exposure is absolutely what we at Meaningful Touch truly need.  By performing in the Del Close Marathon, we will be opening those doors that have allowed the likes of Jimmy Fallon, Tina Fey and Kristin Wiig to enter.  it is a special opportunity.

I know you may be saying - there are tons of improv troupes and comedy teams out there.  Why should I help this one?  And I can only answer that by saying - we're special.  I don't know how else to put it, but when you come across those few moments in life that feel like pure synchonity, you have to take them and run with them.  After being in several comedy troupes my entire adult life, I can honestly say that I've never been involved in one so generous, caring, kind, considerate and hilariously funny.  Our team is just that - a team.  Like a lot of comics, we don't grandstand, step in each other's way or use this opportunity to leap frog over the other guy to reach the goal.  We want to reach the goal together.

We're estimating that we need approximately $10,000 (we're only asking for $5,000).  This would cover airfare for eleven people as well as accommodations.  Also, if you can't offer up a contribution, lodgings would be good too!  

Thank you so much for even considering helping us.  If you live in the New York or Los Angeles areas, we would be more than happy to entertain you!

story:
Help the second episode of the LGBT-friendly all-ages webcomic, The Super-Gay Adventures of Ross Boston, happen faster and better!


"The Super-Gay Adventures of Ross Boston" (or SGARB, for short) is an LGBT-friendly, all-ages webcomic available to read free on the web.  It follows the tale of a chubby ex-pizza-guy-turned-adventurer and his quest to protect the downtrodden monster citizens of the comic's setting.  He has the help of a sassy gay beast, an 80's workout video instructor, a super secret ex-spy, and their boss, a whimsical wizard.  Currently, it updates every Friday, and as of the start of this campaign, the first episode is very nearly finished.  Go on and read it!

Episode 2 of SGARB picks up days after the end of the first story arc.  Having just been hired by Wizard Wayne to join the Bobslist Adventure Team, timid Ross desperately seeks the approval of his fellow adventurers.  In his search, he accepts a challenge from a shady drag queen/wizard who claims to have helpful information on the mysterious "Freedom Nightmare."



My name is Drew Green and I'm an Atlanta-based illustrator and comic artist.  Currently, I'm self-employed and I make a meager living doing commissions and freelance, but I'd like to change that with your help, through this campaign.  With enough funding (the proposed $5,000), I can make my webcomic my full-time job.  I can work on it Monday through Friday - and weekends when necessary - using the funds provided by you to keep my life afloat.  Additionally, the funds will go to comic-related business;  i.e., funding the website, advertising, and conventions.

To be clear, if this campaign is funded, I'm not going to rest on my laurels.  Focusing on my comic in such a concentrated manner will be immensely rewarding and usually enjoyable, but it will probably also be the hardest thing I've ever done, creatively.  I plan to write, draw, ink, and color about 55 pages of content in about 4 months, so you can imagine what kind of undertaking this really is.

What are the benefits of funding this campaign?

  • An increased update schedule -  Since I'll be working on the comic almost exclusively, I'll be able to post more than one page a week, as is the current update schedule.  This means you won't have to wait a year just to read 55 pages of content.
  • Improvements to the story, writing, and art - With more time to devote to the comic, I'll be able to expand on the characters and situations, and the comic will look even better if I don't have other projects to distract me.
  • The SGARB website - You and I won't have to worry about the website ceasing to exist for lack of funds to keep it running.
  • Really awesome perks - Just look below and you'll see all of the great things being offered here!
  • Support the arts - by donating to this campaign, you'll be supporting a unique art form:  independant comics.  Additionally, consider it a moral contribution to the LGBT movement, as I seek to use my comic to help boost visibility of gay characters in popular culture and media.
  • Create a success story - everybody loves a success story in webcomics, rare though that might be.  Help create one!


 

  • A PDF art book, featuring sketches, artwork, and written commentary specifically related to the creation of SGARB and its first episode.
  • Nine new character portrait prints, 6"x8", each signed by me!
  • Colored digital sketches!
  • Completed bust (similar to the portrait prints) and full-body character commissions!
  • The SGARB:  Episode 2 teaser poster, 7"x10", signed by me!
  • The campaign-exclusive 11"x17" poster, signed by me!
  • Original ink drawings of SGARB characters!
  • The extra special Bobslist Adventure Team badge (scuplted and molded courtesy of my awesome parents)!
  • An appearance as a background extra in SGARB:  Episode 2!
  • A 5-page, fully-colored comic, just for you! (Only 4 available.)
  • A super-rad 10-page, fully-colored comic, just for you!  (Only 1 available.)

 

(Updates on the B.A.T. badge will be posted as they become available.)

 

UPDATE:  Added a new 11"x17" print if you donate $130 or more!  See below:


Not able to donate any money?  That's okay, becuase you can help by promoting this campaign by using the useful tools just below the video to share this with others on twitter, facebook, or anywhere you please!  A signal boost would be MUCH appreciated!



You must add the additional amount of money for shipping (designated in the perk description depending on the perk you chose).  Otherwise, I'll be unable to ship your items to you!  And that would just plain suck.  You can add the money on top of the amount of the perk when you select your perk and go to the pledge screen.  It's at the bottom of the section called "Step 1:  Perk & Amount."  If you forget to add the designated amount for shipping, you can select the "Glittering Karma!" perk and change the amount from $1 to $8.

It is my goal to get the perks out to donaters no later than November of this year.  Prints have to be printed, signed, and trimmed, drawings have to be drawn, and badges have to be pulled from the mold and painted, and all of this will probably take place at the end or near the end of finishing up the task at hand - creating Episode 2 of SGARB - so I hope you understand.  That said, I would like to get them out sooner if possible, but I can't make any promises for that.  Furthermore, higher up perks, like a guest appearance in the comic or a comic just for you, will depend on where that guest appearance falls, or will take much longer just by the very nature of making a personalized comic.



  •     I ship internationally.  The rates posted on each perk are a flat rate.  In some cases I will profit from the shipping, and in some cases I will lose a little money, so I expect it to even out.
  •     Those appearing in the comic as a background extra will be able to correspond with me so we can design your character before putting it into the comic.  You can be human or any species you like - given the monster-riddled nature of the comic.  I'm sure we can apply your distinguishing features.  :)
  •     the Bust and full-body character commission process:  I provide you with a sketch, you approve it (or we make changes), I then ink and color the image, you give me final approval, and I send you a high-resolution file.  The commission can be of you, an original character, whatever.  All digital commissions are emailed, not printed.  Though I'm sure if you wanted me to print and sign it for you, we could arrange something for a small fee.  Just let me know.
  •     The personalized comics provided as perks for larger donations:  I'm pretty sure I'll be able to get the comics printed up through a print on demand service so you'll have a physical copy of it (may print one for myself too), and if you'd like more copies to give to your friends or whatever, we'll work something out.  In any case, I'll definitely provide it to you as a PDF, at least.  As for how we'll go about it, you can write it yourself and I'll draw it or you can give me an idea and I'll write something around it.  It'll be a collaborative process and that should be a lot of fun.  :)

 

Thank you for taking a look at my campaign!  I appreciate every single dollar of every donation, and every share on twitter, tumblr, facebook, whatever.  I hope you'll help out and in any case, I look forward to creating Episode 2 of SGARB!

A super-rad 10-page, fully-colored comic, just for you!  (Only 1 available.)
 


(Updates on the B.A.T. badge will be posted as they become available.)
 
UPDATE:  Added a new 11"x17" print if you donate $130 or more!  See below:


Not able to donate any money?  That's okay, becuase you can help by promoting this campaign by using the useful tools just below the video to share this with others on twitter, facebook, or anywhere you please!  A signal boost would be MUCH appreciated!You must add the additional amount of money for shipping (designated in the perk description depending on the perk you chose).  Otherwise, I'll be unable to ship your items to you!  And that would just plain suck.  You can add the money on top of the amount of the perk when you select your perk and go to the pledge screen.  It's at the bottom of the section called "Step 1:  Perk & Amount."  If you forget to add the designated amount for shipping, you can select the "Glittering Karma!" perk and change the amount from $1 to $8.It is my goal to get the perks out to donaters no later than November of this year.  Prints have to be printed, signed, and trimmed, drawings have to be drawn, and badges have to be pulled from the mold and painted, and all of this will probably take place at the end or near the end of finishing up the task at hand - creating Episode 2 of SGARB - so I hope you understand.  That said, I would like to get them out sooner if possible, but I can't make any promises for that.  Furthermore, higher up perks, like a guest appearance in the comic or a comic just for you, will depend on where that guest appearance falls, or will take much longer just by the very nature of making a personalized comic.


    I ship internationally.  The rates posted on each perk are a flat rate.  In some cases I will profit from the shipping, and in some cases I will lose a little money, so I expect it to even out.
    Those appearing in the comic as a background extra will be able to correspond with me so we can design your character before putting it into the comic.  You can be human or any species you like - given the monster-riddled nature of the comic.  I'm sure we can apply your distinguishing features.  :)
    the Bust and full-body character commission process:  I provide you with a sketch, you approve it (or we make changes), I then ink and color the image, you give me final approval, and I send you a high-resolution file.  The commission can be of you, an original character, whatever.  All digital commissions are emailed, not printed.  Though I'm sure if you wanted me to print and sign it for you, we could arrange something for a small fee.  Just let me know.
    The personalized comics provided as perks for larger donations:  I'm pretty sure I'll be able to get the comics printed up through a print on demand service so you'll have a physical copy of it (may print one for myself too), and if you'd like more copies to give to your friends or whatever, we'll work something out.  In any case, I'll definitely provide it to you as a PDF, at least.  As for how we'll go about it, you can write it yourself and I'll draw it or you can give me an idea and I'll write something around it.  It'll be a collaborative process and that should be a lot of fun.  :)
 
Thank you for taking a look at my campaign!  I appreciate every single dollar of every donation, and every share on twitter, tumblr, facebook, whatever.  I hope you'll help out and in any case, I look forward to creating Episode 2 of SGARB!

story:
Our Story

Quick!!!!  Name five top female comics working RIGHT NOW!!  Hard to do huh? That's why Comedienne Mocha is trying to LA to attend the Females in Comedy Convention in LA, April 25th-30th .  This fantastic opportunityis the brainchild of Comedienne Hope Flood to give women access to the knowledge and network shared by so many men!  A resounding theme is that the women "need to support one another" so the era of female comedy can be strengthend again...I have performed as Comedienne Mocha since 1997. 2012 has been designated as the year I pour everything into her!!  No more gigs once a month here and there.  Its Mocha's time to shine!!

 

The Impact

Participants of the conference will be afforded a showcase in one of the hottest comedy clubs in LA to showcase her skills as a comic. Certain professional factors such as contract negotiations, image management and improv classes will also be offered.  Speakers include some of the hottest comics, writers and agents in the comedy game.  Comediennes networking at the convention will create the ultimate benefit by meeting new people that can book gigs and work together in the future.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for a fund of $1250 to cover the expenses of the trip.

Convention fee ($275)

Airline ticket ($409)

Hotel room for 6 nights ($480 before taxes)

Any extra raised will go to head shots, food and a new shirt for the showcase!!

Thank you for your consideration and help towards my campaign!!!

Yours comically,

Comedienne Mocha

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends. Get the word out so that Mocha can spread the joy!!!! Tell your friends and your grandmama and dem!

story:
Anatomy Of War is a comic that is near and dear to me because it is about a young man that is suddenly diagnosed with cancer. He's completely healthy and then life throws him a curve ball that he just isn't ready for. The other main character is a peaceful man that believes his every conflict can be worked out peacefully. The complete story takes place on two worlds and shows how the two affect each other on their life's journey.

Writer: Roshawn Rochester -
www.anatomyofwar.net
www.facebook.com/#!/roshawn.rochester
www.twitter.com/Rdrrrrrrrgh FEEL FREE TO CONTACT ME :)
Artist: Luisa Russo - www.luisarusso-gallery.it

THE PLAN:

I want to have the issue printed and ready for Long Beach Comic-Con 2012!

With the money raised, we will print a run of the comic, produce advertising merchandise.

THE GOAL:

I want this comic to be able to touch people, as well as educate them about the dangers of skin cancer and ways they can help prevent it.

The more money we are able to raise means more copies of the comic we are able to print and hopefully more attention the series can garner.

I want to sincerely thank everyone for all the support they have given us with creating this book. It has been a pleasure to work with such great people!!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

You can help just by getting the word out! We will be updating the page weekly and letting you know what is going on!

story:
UPDATE: On Sunday the campaign hit 113%!!!  It's still going until the deadline.  Your contribution is going toward the unanticipated costs of additional transportation and equipment rental and toward the sound mix, much needed after the helicopter visit during the Lizzie and Oscar date scene.  THANK YOU!!!

Oscar has a deep longing to connect to the world through poetry and as deep of a fear to express himself, until he meets Lizzie who is creative, free and not afraid to be who she is.

“And the Fool Became Beautiful,” a short romantic comedy written and directed by Dina Kagan, is filming in New York City the last week of July.

With all the talent working on this project, I know this film will be really good!  We have enlisted support from a production company Image Factory for some of the equipment and have have received permission to film for free in very special locations in New York City.  But in order to give it the production value that a film likes this deserves, we need to cover basic expenses like hiring a small crew, renting some of the equipment and buying props and food during the shoot.  This is where we need your help.

Fun, fun perks when you donate to the film!  If you give $30, Oscar or Lizzie will write you a haiku.  And with a $100 donation, one of them will write you a limerick!   Please post our indiegogo link to your facebook page.  I also include non-monetary production needs here (barter updates):  https://www.facebook.com/AndTheFoolBecameBeautiful

In supporting this film, you are supporting an authentic expression by an indie filmmaker and providing an amazing cast and crew an opportunity to shine, which will add to the beauty of this world.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

   My name is Ken Austin, I am an aspiring comic book artist and creator of Haven Knights. I am currently on active duty with the US Army and a friend and I created a story that has now become Haven Knights. 

   My campaign is is designed to open up into several venues starting with what I really hope turns into an epic storyline that lasts over hundreds of issues and then moves on into a multi-player online video game, and maybe one day a feature film.

    The campaign is important to me because a friend of mine that I was stationed with in Germany many years ago helped to inspire the story and asked that I turn the idea into a comic book after seeing some of my sketches. My friend passed away last year after a health issue that I won't go into detail about. I have dedicated the book to him and have given him credit for the story which I will continue to do as the book progresses into later issues.

   Your contributions will assist me with production costs for printing, and hopefully blossom into something larger such as hiring comic book industry artists to take part in the future construction of more issues of Haven Knights. I have already networked with a few industry artists whom I now consider friends, one of which was Adam Street who actually did the colors for issues 1 and 2, and remains a friend and mentor as I progress through additional Haven Knights comic art.

What We Need & What You Get

   I am asking for people to assist me to get funded for $1500 initially. This amount will most importantly pay for the estimated $700 for printing. Additional expenses are all estimated but will include $50 promotional art prints, $50 for 11X17 comic art boards to product the artwork which will also be available as original art later, $150 for art supplies most of which is for art inking pens, $200 for shipping of rewards (Estimated from the last 2 projects run from Kickstarter), and lastly approximately $350 for custom commission artwork from industry artists to help provide the book a little kick of comic credibility. If the project does not get fully funded or achieves over-funding which I have witnessed from some projects, the funds will still be applied toward the printing costs and hiring industry professionals for future issue work. I will not be making a profit on this book.

The Impact

   The most important impact your contributions will make is that this issue and hopefully future issues will not take 6 months to a year just to produce. The first issue took nearly 15 years to fully complete and ready it for production, issue 2 was right behind it and took almost 11 months to complete, and I have now been working on issue 3 for almost 12 months. Funding would allow me the opportunity to really hire a few more people to get this book out faster and more regularly.

Risks & Challenges

   One initial challenge was assembling a comic book from start to finish which I had no idea how to do until I tackled the first project. I have since acquired a degree in project management including several courses that were comic book specific which enabled me to adjust for planning.

   There aren't too many risks involved in this project, my main goal from the beginning was to ensure that the hobby paid for itself. I made a vow that I would not get in over my head by purchasing supplies or services unless the funds were available. If there is no funding there is no comic book. I would hate to see the latter happen, I really do have mass amounts of content to unload unto the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

   The biggest problem with past projects has been social media. If you cannot contribute monetarily that is okay, what I would ask for at a minimum is that you log on to your Facebook account since I am sure we all possess one and give my page The Tenth World Comics a "Like", share the page with your friends and family too. I will make regular posts on my page there since past reports have shown that Facebook provided the most contact and contribution sources. If you share those posts with your friends and family my product could potentially reach more people.

story:
Hello and thank you ever so much for stopping by to check out this campaign. My name is Heather Scott and I am the owner of Dragonmun Studios - a small group of artists that enjoy producing comics for everyone's entertainment.

Blink is a graphic novel about Matt, a boy with peculiar powers that wind up trapping him in a comic created by his jealous girlfriend, Amanda. With the help of Julia - a girl with similar powers - he must fight his way back to the real world. This also poses some very unique challenges for my group. 




When I first envision Matt's adventure, it was like a fantastic dream where I got to explore the fantastic visions of my favorite artists. I knew immediately that in order for this story to be told correctly, that I would have hire additional illustrators to work on this project since is more than my regular crew could handle.

Being a comic artist myself, I knew that I couldn't ask other artists to work on this for free. I also knew that the promise to pay based on the comic royalties would not put food on the table or pay the bills. Because of this I reached out to a great many people and found 11 other wonderful artists who were willing to volunteer their time and effort for a rate lower than what they honestly should be compensated for - all because they believe in the story.

I can't even begin to express how grateful I am to have them working on this graphic novel, but I can offer a little bit right here. Thank You Frances Nash, Sarah Bryant, Steve Bennett III, April Burns, Stephanie Chateau, Hannah Cruz, Elizabeth Doyle, Russell Reynolds, Miriam & Dee Jay Smith, and Katrina Trotta for heping me with this!


Because Dragonmun Studios started off as a collection of individuals that produced comics as a hobby and helped each other out in terms of resources, a massive collaborative effort like this is way outside of our normal business model. Making sure that the artists are paid is a huge challenge as the funds for our existing comics go into funding those very same comics. Anything extra would require that we either take on additional employment or ask for help - as we are doing.

The amount we are requesting is strictly to compensate the artists for their time and effort. This does not include the production costs, but I am hoping to pitch this story to some comic publishers to help ease that burden. If that fails, I do have a small budget set aside to publish this through my normal means.

However, despite the fact that I am floating some of the costs myself, this unique comic project will go nowhere if the artist aren't paid.

I mentioned above that the artists had volunteered to work at a low rate because they are as excited about this story as I am. That rate is a measly $20 per page (or a little less than $3/hr if they work fast). As this graphic novel is 200 pages long, that means we need $4,000 to complete this project. If we do not reach this goal, then the money contributed is still going to go to the artists so that it can at least be started and perhaps released in single-issue form (not as fun for the reader).

Because we are all about thanking people, everyone that contributes will be mentioned on a special thanks page up on the website and will have access to a digital wallpaper featuring the submissions from the poster project mentioned below (other perks are listed over there on the right!).




Spread The Word!

It may sound cliche, but one of the best ways that you can help us to reach our goal is to spread the word! It doesn't make sense to ask a small amount of people for a large amount of money in these economic times. Besides, networking is fun!


 The Poster Project

The poster project for Blink is an alternative way for financially impaired artists (like us) to help donate to the fundraising campaign. The goal is to create an Andy Warhol-ish poster featuring as many variations of the same image as possible. This poster will then be posted for sale through a print-on-demand service to serve as another means to raise funds a bit later on.


It's a pretty lenient project overall as the only things that need to stay the same are the branding graphics and the pose. The rest is left up to the artist (who is in the pose, the demeanor of the pose, etc.)


Poster submissions and information on this can be found at http://theressomethinginyoureye.com.

story:
Short Summary

Maybe you wonder why inmates need help learning to write complaints (grievances).  With an average reading level of 5th grade and lots of misinformation, inmates rarely write a grievance that succeeds.  They need our help.

I've written college texts, legal writing columns, and a prison-conditions blog.  Review me at legalwritersink.com  and prisongrievances.com.  I've spent 10 years creating this graphic novel

  • to help the 1 in 100 Americans in our prison system,
  • to help the courts receive credible writs, and
  • to help taxpayers avoid paying for time-consuming, frivolous, or erroneous filings.

Multitudes of prison officials and staff, court personnel, defense and plaintiff attorneys, reading specialists, and academics have reviewed the manuscript.  A professional artist and professional letterer (yep!) worked to make each page both entertaining and educational.  The formerly incarcerated who have reviewed it are ready to send a graphic novel back to their old roomies.

Your donation will touch the lives of thousands of our citizens in prisons, jails, and detention centers.  The graphic novel is only $10--how can you go wrong?

 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to send a copy of this novel into every state and federal prison library.  Your money will pay for

  • your own copy of this useful novel;
  • copies sent directly to state and federal prison libraries. (The U.S. has 128 federal prisons;  Vermont has 7 state prisons, Alaska 14, and Texas appx. 120. Lots of prisons!  These numbers do not include miitary prisons, ICE detention centers, or privately run prisons.)

Perks!!!

We've got them, and we want you to have them! We'll send you and prison libraries the graphic novel;  we'll send you a poster-sized front or back cover (and they are beautiful).  We'll make sure everyone sees your name, or your organization's name, on the prisongrievances blog and prisongrievances facebook page.  Give enough, and I'll travel to your group to discuss prison conditions;  give more, and I'll bring along a court or prison official.

Best-ever perk?  YOU can become a character in the novel.  OK, so maybe you haven't dreamed of being an inmate ... but how about a judge?  bailiff?  defense attorney?  Give big, and you can be a star.  We'll send you a big poster of your panel or page.  Hurry--we'll do this for only 2 people.

The Impact

It is time--way past time--for this information to be published as a graphic novel.

  • Friends and families can learn what rights inmates retain while in prison. They can share that information.
  • State prison systems can hold copies in prison libraries.
  • Prison system officials can use the novel as an educational tool during staff orientation.
  • Human rights groups can use the novel during orientations and educational meetings.
  • Educational groups can use the novel within The Walls for reading exercises: we have created the 5th-grade-level dialogue and prison issues specifically for this audience.

Many people have worked to create this edgy approach to inmate education.  I want to count you as a part of that effort.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to pledging dollars, you can help make this project happen:

  • get the word out--facebook!  listserves!   (make some noise about inmate conditions)
  • ask friends if they have someone in prison/jail, and ask them to help sponsor us so the book is available soon
  • talk with your religious leaders about prison ministry and how this graphic novel can help resolve unnecessary suffering
  • attach this graphic novel's fiscal impact to discussions about saving tax dollars (hey, that comes up a lot, right?)
  • make this graphic novel the service project for your frat or sorority or Sunday School group
  • use your Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.  But do hurry so we can send our Big Thank-Yous!

Short Summary
Maybe you wonder why inmates need help learning to write complaints (grievances).  With an average reading level of 5th grade and lots of misinformation, inmates rarely write a grievance that succeeds.  They need our help.
I've written college texts, legal writing columns, and a prison-conditions blog.  Review me at legalwritersink.com  and prisongrievances.com.  I've spent 10 years creating this graphic novel

to help the 1 in 100 Americans in our prison system,
to help the courts receive credible writs, and
to help taxpayers avoid paying for time-consuming, frivolous, or erroneous filings.
Multitudes of prison officials and staff, court personnel, defense and plaintiff attorneys, reading specialists, and academics have reviewed the manuscript.  A professional artist and professional letterer (yep!) worked to make each page both entertaining and educational.  The formerly incarcerated who have reviewed it are ready to send a graphic novel back to their old roomies.
Your donation will touch the lives of thousands of our citizens in prisons, jails, and detention centers.  The graphic novel is only $10--how can you go wrong?
 

What We Need & What You Get
We want to send a copy of this novel into every state and federal prison library.  Your money will pay for

your own copy of this useful novel;
copies sent directly to state and federal prison libraries. (The U.S. has 128 federal prisons;  Vermont has 7 state prisons, Alaska 14, and Texas appx. 120. Lots of prisons!  These numbers do not include miitary prisons, ICE detention centers, or privately run prisons.)


Perks!!!
We've got them, and we want you to have them! We'll send you and prison libraries the graphic novel;  we'll send you a poster-sized front or back cover (and they are beautiful).  We'll make sure everyone sees your name, or your organization's name, on the prisongrievances blog and prisongrievances facebook page.  Give enough, and I'll travel to your group to discuss prison conditions;  give more, and I'll bring along a court or prison official.
Best-ever perk?  YOU can become a character in the novel.  OK, so maybe you haven't dreamed of being an inmate ... but how about a judge?  bailiff?  defense attorney?  Give big, and you can be a star.  We'll send you a big poster of your panel or page.  Hurry--we'll do this for only 2 people.
The Impact


It is time--way past time--for this information to be published as a graphic novel.

Friends and families can learn what rights inmates retain while in prison. They can share that information.
State prison systems can hold copies in prison libraries.
Prison system officials can use the novel as an educational tool during staff orientation.
Human rights groups can use the novel during orientations and educational meetings.
Educational groups can use the novel within The Walls for reading exercises: we have created the 5th-grade-level dialogue and prison issues specifically for this audience.

Many people have worked to create this edgy approach to inmate education.  I want to count you as a part of that effort.


Other Ways You Can Help
In addition to pledging dollars, you can help make this project happen:

get the word out--facebook!  listserves!   (make some noise about inmate conditions)
ask friends if they have someone in prison/jail, and ask them to help sponsor us so the book is available soon
talk with your religious leaders about prison ministry and how this graphic novel can help resolve unnecessary suffering
attach this graphic novel's fiscal impact to discussions about saving tax dollars (hey, that comes up a lot, right?)
make this graphic novel the service project for your frat or sorority or Sunday School group
use your Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is to it.  But do hurry so we can send our Big Thank-Yous!

story:
Colouring Zombie Planet

Do you love zombies? How about when these delicious horrors swarm and feed (on fear and flesh) to be skillfully lopped to dripping bits (splish, splash) by some cool samurai hero? What if this scene were set in contrast to the greatest positive transformation collective consciouness can conceive of and about to go beyond?

I can hardly wait to share it with you!

 

Eyes on the Prize - The Love Warrior About to Hack and Slash



Hi, I'm Lucas S G Fehr

I'm owner and creator at Lucworks. As a freelance illustrator for 6 years, I've made custom Greeting Cards for my clients and community, as well as character designs, backgrounds promotional posters and logos. Greeting cards are comics - at least the ones at Lucworks are.

I love Sci-Fi (being weened on Star Wars), Samurai Legends and Zombies. I LOVE Zombies! I have ever since I was briefly married to a Game Cube and fell totally immersed in Resident Evil one winter.

Though I'm sometimes scared to death by the real challenges that face humanity, I ultimately have faith in life, the spirit of compassion and the appreciation of finding truth that will guide us in our greater understanding of the universe and the big WOW. Call it my confirmation bias, but I have a feeling everything will be okay.

 

A Planet Redeemed - Reeling in Harmony Careeming Through the Universe Toward Collective Bliss

 

Our journey toward the Source is a fascinating mystery of ever growing awe

in Zombie Planet, zombies finally live up to their potential as a catalyst for planetary transformation! Insatiable consumption driven by fear is redeemed through the wheel of fire: a cycle of fear, attack, surender and transcendence.

A sci-fi horror comic is my humble contribution toward the goal of emancipating us from our fear of death. Do that with a comic book, you say? Befriend the wolf at your door and appreciate what you fear - ultimately it's just fantasy. And wolves these days are a bit less popular as scapegoats - so 'befriending the zombie within' will galvanize humanity to meet the challenges that await us. 

What is it with zombies!?

If nothing else, it'll be a grisly sci-fi horror comic that'll suck you in and creep you out!

 

Sewer Scenario - The Love Warrior Approaches in Stealth

 

I'm taking the colouring process to a level rarely realized in comics

I'm lavishing each and every square panel with rich colour and detail. You'll be able skim through the story and enjoy the message or lose yourself in the myriad details; the book will provide multiple re-readings. So much stuff.

<I LOVE STUFF>

Your investment can help me through the last leg of completing this ambitious project which has been in the works for the last 4 years.

Colouring the drawings: adding texture and depth (making it shine with light and pop out of shadow) is very time consuming. Each panel takes between 3 days and two weeks to colour. Volume one is inked and 20% coloured and the whole comic is 2/3 rds finished.

'Almost there. Almost there!'

 

 Story Drawer - Every Object Tells a Story in the Tale of Zombie Planet

 

I can't wait to share it with you!

With a little help I can immerse myself in monastic dedication, working full time to finish colouring volume 1. Zombie Planet will ultimately be a trilogy - but all things in good time....

At a full-time pace, I can share this story with you in a little over 2 years, by December 5, 2014. 

This is a flexible funding project because every contribution brings me closer to my goal: sharing with you a richly detailed horror story about zombies, transformation and transcendence.

I'm sure you will be pleased with the result. Art is our zeitgeist; seeing ourselves accepting our deepest horror and transcending it will have a liberating effect on our collective courage to be real heros in our own lives, for each other. 

 

Zombie Planet Cover - Black and White (awaiting colour!)

 

The reward for me is reader's delight - a living wage is just a means to this end

 

 

I simply want to work on this until it's awesome - keep me warm, keep me in coffee, keep me colouring - and the living dead will live, like never before!

You can give life to this by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word - and any monetary contribution - seeding the cloud with the zombie comic love virus to a tipping point of epidemic proportions.

 

Yours Truly, 

Lucas

story:
Synopsis

NODE is the story of a young girl who is locked inside a large city prison for supernatural/magical creatures. In this futuristic dystopian world, supernatural species have revealed themselves to the world. Instead of being embraced by society, they are locked up in large city prisons segregating them from the rest of the world. In the middle of this, a young girl is accidentally thrown into one of these cities. She is human, but she is the descendant of an ancient line of mystical fighters who use the energy of their zodiac signs for combat. Re-naming herself Node, the first story arc showcases her being hired to track down a loose nightmare in the sewer systems of the city. The nightmare’s power is to hurt people by making them relive their trauma. While she battles him, we see her origins as to how she got to the city.

Full of action, adventure, and amazing art, Node is a comic book for readers  ages of 10 and up. See the trailer for issue 1 above.

Behind the story

Node is my first endeavor as a creator to put out a full issue story arc. It is also the flagship title for my group Horizon Line Comics. Upon its initial conception, Horizon Line Comics was started to provide the type of stories that I felt weren't on the comic book shelves. Comic books have been a part of the pop culture landscape ever since the drawings on the cave, and their unique literature has influenced everything from fashion trends, major motion pictures, music, the creation of role models and mirror images we see in them. It has helped provide an identity to readers hungry for story. It is the goal of Horizon Line Comics to provide those stories for readers everywhere.

The Funds

Every contribution supports the production of this series. Horizon Line Comics wants to create an enjoyable and entertaining experience with a visual impact on storytelling. This also helps struggling artist work towards the completion of an art goal.

I have found highly professional artists and technicians from pencilers, inkers, colorists, and more.  I believe in paying for their talents.  I don’t want all the hard work to stall because of funding issues. Bringing original storytelling and unique art to readers everywhere is my first priority.

Your contribution will help me to showcase not just this title, but lay the ground work for other titles that I would like to build. I want to make Horizon Line Comics a business that creators with unique voices can turn to. The money goes to help fund artists looking to showcase their work plus printing costs, advertising, marketing, supplies, and helping Horizon Line Comics afford conventions and comic related festivals to bring in as many readers as possible.

Please visit the links below for more information.

http://www.facebook.com/HorizonLineComics

http://davidrondinelli.wix.com/horizonlinecomics

If you can't contribute, you can still help. Help spread the word on your websites and social media sites. Remember to use the share tools on Indiegogo.

Thanks for taking the time to look over my campaign.

David Rondinelli
Founder of Horizon Line Comics

story:
The Project

AJALA: Welcome to the C.S.C.  Is a graphic novel told in 4 parts each of the 4 parts is being released separately in Print & digital formats the print edition will contain all 4 parts as well as some great additional "behind the scenes" material due out in January 2013.  It's a stand-alone, self-contained tale of Action and adventure.  It's geared toward teen and adult audiences.

Parts 1 & 2 are finished! With your support we can finish Parts 3 & 4.

 

 

The Story in a Nutshell

Revolves around the coming of age sci-fi Adventures of AJALA STORM a twelve year old junior agent for a C.S.C., a covert group who operate out of franchise of community centers across the United States. The C.S.C. has been safeguarding communities for so long, and the C.S.C. currently finds themselves in new sorts of conflict. For several decades a long struggle has been waged against a group called The Quo who is determined to hold back the evolution of the urban communities through vices, crime and ignorance. AJALA is introduced to the covert world of the C.S.C. when she uncovers her mother’s past and discovers when she was once a junior agent. AJALA is plunged into the C.S.C. as an agent in training that is sent out to ensure community safety. Through her lessons as a junior agent and her everyday life as a normal school student, AJALA will be leading a new life of adventure and discovery, and helping to protect her community from ruin.

 

AJALA is plunged into the C.S.C. as an agent in training that is sent out to ensure community safety. Through her lessons as a junior agent and her everyday life as a normal school student, AJALA will be leading a new life of adventure and discovery, and helping to protect her community from ruin. 

The Team

ROBERT GARRETT:the writer/creator/founder of Xmoor Studios... with several years under my belt as an independent publisher of my own titles which have garnered quite a few good reviews. Taking Xmoor into new realms for our Studio as we build upon our growing name for quality Intellectual Properties that is quickly getting the attention of professionals outside of the graphic publication fields and moving into the Multi-mediamarket.

N STEVEN HARRIS CREATORS:N. Steven Harris is a name that many of you have no doubt heard before, as his credits span over a decade, and he’s worked on some of the biggest characters published by Marvel, DC, and Dark Horse as well as his own Indy comic The Brotherhood of the FRINGE.

Steven will be Penciling the Fourth comic he will also be working with a talented group of artist to thumbnail and layout the third issue, his influence always creating and motivating 

 

The Money

What will we do with the money? 

All money raised will go toward production costs to make AJALA: WELCOME TO THE C.S.C. and to give supporters some cool rewards. But since this book is 100% creator-owned, there's no publisher's financing.  Our Indiegogo goal is enough to bridge the gap and get a copy of the book in the hands of readers in 4 months!  So if you enjoyed our past work, support creator-owned comics, and want to see AJALA: WELCOME TO THE C.S.C.  Become a reality; we have some great rewards for you.

Achieving our $15,000 goal will make a nice dent in the myriad of expenses involved in producing AJALA. This includes covering all of the costs involved in producing and delivering those sweet backer rewards, as well as some of the tools (both physical and digital) that we use in creating the book. If we exceed our goal we are likely to blow the additional money on Cool new rewards to thank all of our supporters and maybe a big dinner so we can reconnect with friends and family we will have to ignore during this campaign.

You can find out more about the project and the creators at:

 http://www.facebook.com/AjalaASeriesOfAdventures

http://nstevenworks.com/2005/

 

We're are also offering the INDIE.GOGO total exclusive 24 page book AJALA The Field Edition With work by N.Steven Harris and a collection of talented artist which will only be available to our backers and only for the limited time of this crowd funding event. This book will have sketches and designs and images revealing some of the warriors, teachers, and leaders of the C.S.C. as well as an black and white 8-page story of AJALA’s Mother ADEL STORM, when she was a C.S.C. Junior Agent.

Junior Agent.

story:
HOW

In September 2012, Kasi Jammeh found out what it was truly like to be a superhero.  Her friend, Sharyl McGrew joined her at the San Francisco Superhero Street fair and they created the characters Hawt Flash & Solara.  Their characters were named: Hawt Flash - because Kasi started going through "the change" (Perimenopause), Solara - to continue with the theme of hotness.  It was an amazing time that was not supposed to end.

From that experience, was born the idea of a webcomic of The Adventures of Hawt Flash & Solara.  Hawt Flash finds that she gets superpowers from her perimenopausal symptoms.  Together, these women figure out Hawt's powers, empower women AND fight crime!


Check out the website here!

 

WHY

There are about 50 million women going through perimenopause right now - a potential major force for positive change.  This comic gives those women something to relate to in a fun way while also thinking about perimenopause in a new way.  The representation of a strong woman who becomes empowered by her symptoms, shows what's possible in real women today. As Kasi goes through the changes, so does Hawt Flash.  This is a real world documentation of "the change" with a very positive twist.

Our Website offers:

  • Ongoing webcomic of The Adventures of Hawt Flash & Solara - the story of a perimenopausal superhero.
  • PMS PSA's - perimenopausal public service announcements about symptoms and remedies.
  • Remedies - A document explaining the possible symptoms with herbal remedies.

WHAT

We are looking for funding to support our webcomic so we can get the word out to as many women (and friends) as possible.  The funds will go towards:

  • Illustrator  
  • Writers 
  • Trademark
  • Copyright
  • Web Designer
  • Domain Name
  • Web Hosting

With the funds, we will create 10 issues of the weekly webcomic.  If we come up short, then the funds will go towards the issues we can afford.

PERKS!

With certain contributions, you get fun items to play with!

  • Images - You can select different images to go on the items.
  • You can get different types of t-shirts.
  • Choose from different photos for your 8 X 10 signed glossy.
  • The action figures are custom made.
  • You could be the first to own a never before seen 30 second action figure video!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, then please get the word out.  Use your social media networks and the Indiegogo share tools!

 

MAHALO NUI LOA!

story:
Bi The Way - A Comic that puts the "Bi" in "Autobiography"

What's "Bi The Way" about?

In my mid/late twenties, I came to the realisation that I was bisexual. This comic aims to tell that story in a way that I hope is enjoyable and relatable. As well as covering my realisation, my coming out (including  a guide of do's and don'ts for any Allies out there), and all that jazz, the book is also about the stuff after that. Stuff like the conversations and reactions I've had with family and co-workers, being a bisexual in a "straight" relationship, and how hard it can be in general to figure out queer feelings in a heteronormative world. Although Bi folk make up a large part of the LGBT population, we don't tend to get a lot of acknowledgment (It can be hard to name even one character from TV who uses the word "bisexual" to describe themselves), or space to discuss our experiences. So I'm putting my story out there. Hopefully that's helpful to someone, even in a small way.

Bi The Way is a personal story, but it's one that I aim to make accessible and enjoyable to folk of all genders and orientations. Maybe you'll get a new perspective on something, or relate to it from your own experiences. Hopefully it will also make you laugh!

What Will It Look Like?

Bi The Way will be 52 pages long and perfect bound, with dimensions  of 240x157mm. The covers will be in colour, with the interior in greyscale.

In fact, if you want a sneak peek at the book, you can read a 6 page preview here. Enjoy!

 

 

Who are you, anyway?

I'm MJ, a comic book artist & illustrator from Glasgow, Scotland. I make comics about lots of stuff, such as my life, cool animals, ghosts and much more!

My work has appeared in publications such as BBC's The Social, The Skinny, Hens Tae Watch Oot Fur and TGC (Scotland's all-female comics anthology). I also make the webcomic Rollerskates & Breakfast Dates, and self-publish my own books. 

Contact Info

My Artist FB

Rollerskates & Breakfast Dates - The Webcomic!

@TheMysteriousMJ

Reviews for the "Rollerskates & Breakfast Dates" Book:

"...an effective palette cleanser from the doom and gloom." - GeekSyndicate

"heartwarming and hilarious" - Nancy Joyce, Whatcha Reading

Why are you crowdfunding this?

In the past, I've printed my books using money out of my own pocket. While that's great (and I've never had a book not make back its print costs), it does limit me regarding the quality and size of print run I can afford.

Bi the Way is going to be printed at a higher quality than my previous books (Hello perfect binding and non-A5 page size!), and I want to do a larger print run than I have in the past. The money I raise here will all go into printing costs, so I can afford to get the book printed in the quality and amount I think it merits.

I've chosen to go with a flexible-funded campaign so that even if the full amount doesn't get reached, I can still get a smaller print run produced. However! Reached £800 or more will mean I can get the print run I think the comic deserves and keep the print cost per issue at a place where I can still make money back from sales, so please do contribute if you are able too. Even just a few pounds makes a big difference to me.

Once the book is printed, I will be selling it at conventions and also make it available for purchase online.

Potential Risks?

The lineart is all done, the colouring is almost finished, and I've started lettering. This book is definitely going to be made! Delays can always happen, but I'm confident that I will have it back from the printers in time for July 2017. I'll be debuting it at Glasgow Comic Con on the 1st of July, so if you'll be nearby feel free to come say hello and pick up a copy!

How you can help

Even if you can't donate, just sharing this campaign and get the word out is super helpful! Indiegogo has a bunch of tools to help you share it around and spread the word, so if you can, please give this campaign a shout out. Thank you for your support!

story:
Oh yeah, it's BLOODHONEY-SUCKING good fun!

 

I'm so excited about this!  This is the first of many cool limited edition CYBERFROG products that I'd like to offer you! 

THESE ARE HIGHLY LIMITED COLLECTIBLES.

You will receive a copy of the 20 page DYNAMITE COMICS VAMPIRELLA vs. RE-ANIMATOR #1, written by Cullen Bunn and drawn by Blacky Shepherd, with an EXCLUSIVE NEW COVER by ME:

Ethan Van Sciver.  

I've worked for 26 years for Hall of Heroes, Harris Comics, Marvel Comics, and most notably for DC Comics, creating the Emotional Spectrum for GREEN LANTERN, as well as important books like FLASH REBIRTH and SINESTRO CORPS WAR.

Now I'm working independently, creating massively anticipated new titles like REIGNBOW BRUTE and yes, CYBERFROG.  

So have you read VAMPIRELLA before?

VAMPIRELLA, created in 1969, is one of the biggest names in horror comics!   Vampirella  was originally presented as an inhabitant of the planet Drakulon, a world where a vampiric race lived on blood and where blood flowed in rivers. Drakulon orbits twin suns that were causing droughts across the planet, marking certain doom for Vampirella and her race. The race of which Vampirella was born, the Vampiri, were able to transform themselves into bats at will, possessed superhuman physical attributes, sprout wings when required to fly, and drink blood.

During the BAD GIRL craze of the 1990's, she was one of the most popular and best selling characters, and I was there for it all!

SO LET'S GO!

This is the first issue, the first time CYBERFROG and SALAMANDROID have ever been seen with a mainstream comic book character!  If this is a success, I'll do more!

These books are ready to print!  LET'S GET THIS FROG JUMPING!

story:
Hi,

 I am Michael Hopkins, creative writer of Jack Rider. I'm working with artist, Nate Getz, the man who brought the comic to life. Both of us have been long-time comic fans and collectors. Nate works with GCP Comics on several different projects. I am a toy and comic reviewer for the website Kastor's Korner. As you can see, both of us love this business and our goal is to deliver a great comic that everyone will want to read.

 What we are trying to accomplish is twofold. As I am writing this, my wife is laying in the hospital with terminal brain cancer called Glioblastoma. It is a rare and deadly type of cancer that is very aggressive. Her given timeline is 3 to 4 months. First, I want to fund this comic so she can see it succeed. She has always been my biggest fan and knows I am passionate about writing and this comic. So, I want to dedicate it to her and show her that we made it happen. Secondly, since this has opened my eyes, I want to donate two dollars per package sold to cancer research. Everyone seems to focus on breast cancer awareness while other types of cancer need to be brought to light. I want to see them find a cure for cancer and be able to study all types. Having been at the hospital, I can tell you there are a lot more brain cancer patients than I realized, but we hardly hear about those cases.

 We need to raise $4,000 to have our comic printed and distributed to stores located throughout Maryland, one in Mississippi, and a few others in the U.S. Being in many Facebook groups that are into collectibles and comics, I have met a lot of good people that are willing to support Jack Rider. Anything raised beyond the $4,000 will also go to cancer research.

 Jack Rider is a Sci-Fi and Horror hybrid with steam punk elements that takes place in the old west. It's got necromancing, shapeshifting, and Vampires who don't drink blood, but drain the life force from their victims. The first 3 issues take place during the 1800's. The story ends on another planet that is ruled by four brothers, all whom are vampires, and it continues from there. 

 If you cannot contribute funds, you can help us by spreading the word. Understand, this is not only to fund our book, but to help cancer research as well. You can also reach us at  http://crowdfundingforum.com/showthread.php/987... and chat with myself if you have any questions.

story:
The quick of it...

Through the success of our previous campaign, we were able to raise enough capital to move to our new location inside the Austin Toy Museum. But there's so much more we can do. We want Hops & Heroes to become a name everyone knows they can trust. Whether we're YOUR go to comicbook shop, or the neighborhood's champion for LGBT, Female, and POC (both behind and within the panels of comics), we want to be your home. And it doesn't stop there. We also want to continue to expand our Non-profit Foundation and the programs it provides, and for that we need your help! 

 

Avengers Assemble...

It's no secret superheroes can't save the world alone, which is why epic team ups are created regularly in every comics universe. By donating to Hops & Heroes, you become part of a team of mini lion bots helping us to become a mega bot that can really make a difference. We've set our goal at $2,000 because that will be the first step we need to take to impact change in our environment. With that money, we'll lay the groundwork of a bright future not just for Hops & Heroes, but for the East Austin community and for the beneficiaries of our Comics for College scholarship program.  

 

Become a Guardian of our Galaxy...

Funding our campaign allows us to bring an incredibly unique experience to a changing demographic, as well as a stagnate market that is in desperate need of new ideas. Our dream is to make Hops & Heroes Comics a central part of East Austin through our charitable acts, focus on community, and determination to provide the highest standard of service and knowledge to our customers.  That's you! And when you donate, you become a part of that alliance, someone who stands up to make a difference through the power of epic dance offs. 

 

It's Dangerous To Go Alone, Take This...

It's actually not! Donating to Hops & Heroes is beneficial to everyone! When you make a donation you are helping to create success in our programs like Comics for College, Comics for Kids, etc. But these donations also help us to grow physically, which means more titles, more backstock and more events that you'll love. And it's all thanks to your charitable donation!

 

But last I checked I'm not Bruce Wayne...

That's okay, most of us aren't. But just because you can't donate to our campaign doesn't mean you can't help. There's a lot of things you can do. Share this campaign on your social media. Tell your friends about our store and our causes. Consider stopping by the store during one of our Super Power Happy Hour events and bring a friend, or just stop by and pick up a comic. Regardless of how you do it, your support helps us with our charitable pursuits.
