story:
Καλώς ήρθατε στην καμπάνια μας!

Σε μια εποχή όπου όλα μοιάζουν να γυρίζουν γύρω από τις μεγαλουπόλεις και την κουλτούρα τους, ο Αποστόλης Ιωάννου εμπνέεται από την ανεπιτήδευτη αγάπη του για την ελληνική ύπαιθρο και παράδοση, δημιουργώντας ένα graphic novel-φόρο τιμής στην παραμυθένια διάσταση μιας πραγματικότητας που χάθηκε.


ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ είναι ένα graphic novel 80 ασπρόμαυρων σελίδων που διηγείται μια απλή, όσο και όμορφη ιστορία: Οι σχέσεις των νέων γενεών με τις παλαιότερες, μέσω εικόνων που αποτυπώνουν την ελληνική ηπειρωτική φύση, την αρχιτεκτονική των χωριών της, τις αγροτικές και κτηνοτροφικές εργασίες, τα πανηγύρια, τα παιδικά παιχνίδια, και –εν γένει- την ανεμελιά μιας ζωής με πιο αργούς, πιο «ανθρώπινους» ρυθμούς. Μιας εποχής που πέρασε.


«Αυτά που θέλω να πω, τα λέω μέσω των εικόνων και μέσω των χαρακτήρων και όχι μέσω του σεναρίου. Το σενάριο είναι δευτερεύον, απλά μια αφορμή, ένα "απαλό" και διακριτικό backround»

Αποτέλεσμα όχι μόνο της αγάπης του δημιουργού του, αλλά και της εντατικής έρευνας που προηγήθηκε σε θέματα λαογραφικού και φυσικού ενδιαφέροντος, ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ είναι μια δουλειά που ζητά την πολύτιμη βοήθειά σας για να ολοκληρωθεί και να τυπωθεί.

Ο δημιουργός

Ο Αποστόλης Ιωάννου γεννήθηκε στα Τρίκαλα, όπου και διαμένει. Εικονογράφος και δημιουργός comics, έχει επίσης στο ενεργητικό του εικονογραφήσεις για παιδικά και εκπαιδευτικά βιβλία, αφίσες συναυλιών και εξώφυλλα δίσκων. Comics του έχουν δημοσιευτεί σε ελληνικά fanzines (ΕVOL 2, FART 2), ενώ τo 2013, κυκλοφόρησε το πρώτο μεγάλο, ολοκληρωμένο comic του, ΒΑΘΥ ΔΑΣΟΣ (Comicdom Press). Το 2014 κυκλοφόρησε την ιστορία ΤΑ ΜΑΓΙΚΑ ΒΕΛΑΝΙΔΙΑ και το πρώτο τεύχος του comic TO ΡΟΜΠΟΤ ΚΑΙ ΤΟ ΚΟΡΙΤΣΙ. Ένα τρισέλιδο δείγμα από την επερχόμενη δουλειά του, ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, φιλοξενήθηκε στην έκθεση comics και εικονογράφησης, Εν Αιθρία 5, στην Αθήνα, τη Θεσσαλονίκη και την Ίσπρα της Ιταλίας, ενώ με δείγματα του ίδιου project εκπροσώπησε την Ελλάδα στο 4ο Σαλόνι Κόμικς (Salonul European De Banda Desenata) που πραγματοποιήθηκε στο Εθνικό Μουσείο Σύγχρονης Τέχνης του Βουκουρεστίου.


Εικονογραφήσεις και comics του Αποστόλη, μπορείτε να δείτε στο http://blackbirdzoo.blogspot.gr/

Τι χρειαζόμαστε και τι προσφέρουμε:

Προκειμένου να καλυφθούν οι δημιουργικές και εκτυπωτικές ανάγκες του graphic novel, ανοίξαμε στις 5/12/2014, καμπάνια χρηματοδότησης, η οποία θα διαρκέσει μέχρι και τις 3/2/2015.

Ζητάμε τη βοήθειά σας ώστε ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ να μην γίνει μια ακόμη όμορφη δουλειά που θα μείνει στο συρτάρι, και για να σας δώσουμε το κίνητρο να γίνετε κι εσείς κομμάτι αυτής της προσπάθειας, συντελώντας ουσιαστικά στην πραγματοποίησή του, ο Αποστόλης ετοίμασε μια σειρά από όμορφα ανταλλάγματα. (δείτε στην κάθετη στήλη δεξιά, πώς αυτά συνδυάζονται σε πακέτα και διαλέξτε αυτό που σας ταιριάζει!)

----- ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, το graphic novel
Μια καλαίσθητη έκδοση 80 σελίδων, σε μέγεθος 17x24 cm, με έγχρωμο εξώφυλλο και ασπρόμαυρο περιεχόμενο. To αντίτυπο που θα παραλάβετε θα είναι υπογεγραμμένο, με ονομαστική αφιέρωση και ένα σχέδιο της προτίμησής σας. Το «αντάλλαγμα’» αυτό, όπως και όλα τα άλλα, θα σας σταλούν αρκετές ημέρες πριν την επίσημη κυκλοφορία του στα τέλη Απριλίου.

----- ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, το e-book
Το graphic novel στην ψηφιακή του μορφή.

----- ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, το sketchbook
Μέσα από μοναδικά σκίτσα και μελέτες χαρακτήρων και τοποθεσιών, σας αποκαλύπτεται η διαδικασία δημιουργίας του έργου, σε ένα όμορφο 16σέλιδο sketchbook, διαστάσεων 14,5 x 21 cm.

----- Wallpapers/ Φόντα Οθόνης
2 διαφορετικά φόντα για οθόνες θα είναι διαθέσιμα για σας. (σύντομα κοντά σας και το δεύτερο wallpaper)


----- Σελιδοδείκτες
5 διαφορετικοί, έγχρωμοι σελιδοδείκτες σχεδιάστηκαν και σας περιμένουν!


----- Αrt Prints/Καλλιτεχνικές Εκτυπώσεις
4 εικονογραφήσεις εμπνευσμένες από το graphic novel, σε εκτυπώσεις υψηλής ποιότητας (χαρτί 300gr - 33x48cm)


----- Κουτί με κάρτες
Ένα κουτί με 10 έγχρωμες κάρτες (17,5×12,5cm) με σκηνές από το graphic novel.


----- Αυθεντικές σελίδες

6 από τις πιο όμορφες αυθεντικές σελίδες της έκδοσης, στο μέγεθος που σχεδιάστηκαν (Α2, 43 x 60 cm), για να διαλέξετε.

----- Ανάθεση σχεδίου
Διαλέξτε έναν χαρακτήρα από το graphicnovel, και ζητήστε από τον δημιουργό να σας το σχεδιάσει ασπρόμαυρο ή έγχρωμο, σε ένα μοναδικό σκίτσο, στην πρώτη σελίδα της έκδοσης ή σε ειδικό χαρτί.


----- Άλλα comics του Αποστόλη
Αποκτήστε όλες τις μέχρι τώρα εκδόσεις του δημιουργού (ΒΑΘΥ ΔΑΣΟΣ, ΤΟ ΡΟΜΠΟΤ ΚΑΙ ΤΟ ΚΟΡΙΤΣΙ, ΜΑΓΙΚΑ ΒΕΛΑΝΙΔΙΑ) σε ένα πλούσιο πακέτο για τους πραγματικούς φίλους των comics και της εικονογράφησης!



Άλλοι τρόποι να υποστηρίξετε το ΧΩΡΙΟ

Αν δεν έχετε τη δυνατότητα να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά, υπάρχουν κι άλλοι τρόποι να μας βοηθήσετε να πετύχουμε το στόχο μας:

  • Προσθέστε την καμπάνια μας στις favourites του Indiegogo και αφήστε κάποιο comment.
  • Χρησιμοποιήστε τα εργαλεία κοινωνικής δικτύωσης του Indiegogo
  • Διαδώστε την καμπάνια μας σε ανθρώπους που πιστεύετε ότι θα τους ενδιέφερε να μάθουν για αυτήν.
  • Γράψτε ένα καλό λόγο στην ιστοσελίδα ή το blog σας (και μην παραλείψετε το link που θα οδηγήσει εδώ τους ενδιαφερόμενους)
Σας ευχαριστούμε από καρδιάς!
story_txt:
Καλώς ήρθατε
στην καμπάνια μας!
Σε μια εποχή
όπου όλα μοιάζουν να γυρίζουν γύρω από τις μεγαλουπόλεις και την κουλτούρα
τους, ο Αποστόλης Ιωάννου εμπνέεται από την ανεπιτήδευτη αγάπη του για την
ελληνική ύπαιθρο και παράδοση, δημιουργώντας ένα graphic novel-φόρο τιμής στην παραμυθένια διάσταση
μιας πραγματικότητας που χάθηκε. 
ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ
είναι ένα graphic novel 80 ασπρόμαυρων σελίδων που διηγείται μια απλή, όσο και
όμορφη ιστορία: Οι σχέσεις των νέων γενεών με τις παλαιότερες, μέσω εικόνων που αποτυπώνουν την ελληνική ηπειρωτική
φύση, την αρχιτεκτονική των χωριών της, τις αγροτικές και κτηνοτροφικές
εργασίες, τα πανηγύρια, τα παιδικά παιχνίδια, και –εν γένει- την ανεμελιά μιας
ζωής με πιο αργούς, πιο «ανθρώπινους» ρυθμούς. Μιας εποχής που πέρασε.«Αυτά που θέλω να πω, τα λέω μέσω
των εικόνων και μέσω των χαρακτήρων και όχι μέσω του σεναρίου. Το σενάριο είναι
δευτερεύον, απλά μια αφορμή, ένα "απαλό" και διακριτικό backround»

Αποτέλεσμα όχι μόνο της αγάπης του
δημιουργού του, αλλά και της εντατικής έρευνας που προηγήθηκε σε θέματα
λαογραφικού και φυσικού ενδιαφέροντος, ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ είναι μια δουλειά που ζητά την
πολύτιμη βοήθειά σας για να ολοκληρωθεί και να τυπωθεί.
Ο δημιουργός
Ο Αποστόλης Ιωάννου γεννήθηκε στα Τρίκαλα,
όπου και διαμένει. Εικονογράφος και δημιουργός comics, έχει επίσης στο
ενεργητικό του εικονογραφήσεις για παιδικά και εκπαιδευτικά βιβλία, αφίσες
συναυλιών και εξώφυλλα δίσκων. Comics του έχουν
δημοσιευτεί σε ελληνικά fanzines (ΕVOL 2, FART 2), ενώ τo 2013, κυκλοφόρησε το
πρώτο μεγάλο, ολοκληρωμένο comic
του, ΒΑΘΥ ΔΑΣΟΣ (Comicdom Press). Το 2014 κυκλοφόρησε την ιστορία ΤΑ ΜΑΓΙΚΑ
ΒΕΛΑΝΙΔΙΑ και το πρώτο τεύχος του comic TO ΡΟΜΠΟΤ ΚΑΙ ΤΟ ΚΟΡΙΤΣΙ. Ένα τρισέλιδο
δείγμα από την επερχόμενη δουλειά του, ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, φιλοξενήθηκε στην έκθεση comics
και εικονογράφησης, Εν Αιθρία 5, στην Αθήνα, τη Θεσσαλονίκη και την Ίσπρα της
Ιταλίας, ενώ με δείγματα του ίδιου project
εκπροσώπησε την Ελλάδα στο 4ο Σαλόνι Κόμικς (Salonul
European De Banda Desenata) που πραγματοποιήθηκε στο Εθνικό Μουσείο Σύγχρονης
Τέχνης του Βουκουρεστίου.
Εικονογραφήσεις και comics του
Αποστόλη, μπορείτε να δείτε στο http://blackbirdzoo.blogspot.gr/
Τι χρειαζόμαστε και τι προσφέρουμε:
Προκειμένου
να καλυφθούν οι δημιουργικές και εκτυπωτικές ανάγκες του graphic novel,
ανοίξαμε στις 5/12/2014, καμπάνια χρηματοδότησης, η οποία θα διαρκέσει μέχρι
και τις 3/2/2015. 
Ζητάμε τη
βοήθειά σας ώστε ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ να μην γίνει μια ακόμη όμορφη δουλειά που θα μείνει
στο συρτάρι, και για να σας δώσουμε το κίνητρο να γίνετε κι εσείς κομμάτι αυτής
της προσπάθειας, συντελώντας ουσιαστικά στην πραγματοποίησή του, ο Αποστόλης
ετοίμασε μια σειρά από όμορφα ανταλλάγματα. (δείτε στην κάθετη στήλη δεξιά, πώς
αυτά συνδυάζονται σε πακέτα και διαλέξτε αυτό που σας ταιριάζει!)
----- ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, το graphic novelΜια καλαίσθητη έκδοση 80 σελίδων, σε
μέγεθος 17x24 cm, με έγχρωμο εξώφυλλο και ασπρόμαυρο περιεχόμενο. To αντίτυπο που θα
παραλάβετε θα είναι υπογεγραμμένο, με ονομαστική αφιέρωση και ένα σχέδιο της
προτίμησής σας. Το «αντάλλαγμα’» αυτό, όπως και όλα τα άλλα, θα σας σταλούν αρκετές
ημέρες πριν την επίσημη κυκλοφορία του στα τέλη Απριλίου.----- ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, το e-book Το graphic novel στην ψηφιακή του μορφή. 
----- ΤΟ ΧΩΡΙΟ, το sketchbookΜέσα από
μοναδικά σκίτσα και μελέτες χαρακτήρων και τοποθεσιών, σας αποκαλύπτεται η
διαδικασία δημιουργίας του έργου, σε ένα όμορφο 16σέλιδο sketchbook, διαστάσεων 14,5 x 21 cm. ----- Wallpapers/ Φόντα Οθόνης 2
διαφορετικά φόντα για οθόνες θα είναι διαθέσιμα για σας. (σύντομα κοντά σας και το δεύτερο wallpaper)
----- Σελιδοδείκτες 5 διαφορετικοί, έγχρωμοι
σελιδοδείκτες σχεδιάστηκαν και σας περιμένουν!
----- Αrt Prints/Καλλιτεχνικές Εκτυπώσεις 4 εικονογραφήσεις εμπνευσμένες από το graphic novel, σε εκτυπώσεις υψηλής ποιότητας
(χαρτί 300gr - 33x48cm)
----- Κουτί με κάρτεςΈνα κουτί με 10 έγχρωμες κάρτες (17,5×12,5cm)
με σκηνές από το graphic novel.----- Αυθεντικές σελίδες6 από τις πιο όμορφες αυθεντικές
σελίδες της έκδοσης, στο μέγεθος που σχεδιάστηκαν (Α2, 43 x 60 cm), για να διαλέξετε.
----- Ανάθεση σχεδίουΔιαλέξτε έναν χαρακτήρα από το graphicnovel, και ζητήστε από τον δημιουργό να
σας το σχεδιάσει ασπρόμαυρο ή έγχρωμο, σε ένα μοναδικό σκίτσο, στην πρώτη
σελίδα της έκδοσης ή σε ειδικό χαρτί.


----- Άλλα comics του ΑποστόληΑποκτήστε όλες τις μέχρι τώρα
εκδόσεις του δημιουργού (ΒΑΘΥ ΔΑΣΟΣ, ΤΟ ΡΟΜΠΟΤ ΚΑΙ ΤΟ ΚΟΡΙΤΣΙ, ΜΑΓΙΚΑ
ΒΕΛΑΝΙΔΙΑ) σε ένα πλούσιο πακέτο για τους πραγματικούς φίλους των comics και της εικονογράφησης! 

 Άλλοι τρόποι να υποστηρίξετε το ΧΩΡΙΟ
 
Αν δεν έχετε τη δυνατότητα να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά, υπάρχουν κι άλλοι τρόποι να μας βοηθήσετε να πετύχουμε το στόχο μας:
Προσθέστε την καμπάνια μας στις favourites του Indiegogo και αφήστε κάποιο comment. 

Χρησιμοποιήστε τα εργαλεία κοινωνικής δικτύωσης του Indiegogo
Διαδώστε την καμπάνια μας σε ανθρώπους που πιστεύετε ότι θα τους ενδιέφερε να μάθουν για αυτήν.
Γράψτε ένα καλό λόγο στην ιστοσελίδα ή το blog σας (και μην παραλείψετε το link που θα οδηγήσει εδώ τους ενδιαφερόμενους) 

Σας ευχαριστούμε από καρδιάς!

story:
Video created by Nandor Kiraly

BACK OUR NEWEST ADVENTURE!

Hi there, if you're looking to back Snippy's Dead Zone Tour Guide book, you've come to the wrong place, but don't worry, we've got you covered. Either click on the image above or go to http://igg.me/at/snippy and find out how you can help, and what you can get in return!

Below is the content from the 2012 campaign.

FULFILMENT UPDATE 1

By now you should have received your PDF copies of books one and two to the email address you provided when you contributed. If you don't see it you may have to look in your spam folder. Happy reading!

42.5K+ ...AND ONE MORE THING:

With just 4 days of campaigning to go, Captein has teamed up with the GOOD Directorate to bring you happiness in the form of your face in the RA world. Whether you're one of the few companies left in the modern-day multinational conglomerate world of corporate domination, or just a tourist wishing to see your face in zee limelight, Captein and the GOOD Directorate are sure you'll find this offer too GOOD to refuse:

Just choose the DIRECTORATE TOURIST perk to activate this offer and send images of you or your company for inclusion! Click image for full res.

$30,000 DONE, NOW $50,000?

Since we're still on a roll and you're continuing to show your (much appreciated) support, we're delighted to announce two extra things we can do if we get to $50K:

By popular request: Kittyhawk Plush toys! We can make them!

We can improve our studio green-screen and photoshoot setup for better, more rapid comic creation!

New to this and not sure what's going on? Read more here...

OVER $30,000!

Juicy thanks from Captein and his crew for helping us beat 30K! Now we can do everything we said we could do, including a proper video shoot and a better album besides the huge new print run!

Helping us celebrate are a bunch of Annet Drones created by Cartagia and "Charles":

CONTEST - SHARE ZEE CAMPAIGN!

Click image for full-res detail:

OVER $10,000 celebrations!

We the RA team have a confession to make.

We never, in our wildest dreams, anticipated we'd get such a positive and speedy response from you, our community. We're so overwhelmed with the support and trust you've shown us that we have to admit we were wrong to set our ambitions so low. What we have heard from this weekend's manic pledge-fest (apart from that you're ravenous for cosplay outfits :D) is that you want us to do something really significant, you're ready for us to do it now, and you expect to come along for the ride!

[Captein's Facebook post above received 476 Likes and 24 delightful comments in just two hours]

So, thank you for those messages, and for all your generous pledges so far. We're ready to take this much further with your continued help...

Produce the live-action series.

We guess it's plain why spending this much on the live-action will be beneficial to everyone, but here are some things we can do with the money:

  • Hire a top class camera, lenses, lighting and a DOP
  • Pay for travel expenses, food and crew on location
  • Colouring and visual effects, no compromise!

We can film a full episode and make a small number of promo and music videos to go with it, which, of course, Contributors will have VIP access to. Plus, we'll be able to document the adventure in video, photos and a diary along the way. If we get more than 30K, you can bet we'll be filming more episodes!

New Books. The current generation of books is heavy, expensive even in bulk because of the image quality we demand, and costs a whole bunch to ship, but with this money we will finally have the clout to source high quality yet light books that will simultaneously save us huge amounts of wasted cost and lower the purchase price significantly for every fan. We will work with printing houses to deliver a product that at least lives up to the print and binding quality of the current generation, or even exceeds it, before making any commitments. Guarranteed.

Awesome music. Behind the scenes we've been talking about and experimenting for a while on a companion soundtrack for RA. David H, Alexius and I have toyed with the idea of pairing the visuals with a sound-scape that seamlessly adds depth to, and progresses with, the main comic. This album is our first step on the road to realising that concept and because of that we had planned the whole thing out on a minute shoe-string budget. Five thousand dollars changes everything because it means we are free to hire performers to play and sing for us, spend more time creating, mixing and recording the work, and have the final product mastered by a professional, helping us truly achieve our vision and make this album the best it can be.

Besides all this we will continue to sweeten the deal with more bite-size mini-perks at various milestones on the way.*

You can help us reach this most exciting of destinations by upgrading your perk or by getting your friends, colleagues and families involved through Facebook, Twitter and deviantArt, among other places. We'll be doing our best to broaden our reach too and if we all pull together, we'll get there!

Respect and gratitude, Oggy and the team. @theOggyb

WHAT BE THIS NONSENSE?

Just over a year ago we launched the first physical volume of Romantically Apocalyptic. It was self-published in Toronto and shipped out on an ad-hoc basis. Back then, we had a few thousand followers on Facebook and 800 thousand page views per month to the website. Now those numbers have gone up to 60 thousand, and four million, yet the physical books are still sent the same way: a few at a time, and with a frustrating wait if you happen not to live on the American continent!

Now, if you're a starving artist (and, needless to say, our little team consists mostly of starving artists...) you end up spreading yourself too thin, trying to meet demand with regular low-scale print runs while working your socks off to fulfil your boundless artistic ambition. This is where we are, and that's why we need your help.

We're asking for ten thousand dollars. With this we want to do a large scale print run of not only the original volume, but also volume two, which we have started selling at select comicons. Both are around 100 pages and contain significantly more content than that shown on the website alone. In addition, we have a live action series at the pre-production stage, which we want to kick into a higher gear, and, due to popular demand, we want to release an RA-inspired companion music album.

WHAT DO I, AS A MINION, GET IN RETURN?

If we reach our goal of ten thousand, we will have enough to do all of these things and send glorious trinklets of swag in return. If we didn't reach our goal, we'd have to compromise too much so this is an all-or-nothing adventure!

There's a perk for everyone. For those devoted minions with less to spend, we're offering the entire first two volumes as a DRM-free PDF, so you can experience the full content of the books on-screen for your investment, without the extra cost of a physical copy. Further up the chain we're offering individually numbered CDs of the album, prints, greeting cards and even unique, custom artwork on top of the inevitable newly printed comic books.

Don't forget too that if we skyrocket through our initial goal of 10K, we have even more superlative ideas for ways we can give back to you, our community.

ZEE IMPAKT

Your contribution affects Romantically Apocalyptic in several delectable ways:

  • The comic becomes self-sustaining and grows with its audience
  • The RA universe continues to expand into the video and audio realms
  • Eventually the team can travel to further reaches of the globe visiting pre-apocalyptic cities of residence, evangelising the whole world to Capteinism

Furthermore, after helping to bring RA to ever more people, you yourself will have acquired a piece of history: exclusive prints will indeed be exclusive - forever - and individually low-numbered CDs will proclaim to the world that you got there first. Heck, you could even be the proud owner of an original RA oil painting to display on the grandest wall in your house...

And remember, if you pledge over a hundred dollars these books will have your name credited as a prized and esteemed contributor for all to see!

MONEY TREES DO NOT GROW IN MY SURROUNDINGS, BUT I AM A LOYAL MINION. WHAT CAN I DO???

Captein requires that you scout and procure new minions for zee cause. You can do this by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, G+, vkontakte or any other social tomfoolery you partake in, both on- and offline.

Indiegogo have provided a handsome set of sharing functions for you to do just that.

If your social endeavours help us to reach our funding goal, you too will benefit further down the line whether that be through lower prices for merch, a greater presence of Captein in your locality or just through helping a friend get addicted!

New: Use the sharing functions at the top of this page to share our campaign with your friends. The top referrers for new visitors, new contributors and total funds will receive a special thank you prize :) - see this info.

WHAT IF I'VE NEVER HEARD OF ZEE CAPTEIN OR ROMANTICALLY APOCALYPTIC?

No worries! Romantically Apocalyptic is a webcomic begun in 2009 by Vitaly S. Alexius. It's unique because the style is a combination of high-resolution photomanipulation and cinematic digital painting. It contains crafty and dark humour, a tense, dramatic story arc, and a small crew of apocalypse survivors with a complex, interwoven relationship with each other and the end of the world. Being a webcomic, it's totally free to view online at www.rom.ac and if you like it, please consider coming back to support us.

With most excited anticipation, thank you!
The Romantically Apocalyptic Team

Follow @zeecaptein for official updates, and @theOggyb for any RA/Indiegogo-related queries!

story:
Punchers Mark

Before there was Superman, Batman, X-Men or any other super heroes that we are endeared to today, during the 15th through the 19th centuries, the idea of a human being doing incredible feats that defied human capabilities - that level of distinction, was bestowed on bareknuckle fighters. You have to go back to a world where there was no TV, or efficient means to deliver news, and fights were not held in grand stadiums, but rather, in the middle of the woods, with no medical facilities to speak of, or an anesthetic to dress the inevitable wounds suffered during a fight. If you broke your orbital bone, lost an eye, even that, did not meet the threshold to end a fight between the prizefighters!

The concept of actually getting a chance to see, in person, a true prizefight was very foreign to the average commoner. You heard the exaggerated stories third or maybe forth hand and by then you thought you heard the exploits of a super human being. Kids then, instead of wearing capes around their necks to imagine being a super hero, in ghettos across Britain, boys fought their counterparts as Tom Cribb and in the USA, John L Sullivan!

In that vacuum, the exploits of these fighters, were documented in books, oral stories passed down generations, songs and everyone who was in the know, mingled with these fighters, to build what we call today "Street Cred." From politicians, to even kings, could be found passing purses with money to bet on the outcome of one of these epic fights.

DC and Marvel comics describe imaginary feats and powers that humans would never have. These fighters fought till someone got knocked out, either 20 rounds, or on some occasions, going 100 hundred rounds, with food or no food in their bellies, in all kinds of weather. Stripped down to the waist and nothing but ones fists as means to defend. This art form was crafted over generations and many of these fighters exploits lie dormant until now. 

 "Punchers Mark, A 300+ Page Graphic Novel, that honors the History of Bareknuckle Boxing." This labor of love was created by a great friendship between the late Bert Randolph Sugar and Jean Borgella. The graphic novel chronicles the exploits of great bareknuckle fighters of olde. Long forgotten, their contributions to Boxing, MMA and any major spectator sport should not be taken for granted. 

Bert Sugar was a renowned boxing and sport historian. In many of his writings, he recognized the courage and the significance of many of these fighters contributions. Mike Tyson a mutual friend of Bert and Jean jumped at the chance to be part of this project! He sat down to discuss his love for the history of the sport and provided some detailed historical knowledge that will be outlined in the book and with a small pledge a link to the long version of the behinds the scenes interview! 


Founders Jean Borgella and Erica Lee Benedetto

By supporting the creation of this novel, you help connect this current generation not only to these great pioneers, you help me personally fulfill a promise I made to my dear friend Bert, which was to make sure these stories are told and to continue his legacy...

Make a Mark with Punchers Mark!

Development Team

story:
“By Page or by stage, my audience is my greatest Lover.” – Divinity Rose

Comedienne Divinity Rose is the girl of every nerd's dreams. She transforms from geeky single mom to multitalented performer and comes with her own accessories. Divinity's playfully funny observational comedy has made her an audience favorite. The Kentucky native "wild ginger" found herself crushing on comedians from a young age, sneaking to watch SNL and Red Dwarf while babysitting. Divinity began her comedy career in 2002 when she performed on the Lisa Lampinelli Show at Caroline's in New York City, and she's since shared the stage or screen with Nora Dunn, Dinky Gowen and countless others. When she isn't telling jokes or slinging her books at venues around the country, Divinity acts in films and writes for both stage and screen. Divinity has been heard on NPR and seen on the Syfy program "Spooked," which may or may not be part of her master plan to compile the geekiest credits of all time.

Divinity has inspired the hearts and minds of many groups with her continual determination to follow her dreams and the willingness to share her trials and victories in the hopes of encouraging others in doing the same.  For years, people have predicted success for her and wanted to see what she could do with a real budget to work with, so now's their chance. She's floored people with her wit, moving words, energy, and determination for more than a decade producing and performing in over 500 shows, films,  and events providing work to hundreds of other writers and entertainers. After years of healing from traumatic events, she's found the power within to rise into something more. 

FUNDS:

I've worked like mad for a long time and have come to a very exciting time where opportunities are presenting themselves, but I need help in order to take them.  Being a single mom means I can't go full Bohemian and live out of my car while I chase down my dreams and also means there's not a lot of money left over for things like recording or promotions. Being able to record a CD, finish my book, and make the rounds to perform will allow me to have more income to support my son and myself. The complete amount of funds needed to knock out all of my plans is hefty, so I'm breaking it into several cycles. Any excess during a cycle will go towards the next cycle.

Here’s the list of things to pay for/accomplish in Phase 1:

Phase 1: 11 K

This will allow me to:

  • Arrange and rehearse material to move from feature length comedian (20-30 min) to Headline Comedian (40 min -1.5 hours), which means more pay when performing
  • Record CD to sell at shows/online for download
  • Tour Midwest and East Coast - I've already started traveling and am trying to keep up with the invitations to perform best I can.
  • Pull writings together into book.

Completing this phase of fundraising will allow me to  move on to the next steps of acquiring legal representation and PR for the writings/performance. If it looks like we'll exceed the 11g, I'll list the next steps and what they will cost as well!

 

JUST FOR YOU:

I want to create something that gives back to those who support me. Perks start at just $1 (check the right of the page for list of perks), but each contributor of $25 or more (that's less than $3 a month) will be given a log-in to a secret garden community on my web site. As a member of my secret garden, you'll get:

  • Exclusive photos, writings, character sketches
  • Invitations to private invitation-only parties, shows, and events
  • Pieces of my writing dedicated solely to you that you can display on your profile page there.
  • Notices when I need extras, help, etc with my projects
  • Updates on each project as it unfolds and tour diaries

Contributors are invited to be an interactive part of my world and creative process as I will continue to use the garden for all future projects (novels and tv pilots). 

I'll sweeten the deal once a week during this campaign by releasing an extra perk for the first five contributors each week of a certain amount. 

If you donate more than once, we will total your donations and give you the highest perk you are eligible for based on total amount donated.

I'll be throwing down after my fundraising drive with a very interactive and fun redheaded wild rumpus of a show for contributors only! We'll be recording the show for a CD, and you'll be the first to see my new stage show!

Spread the Love! 

 Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help: If you can't contribute, you can help spread the word! We can also let businesses know what kind of "in kind" contributions or sponsorships would help us and also garner them some promotion.

With that in mind, don't forget perks start at just $1, so don't be chicken! Scrounge some change up and then pass the word and ask your friends/families to ""give  a buck if they give a Cluck" (and even if they don't).

 To reach the first $11,000 goal, I would need less than $4.00 from each of my FB friends! The ideal donation is at least $25 so that you can continue to receive gifts from year round!

Use the share tools to hit your social media pages!  Come on! Adopt a ginger! I promise to be more entertaining than a neopet, and I won’t wither away if you forget to login!!

Thanks from Divinity

 

Your contribution helps a very inspirational artist take her creations to the next level. I've been producing powerful live variety shows, giving work to hundreds of musicians, comedians, artists, performers, for four years out of pocket as a single mother, often putting others first. I've also taken the time to speak to groups and schools and help non-profits raise funds with events. I've given till I had nothing to give (literally), and have made an impact everywhere I've gone. I appreciate all help in making a further impact on the world around me - Divinity

story:
KYRIE tells the story of ​a curious band of thieves, cutthroats, bookworms and traitors as they attempt to outsmart the North African authorities, while navigating their own dark and competing desires as outlaws of a dying Roman Empire.

Book One of this unique graphic novel series is ready to be put into your hands! And most importantly:
 

All 128 pages are already finished!

Book 1: The Curse of the Macedonian Scroll




Chapter 1: Prologue
The book opens with an unlikely troupe of thieves, a duo called the Thunder Brothers and led by the treasure hunter Myra, as they race to escape Alexandrian Egypt with the Red Lady of Babylon - an infernal ruby coveted by both Roman and Persian Empires, containing an encrypted message from civilization's dawn.

Chapter 2: The Red Lady of Babylon
The robbers escape by stealing Senator Valerian's sailing ship, only to discover a prisoner aboard named Marcus, who knows how to reveal the Red Lady's message, and a scroll from Macedon which explains it. But is this mysterious prisoner more dangerous than the Roman naval authorities who are already hunting them down?
 

This is an independently published graphic novel - meaning this book can only be printed with your pre-orders!

Securing a minimum number of pre-orders allows us to hire the printer to run their printer in China and ship the books to America, where we can then distribute them to you.

Free KYRIE postcard included for those who share the their Confirmation ID Number on social media and tag @mattcrotts on Twitter or Instagram!

Also: free bookmark for everyone who signed up for the pre-launch campaign and bought on day one.

BOOK PRINTING SPECS:

• 12 pt matte UV cover

• 80 lb matte coated interior pages

• 6.25"x8.574" at 128 pages


The more pre-orders we receive, the lower the cost of each book becomes. This in turn allows us to invest those savings back into the length of the book itself.


PRINTING STRETCH GOALS
(added for free to each printed book order):

ACHIEVED:
✔️ Spot gloss cover

✔️ Bonus printed map of KYRIE's Ancient North Africa by illustrated map expert Stephen Hesselman
(examples below):






✔️ Awesome fan art will be included!



^ art by Kate Sherron (@katesherron), Madeleine Fisher (@mfisherart) and Simon James Fletcher (@dropthedrawing)

 

NOT ACHIEVED:
❌ Movie poster by Elliot Fernandez 

(Proceeds from the book orders will now contribute towards hiring Elliot beforehand for a future campaign)

 

KYRIE is a richly crafted longform comic, following in the best traditions of the classic high adventure storytelling. It's also a love letter to Ancient North Africa.

And graphic novels like this one just aren't (yet) available your local comic book shop or bookstore!

Purchasing this book helps get stories like this one onto the bookshelves of readers of all ages, all over the world. We just can't do it without your backing!


 

This Indiegogo campaign is the only available way to print Book 1 of KYRIE. Though every page of this book is finished, we cannot produce a printed version without your invaluable support.

We've successfully funded and delivered a Kickstarter campaign for KYRIE's prologue back in 2014. We are confident we can do so again.

Thanks to the printer, we can get this book efficiently and reasonably printed and delivered to myself or the distributor in just a few months. 

No one is charged if this Indiegogo campaign doesn't fund. If for some reason the campaign funds but I cannot deliver the book, I will fully refund the campaign.

We're sure you'll love this book! And we are making every effort to ensure your book will get to you safely and on time. We want you to be more than satisfied with your purchase.

Have questions or concerns?My contact info is in the Q&A section. Just ask!


 

Some people just can't contribute. We understand ! But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends!
  • Social media works! Share this campaign online.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

So that's the pitch! Let us know if you'd like any more info. See you after the campaign!

story:
Hello everyone!

Katie Uhlmann and Trish Rainone here. We are two writers and actors residing in Toronto. You may recognize us from... well... you probably don't. We have both been in the film and television industry for approximately five years, and have acted in countless film and television projects. We've both produced several short films- winning a few awards between us, and are ready for the next step! 

Our campaign will raise the funding necessary to create a 10 episode web series created by and starring... us, and several other amazing actors. Ok, maybe you're thinking "wow, they seem egotistical." You say egotistical- we say frustrated actors trying to jump-start our careers. Tomato-tomawto! No, but seriously, we think it's more advantageous to create the work you want, rather than sitting around and complaining about why you're living with seven roommates, and your power is being shut off, because you're broke, because you're not getting the roles that you want, because your agent isn't getting you the proper auditions, because the casting directors secretly hate you... you get the idea.  

What is the magnitude of what the contributors will help us achieve? The sky is the limit. No, literally the limit- we won't be able to fly actors in for this. By helping us reach our goal, you are helping us create a kick-ass web series that will make you laugh at the end of your shitty day. The magnitude of potential for this series goes beyond that. There is a possibility that the series will get picked up by a network, and our contributors will have all been a key factor in the birth of our comedy baby- without you, nothing is possible.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $23, 500. This budget has been carefully put together and allows us to pay all of our cast, crew, and post-production team a little bit of money. Nobody is getting rich off this project, but we strongly believe that if you can give everyone a little something for their time, it goes a long way. This also includes the budget for locations, food, equipment, props, makeup, wardrobe, and transportation for a week-long shoot, as well as publicity and marketing, 


Our Perks

If you donate $30 or more, you are invited to our exclusive TIFF party! That means you'll be on the same guest list as Ryan Gosling (we are still waiting on his RSVP.) There will be red carpet photos for everyone and tons of amazing Canadian actors and filmmakers will be in attendance!

If you donate $500 we will wash your car, as long as you live in the GTA.  

If you donate $1000 we will bartend at your party in character, and you will get an executive producer credit. Haven't you always wanted to be an executive producer on a comedy series? 

Head-on over to our PERKS section after this and see all the amazing perks available. 


Where will your money will go if we do not reach the entire goal? 

We are making this series come hell or high-water, so you better believe your money will go to good use. The more money we get - the higher quality product the series will be, and the more likely it will lead to bigger and better things. Bottom line- your money will make a web series 100% guaranteed.


What will the impact of this series be?

For our individual viewer, we will be holding up a mirror to relatable situations of living with another person. There are struggles associated with sharing your space, and we are hoping to impact our viewers with relatable heightened situations that will make you escape, empathize, and hopefully laugh. 


Why is our project valuable to the contributor and to the world? Our world is light on female produced and written content. We are a small step toward changing the ecosystem of a male-dominated industry. 


What's our track record?

Why the hell should you trust us with your hard-earned cash that you had to fight for in this cruel cruel world? Good question! Katie Uhlmann has produced over 3000 episodes of an internet-based show entitled "Katie Chats" where she interviewed countless celebrities such as Tatiana Maslany, David Cronenberg, Atom Egoyan, Shannon Tweed, and many many more. She also wrote and produced the short film "Pyramid Scream" which went to countless international festivals and won several awards.

Trish Rainone has co-written and produced various film projects. Recently, her horror film, Constance, was one of eight horror films selected to screen in Georgia at the Milledgeville Film Festival. Before moving to Toronto, Trish owned and ran her own small-business, a cafe and catering service, in her home town of Sault-Ste Marie. Her diverse experience as a business-owner and an independent filmmaker, helped her to understand that dedication and hard-work will get you ahead.  


Risks & Challenges

Our main challenges include getting everyone's schedules aligning for the shoot. Many people who work in the arts have to have day jobs. A struggle for us is getting everyone to commit to taking time off from other jobs and making this project a priority. Another challenge is building a great team with like-minded, positive individuals. Putting together a team where everyone gets along with each other can be difficult. We are learning that there tends to be a significant number of people who don't like each other in the entertainment business, but maybe that is just business in general. 

Despite our hurdles, we feel as though we are qualified to overcome them. Having both worked on various team projects, we are becoming very adept at managing people and egos. 

To solve these challenges, we are very straight forward with our team members about what our goals and expectations are. We also believe that everyone fundamentally wants to be treated with respect first and foremost, and we are taking steps to have everyone's best interests at heart. With your help, we will be able to pay everyone a small amount of money, and this will help them take time off from their day jobs or other commitments to allocate time to our series.


Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from a financial contribution, how can you help? We know (very well) that not everyone can afford to give away rent money! We also sincerely appreciate twitter, facebook, and instagram shout outs. Like, comment and share our videos- every little bit helps! Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you!

We've both produced several short films- winning a few awards between us, and are ready for the next step! Our campaign will raise the funding necessary to create a 10 episode web series created by and starring... us, and several other amazing actors. Ok, maybe you're thinking "wow, they seem egotistical." You say egotistical- we say frustrated actors trying to jump-start our careers. Tomato-tomawto! No, but seriously, we think it's more advantageous to create the work you want, rather than sitting around and complaining about why you're living with seven roommates, and your power is being shut off, because you're broke, because you're not getting the roles that you want, because your agent isn't getting you the proper auditions, because the casting directors secretly hate you... you get the idea.  What is the magnitude of what the contributors will help us achieve? The sky is the limit. No, literally the limit- we won't be able to fly actors in for this. By helping us reach our goal, you are helping us create a kick-ass web series that will make you laugh at the end of your shitty day. The magnitude of potential for this series goes beyond that. There is a possibility that the series will get picked up by a network, and our contributors will have all been a key factor in the birth of our comedy baby- without you, nothing is possible.What We Need & What You GetWe need $23, 500. This budget has been carefully put together and allows us to pay all of our cast, crew, and post-production team a little bit of money. Nobody is getting rich off this project, but we strongly believe that if you can give everyone a little something for their time, it goes a long way. This also includes the budget for locations, food, equipment, props, makeup, wardrobe, and transportation for a week-long shoot, as well as publicity and marketing, Our PerksIf you donate $30 or more, you are invited to our exclusive TIFF party! That means you'll be on the same guest list as Ryan Gosling (we are still waiting on his RSVP.) There will be red carpet photos for everyone and tons of amazing Canadian actors and filmmakers will be in attendance!If you donate $500 we will wash your car, as long as you live in the GTA.  If you donate $1000 we will bartend at your party in character, and you will get an executive producer credit. Haven't you always wanted to be an executive producer on a comedy series? Head-on over to our PERKS section after this and see all the amazing perks available. Where will your money will go if we do not reach the entire goal?  We are making this series come hell or high-water, so you better believe your money will go to good use. The more money we get - the higher quality product the series will be, and the more likely it will lead to bigger and better things. Bottom line- your money will make a web series 100% guaranteed.What will the impact of this series be? For our individual viewer, we will be holding up a mirror to relatable situations of living with another person. There are struggles associated with sharing your space, and we are hoping to impact our viewers with relatable heightened situations that will make you escape, empathize, and hopefully laugh. Why is our project valuable to the contributor and to the world? Our world is light on female produced and written content. We are a small step toward changing the ecosystem of a male-dominated industry. What's our track record? Why the hell should you trust us with your hard-earned cash that you had to fight for in this cruel cruel world? Good question! Katie Uhlmann has produced over 3000 episodes of an internet-based show entitled "Katie Chats" where she interviewed countless celebrities such as Tatiana Maslany, David Cronenberg, Atom Egoyan, Shannon Tweed, and many many more. She also wrote and produced the short film "Pyramid Scream" which went to countless international festivals and won several awards.Trish Rainone has co-written and produced various film projects. Recently, her horror film, Constance, was one of eight horror films selected to screen in Georgia at the Milledgeville Film Festival. Before moving to Toronto, Trish owned and ran her own small-business, a cafe and catering service, in her home town of Sault-Ste Marie. Her diverse experience as a business-owner and an independent filmmaker, helped her to understand that dedication and hard-work will get you ahead.  Risks & ChallengesOur main challenges include getting everyone's schedules aligning for the shoot. Many people who work in the arts have to have day jobs. A struggle for us is getting everyone to commit to taking time off from other jobs and making this project a priority. Another challenge is building a great team with like-minded, positive individuals. Putting together a team where everyone gets along with each other can be difficult. We are learning that there tends to be a significant number of people who don't like each other in the entertainment business, but maybe that is just business in general. Despite our hurdles, we feel as though we are qualified to overcome them. Having both worked on various team projects, we are becoming very adept at managing people and egos. To solve these challenges, we are very straight forward with our team members about what our goals and expectations are. We also believe that everyone fundamentally wants to be treated with respect first and foremost, and we are taking steps to have everyone's best interests at heart. With your help, we will be able to pay everyone a small amount of money, and this will help them take time off from their day jobs or other commitments to allocate time to our series.Other Ways You Can HelpAside from a financial contribution, how can you help? We know (very well) that not everyone can afford to give away rent money! We also sincerely appreciate twitter, facebook, and instagram shout outs. Like, comment and share our videos- every little bit helps! Use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you!

story:
When I Grow Up

As a child Juliette wanted to be many things: ballerina, princess, Muppet. Did she have it right when she was a kid? Did she know her vocation before life got in the way? In this true-life comedy, Juliette goes to extreme lengths to realise her childhood ambitions. Is what we do who we are? And does growing up mean letting go?


In this one-woman show an ordinary girl - Juliette Burton - tries to be extraordinary things. Artist, farmer, ballerina, baker, princess, pop star, cartoon, muppet; she’s living the dream…every dream she ever had!


Research so far...


So far Juliette has been an artist working with Cambridge-based artist John Lyons (http://www.johnlyons.org/); a farmer working at Edinburgh's Gorgie City farm (http://www.gorgiecityfarm.org.uk/); has joined a children's class at the Edinburgh Dance school to become a ballerina (http://www.edinburghdanceschool.co.uk/)and then spent a week being a baker at La Cerise (http://www.lacerise.biz/) and Edinburgh New Town Cookery School (http://www.entcs.co.uk/).

Chasing her dream of being a pop star Juliette has recorded her brand new single and will be performing at a gay club in Glasgow and on stage at T in the Park in July 2013 (http://www.tinthepark.com/content/). She is also being turned into a cartoon by animator Robyn Liebschner.

Exciting plans are in the works for Juliette to become a princess. She has been in talks with Clarence House about meeting Prince Harry. Following a friendly response, Juliette has exciting plans to possibly find her prince in May 2013, meet with a Lady in Waiting, take etiquette lessons with Public Image Ltd and truly be an Edinburghian Princess.

And finally, she is also speaking with Sesame Street Live about a possible meeting and with Disney representatives about chatting to her ultimate heroes - The Muppets! (http://disney.go.com/muppets/).

Why we need your help...

All money pledged will help towards the costs of putting on the show: venue hire, staff at the venue, materials, publicity costs and more. Juliette is not raising funds to pay herself a fee at all. All money raised will go towards the show.

Company

Lizzy Mace and Juliette Burton met as actor-members of the Cambridge scriptwriting forum, WRiTEON! They began writing together at a stand-up comedy workshop in 2010. After Juliette helped Lizzy write her solo show, Crush, for Edinburgh Fringe 2010, they went on to write and perform two more shows together - Rom Com Con and Heartbreak Hotel. Both shows gained four and five-star reviews and at last year's Brighton Fringe Rom Com Con was one of only 11 shows singled out for an Argus Angel Award for Excellence. 

Juliette has worked as a professional actress and voiceover artist since 2009. Before then she worked for the BBC and IPC Media as a radio and magazine journalist. She has performed in many short films and stage shows, particularly comedy
films and shows. She has also worked as a presenter, mainly on music programmes. Please see http://www.spotlight.com/9734-7869-3053 for more information.

story:
Hi there! This campaign is a chance for readers to purchase a digital copy of Tales of Pylea: A Hunter's Patience, a fantasy adventure that consists of 150+ pages of quality art, along with other assorted goodies including an exclusive short story!


What is Tales of Pylea?

Tales of Pylea is a fantasy webcomic series that aims to combine quality art and a solid narrative.


What's it about?

In a struggle between immortal demigods, the fate of the world lies in the hands of an introverted clerk and a brutish legbreaker.


Why would anyone back you?

The two of us grew up on the wonders of independent comic books and have always dreamt of producing our very own comic series.

Up until now, our project has been funded from our own pockets; we're doing this full-time, working every weekday to bring you quality fantasy adventure since January 2013.

In the last two years we haven't missed a single deadline, bringing our readers regular updates every Monday.

Every issue we produce is planned well in advance in a solid production pipeline with tremendous leeway for human error. 


What's this money supposed to fund?

We're self-employed and your contribution will allow us to cover the costs of marketing and maintaining the domain over a prolonged period.

Our goal is to raise $2000; It doesn't look like much, but your money will ease the upkeep for a project of such scope.

We won't lie to you; rather than make outrageous claims that we can't deliver on, we're keeping it simple; bringing you quality comics in a timely and reliable fashion.

Please note that due to rising shipping costs we still can't afford to sell physical books as of yet and for now our products will remain digital.


Perk descriptions

  • Every bit counts, and for your $5 contribution you'll get a gorgeous ToP-themed Wallpaper drawn by Humbug!


  • At this pledge level, you'll get your very own digital copy of Tales of Pylea: A Hunter's Patience. 
  • Also included is a bonus short story featuring the adventures of Lair!


  • For your generous pledge of $20, you get not one, but two comics!
  • Par'Dis: Only Human is another comic series on our site that tells another Pylean tale; that of a city's guardian and his struggle to understand humanity and change.



  • Believe it or not, Chris (ToP's writer) can draw so he'll be helping with the perks. 
  • This is the style and quality you can expect of Chris should you select this perk!
  • You may request any character; a little nudity is fine but nothing explicit!



  • Receive a shaded sketch from the very artist of ToP herself! 
  • This is the style and quality you can expect of Humbug should you select this perk. 
  • You may request any character, a little nudity is fine but nothing explicit!




  • For $50 you get a lotta love from both ToP's creators in the form of sketches!
  • You may request any character, a little nudity is fine but nothing explicit!


  • For this pledge? Your very own appearance in ToP's next issue!
  • You will receive a single scene speaking role. 
  • Humbug can either draw your likeness or a design of your choosing. 
  • The clothing that you or your avatar will be wearing has already been decided.


  • Wow, thanks! For this generous contribution, you will receive a digital painting of your likeness or a design of your choosing in a style similar to the following card. 
  • You can also decide what you would like to wear! Be it a bear suit or a beer hat, go nuts! 
  • Nothing too explicit please, or Humbug will have to comically censor your image. 
  • Your card will also be featured in a special Hall of Fame page on ToP's website.


Stretch Goals


$2800

  • Let's get pandering! You will receive 2 special wallpapers that will follow the Sixpacks and Seafood theme! See this image that appears over Humbug's blog? ToP's lead heroes will be featured in this suggestive wallpaper wrapped in tentacles. It will be naughty, but not explicit. Don't want both wallpapers? You can request for just the male or female lead if you want.


$4000
  • With this we will have broken even and then some! Any backers who have picked the Shard perk and above will received an additional bonus short comic in their ToP PDF!

Thanks for your time; it means the world to us.

Stretch Goals

$2800

ToP's lead heroes will be featured in this suggestive wallpaper wrapped in tentacles. It will be naughty, but not explicit. Don't want both wallpapers? You can request for just the male or female lead if you want.

With this we will have broken even and then some! Any backers who have picked the Shard perk and above will received an additional bonus short comic in their ToP PDF!

Thanks for your time; it means the world to us.

story:
"Imprisoned in her mystical sleep for fifteen hundred years, give or take, Morgan Le Fay has been discovered & restored to a shadow of her former glory by a cabal of powerful beings calling themselves the Triple Moon. For no less than thirteen years, Le Fay will serve this group, and at the end of that service she will be given the means by which she can restore her power. Until that time, she will be their trouble shooter, on call 24/7, no job too big or too small. The Triple Moon’s very own private investigator." Paul- Pullbox Reviews

This is a modern take on the classic villain from Arthurian legend brought into the present in an urban setting. Ever wonder what Jessica Jones would be like if she happened to be a powerful sorceress? That's Le Fay in a nutshell.

WHAT ARE YOU BACKING?

  • This is a 32 page full color comic, single (third) issue of a series.
  • Urban Fantasy Noir genre
  • Mature Readers

New to Le Fay? Read 10 pages of issue 1 HERE

 

Joshua Metzger - Writer/Creator

Writes the crime comics Punch Drunk (Arcana Comics) and Metzger and Pawlak Presents: Villain (Evoluzione Publishing).

Miguel Angel Ruiz - Artist

Miguel Angel Ruiz, was born in 1984 in Córdoba, a little city in the south of Spain.

He began his carrer in animation world, studing animation during two years, then was working in three films of spanish productions,three years later he moved to Mexico and worked in his fisrt comics for indy companies, then when he returned to Spain, studied Illustration carrer in Art School of Córdoba, while he was working in Farscape Scorpious for Boom Studios.  When he finished his studies, started to work in Crossed Badlands for Avatar press, Miguel Angel still working in indie comics since that moments, have worked in Arclight comics, Sygn media, Genuine comics etc...Currently  Miguel Angel is working for Evoluzione Publishing making the art of Le Fay, and covers for another titles.

Vittorio Astone - Colorist 

Hi, I'm Vittorio Astone and I'm a professional comic book artist and freelancer concept artist. I've published some short stories with Heavy Metal Magazine and Editoriale Aurea's Lanciostory and now I'm working with Vault Comics on an upcoming comic book series. As a concept artist, I'm currently working as a freelancer for private clients.

story:
Synopsis

A (tired) writer has a deadline with executives. With only one day to come up with a story, he goes on a walk for inspiration. During the walk, the writer has some... creative ideas. How will the executives react to his proposal?


Our Story

Hi! My name is Joseph Ruggieri and I am attending the Los Angeles Film School! I finished four years in the Army. I love comedy, and have come up with a short film that will be a fun experience for everyone. I'm really passionate about film making and comedy in general, I feel that so often, it's not done right. I know ultimately I can produce an amazing product, and I hope people like the film!


The Impact

I can't afford to do this on my own and I really feel the project is amazing. I have a really dedicated crew and everyone who reads the story loves it. I don't want to sell my car, I need it!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to buy food for cast and crew during the shoot days. We also need gas money/van rental money. Costumes will be a big part of this project and last but not least the crew insurance is mandatory and that costs a couple hundred dollars. If we somehow make more money than the film costs, we will be using that for festival entrance fees!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends! It really is a team effort making a film and we need as much help as we can get!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kat Rush, and I'm a 20-year-old animation student at Sherida college. I'm also the author and illustrator of Moth, an online animated webcomic. My comic follows the story of a young telepath named Taylor Gray, who is being hunted through the southern United States by the corporation that illegally created her. But something darker is hunting Taylor as well - she is haunted by a host of mysterious demons that seem to appear only to her. Does Taylor have more powers than she knows, allowing her to see a reality that others can't percieve? Or is Taylor herself the one who is not in tune with reality? Moth is essentialy a superhero origin story with a gritty, surreal tone. As the story progresses, the book takes us on a action-packed, funny, heartfelt and beautiful adventure through the Bayou with a cast of bizzare, superpowered characters.

The comic is partly animated, which is a relatively new and unexplored medium that combines some looped animation with comic book format. My book is one of the very few animated webcomics available online, and the only one that uses animation in the way that I do. Because of this unusual format, Moth is very experimental in nature, and i learn new ways to apply animation in a way that serves the story all the time. The first 47 page issue of the comic is all online already, and you can read it here - http://mothcomic.smackjeeves.com/ . 

Reaching my funding goal would mean that I would be able to complete the next two issues of the book, and continue to learn and create high-quality, entertaining content for free online.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm a full-time student, which means that between my very intense program, jobs, and portfolio prep, the enormous amout of work and time that Moth requires is hard to justify doing for free, when I could be doing something with my time that would allow me to pay tuition. Without funding, there is a good chance that I will have to scrap the entire project simply because of a lack of time, which would break my heart. Even if I did decide to go ahead with the book without funding, it would take me a huge amount of time to finish the book and it would be very hard to keep momentum and get the story across.

The 4000$ will fund the creation of issues 2 and 3 of Moth - 2000$ an issue. That'll be almost 100 pages of full artwork and animation. Half of that money goes to me to write and draw the book, and the other half goes to a second artist ( http://tegan-ray.deviantart.com/ ) who will colour and draw some of the layouts for the book. Quite a bit of the money will also go to fufilling perks, paying Indiegogo, and other technicalities like renewing the subcription to the comic host site.

With your help I'll be able not only to create the next two issues, but put so much more time and energy into finding an audience. With a bigger audience as a result of this campaign and your help, the comic might be able tos tart making money in it's own right, which would mean that I wouldn't have any trouble continuing the book until he entire volume is done.

When you contribute, there are a variety of really cool perks that are available. Check out the perk section - you could get a poster, t-shirt, postcards, original artwork, or even have your name or a caricature of you appear in the comic. You could recieve a poster or postcards that will have hints about the upcoming plot and Taylor's mysterious backstory. Be a part of the creative process and get involved with the book by donating!

When you donate to Moth, you become a part of the project. I'm hoping to establish a direct creator-audience relationship, where you fund directly the work that you want to continue to see. And you know that I'll finish the book because the whole first issue is already up.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign is just as valuable to me as a donation. I want the book to be funded by people who love my work, so if that's not you - don't sweat it! But help me find people who do love it by introducing people to Moth.

Remember to read the book here - http://mothcomic.smackjeeves.com/ - and use the share tools on Indiegogo!

As the story progresses, the book takes us on a action-packed, funny, heartfelt and beautiful adventure through the Bayou with a cast of bizzare, superpowered characters.
The comic is partly animated, which is a relatively new and unexplored medium that combines some looped animation with comic book format. My book is one of the very few animated webcomics available online, and the only one that uses animation in the way that I do. Because of this unusual format, Moth is very experimental in nature, and i learn new ways to apply animation in a way that serves the story all the time. The first 47 page issue of the comic is all online already, and you can read it here - http://mothcomic.smackjeeves.com/ . 
Reaching my funding goal would mean that I would be able to complete the next two issues of the book, and continue to learn and create high-quality, entertaining content for free online.


What I Need & What You Get
I'm a full-time student, which means that between my very intense program, jobs, and portfolio prep, the enormous amout of work and time that Moth requires is hard to justify doing for free, when I could be doing something with my time that would allow me to pay tuition. Without funding, there is a good chance that I will have to scrap the entire project simply because of a lack of time, which would break my heart. Even if I did decide to go ahead with the book without funding, it would take me a huge amount of time to finish the book and it would be very hard to keep momentum and get the story across.
The 4000$ will fund the creation of issues 2 and 3 of Moth - 2000$ an issue. That'll be almost 100 pages of full artwork and animation. Half of that money goes to me to write and draw the book, and the other half goes to a second artist ( http://tegan-ray.deviantart.com/ ) who will colour and draw some of the layouts for the book. Quite a bit of the money will also go to fufilling perks, paying Indiegogo, and other technicalities like renewing the subcription to the comic host site.
With your help I'll be able not only to create the next two issues, but put so much more time and energy into finding an audience. With a bigger audience as a result of this campaign and your help, the comic might be able tos tart making money in it's own right, which would mean that I wouldn't have any trouble continuing the book until he entire volume is done.
When you contribute, there are a variety of really cool perks that are available. Check out the perk section - you could get a poster, t-shirt, postcards, original artwork, or even have your name or a caricature of you appear in the comic. You could recieve a poster or postcards that will have hints about the upcoming plot and Taylor's mysterious backstory. Be a part of the creative process and get involved with the book by donating!


When you donate to Moth, you become a part of the project. I'm hoping to establish a direct creator-audience relationship, where you fund directly the work that you want to continue to see. And you know that I'll finish the book because the whole first issue is already up.


Other Ways You Can Help
Sharing this campaign is just as valuable to me as a donation. I want the book to be funded by people who love my work, so if that's not you - don't sweat it! But help me find people who do love it by introducing people to Moth.
Remember to read the book here - http://mothcomic.smackjeeves.com/ - and use the share tools on Indiegogo!

story:
THE STORY

I lived on the wrong side of the Iron Curtain when I was of the comics-reading age, so I knew next to nothing about British comics as a kid. A pen-pal from Leeds once sent me an early issue of Whoopee! which made a profound impression on my 10-year-old self, and inspired me to try my hand at the genre. I freelanced for Lithuania’s national humour magazine for quite a while in my twenties. At one point in the early ‘90s they even nominated me the cartoonist of the year!.. Then other things in life took priority, and it was only in 2007 that I got back to my old hobby – this time as a collector of British comics, and starting from 2012 – an active blogger and owner of http://kazoop.blogspot.co.uk

It didn’t take me long to discover the genius of Ken Reid. To me, his strips in WHAM!, SMASH! and POW! comics published by Odhams Press in the ‘60s stood in splendid isolation above the work of his fellow-cartoonists, and I couldn’t help but wonder why they weren’t collected under one cover for fans – and the whole wide World – to appreciate and enjoy… They represent Ken Reid at his very best, and are a proud landmark of British comics heritage.

A few months ago I finally decided to stop wondering and take action instead! I negotiated a license with copyright owners – Time Inc. (UK) Ltd. I have all the scans cleaned and ready, I arranged for a talented young artist to draw sumptuous cover illustrations (front and back), obtained enthusiastic introductions from well-known folks in the British comics industry and secured further entertaining intros from Ken’s son Antony J. Reid, who kindly allowed me to use his dad’s archive material – my ultimate resource when researching and writing a detailed biography of the artist, covering the years 1964 – 1969 when he worked for Odhams (also included in the collection).

Layouts are now in preparation, and this campaign is the final step before the books go to the printers! They will be printed offset by one of Lithuania’s top printing houses with lots of experience in printing editions of this kind.  

Your contribution will help me release this remarkable collection that is long overdue, and I am sure you will be satisfied with the final product. THE POWER PACK OF KEN REID will consist of two hard-cover 200 page volumes, available both individually and as a set. Backers of this campaign will enjoy the privilege of the boxed-set edition and the free prints of original artwork:

SPREAD THE WORD!

Even if you don’t want or can’t contribute to the campaign – please, get the word out by sharing it on social media and telling your friends, relatives, neighbours and passers-by all about it!

WHAT HAPPENS IF…?

The money I am raising will be used to cover production costs. I have strong faith in the project, and I am confident the campaign will reach the goal of $9,970 (roughly £8,000), but you may be wondering what happens if it doesn’t...

Well, differently from many other comics crowdfunding campaigns, this reprint collection is published under license, which had to be paid for in advance. The cover artist, the layouts designer, etc. – those people also don’t work for free, which means I have already made quite an investment, so THE COLLECTION WILL BE PRINTED NO MATTER WHAT. Furthermore, I have no intention of making fewer copies than the license allows me to. In other words – if the whole print run is not pre-ordered during this campaign, the books will eventually be available to buy online, but not as a boxed set and without the free prints of original artwork as these incentives are reserved exclusively for supporters of this campaign.

SCHEDULE

  • The plan is to print the books within two or three weeks after this crowdfunding campaign ends in the first days of July 2018. 
  • Individual books (Vol. 1 or Vol. 2) will be dispatched to their backers as soon as possible after they arrive from the printing house.
  • Boxed sets will be dispatched two or three weeks later because the slipcase will be manufactured only after the books have been printed.

This is an estimated but realistic time-frame. It will be updated in an unlikely event if something unexpected happens.

SHIPPING COSTS

The books can be shipped anywhere in the World.  All packages will be shipped using the recorded delivery priority (airmail) service of Lithuanian Post.

INDIVIDUAL BOOKS: one book can be shipped for the standard flat rate – $15 (approx. £11) for the UK/the EU, and $22 (approx. £16) for the rest of the World.

THE POWER PACK: both books in the slipcase will weigh more than 2 kilos and will have to be shipped as a parcel, which costs more. Rates differ by country. Shipping costs to a few destinations are quoted under the POWER PACK perk. If your country isn’t mentioned, please, contact me and I will obtain a quote for you from Lithuanian Post.

Note regarding shipping cost to the UK: anticipating that the majority of those heavier POWER PACK parcels will go to the UK, I have negotiated a special rate of £15 with the local office of TNT. HOWEVER, the rate will apply only provided the minimum number of packages I submit to them in one go is 200. If the quantity is achieved, I will refund the difference to all UK supporters who choose THE POWER PACK perk.

Do not hesitate to contact me with any questions about the project.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE REGARDING POSTAGE COST TO CONTINENTAL EUROPE

I received a few emails from fans of Ken Reid in France and Greece, and this calls for an update.

It turns out I neglected to include postage cost to the EU with the POWER PACK perk… My apologies, folks!

I can’t add new destinations to the existing perk, so I have now created a new one which is identical to the Featured Perk, but offers postage to many European countries. You can find it at the bottom of the perks column. I will increase the number available if (and when) the 10 I have included now are claimed.

Backers from the UK, Ireland, the USA, Canada, Australia and New Zealand – please use the FEATURED PERK at the top of the column because it includes correct postage costs to your countries :)

Many thanks!

story:
Bonabyl is a comic series about fear and friendship. It follows a spirited blind boy Miro, and his best friend Vick, both students at the mysterious Bonabyl Academy. They start investigating some spooky secrets around the school, but what starts as curiosity leads them straight into their worst nightmares. The series promises charming characters and gorgeous art that draws influence from Japanese manga and American superhero flicks, yet still remains vibrantly distinct.

But the best way to tell, is to show...

 

 

Have we met yet?

I’m Manek D’Silva, an illustrator and writer from India. I grew up on Samurai Jack, One Piece, and Lord of the Rings, and always aspired to make drawings and stories like that; they felt massive in scale, wildly fantastical in every way, but still thoroughly believable. I've learned a lot over the last decade of illustration, but Bonabyl is easily the most special and elaborate project I’ve ever worked on, it's full of weird creatures, wild action, hilariously cute dialogue, and a lot of heart (Go Planet!).

So what’s the plan, fam?

The goal for this campaign is set at 3000$. I plan to use it for the initial print run of the comic, marketing to new readers, as well as to fund goodies, merchandise, and the occasional chocolate cake. Mmm.

The reward tiers are packed with immense value: every comic is sent out as a gorgeous full-colour book, with 84 pages of story in an exclusive hard-cover just for the backers of this campaign. Since all the artwork is done, the funds will go directly into printing and delivering beautiful books to the backers of Bonabyl, so you can pledge with confidence that you’ll get your copy.

 

 

The work is all done, no waitin’ or deliberatin’!

Great news, I’ve already invested 4 years to write the story and finish the art for this book, so you don’t have to wait any longer. The pages are drawn, inked, coloured and ready for print. Which means as soon as the campaign is done, I can jump into the print and production process, and have these eye-smackin books shipped out to you.

A country of emerging stories

Bonabyl is written for audiences all across the world. But India itself is on the brink of a massive shift to modern fantasy storytelling with original films and shows being created every year, and the audience for them is growing steadily, mostly thanks to Marvel and Game of Thrones (Winter is here y'all!). There’s very few high-quality original comic series being made in the country; so by contributing and spreading the word about independent comic projects like this, you’re helping open up the floor for new creators and stories to emerge in the future!

My personal library is full of beautifully printed books and comics that have brought me immense joy over the years. I’m determined to meet that high quality of storytelling and production, and pass that joy on to you through this book.

Do you know a guy who knows a guy?

Funding is only one part of the equation, it would mean the world if you spread the word about Bonabyl and this campaign on social media or directly to your friends and family, maybe you’ll hook them on comics forever! And if you're on Instagram, say hi @manekdsilva

story:
WHY INDIEGOGO

This Indiegogo campaign will provide me with lodging, transportation, food and supplies, during my Residency at the Banff Centre in Aug 2011. During my time at the center I will draw a 30-50 page comicbook, use the printmaking facilities to make limited edition prints and make many one of a kind sculptural textile works. 

I am seeking funding through Indiegogo since I found out about the residency in early June and as a result I missed many Canadian grant deadlines. Though fundraising through Indiegogo provides me with an interesting opportunity to make work for a specific built in audience, rather than trying to find an audience after the work is complete. It is good to know that the work is wanted before it is even made. 

ARTIST BIO

Shanell Papp grew up in Southern Alberta and received her B.F.A. from the University of Lethbridge, in 2006.  She completed her graduate studies at the University of Saskatchewan, in 2010. Papp also received a dean’s medal nomination, for her work Loners: working away from a pattern (her thesis can be accessed online from the University of Saskatchewan Library). Much of her work is textile, video, drawing, printmaking and photography. She has never painted and in any of her attempts to paint, have ended up with unintended paint mixing results, greens that end up as browns and browns end up as purples, but one day she would love to paint an iceberg in the fog.

Much of her work is interested in structures and definitions. She is interested in how people make sense of the world, in how one creates order and structure for themselves and in labour intensive and skilled art practices. Much of her work displays her skill and patience with many materials. She has embroidered life size skeletons into tough canvas by hand (bonebook), she has woven 50-60 cases of straight pins into a canvas to create a mountain (anxiety), but Shanell is best known for a crochet human skeleton and organs (Lab), which was part of the Current show at the SAAG in 2006. Her work is often labour intensive and skills based; but much of her work is dense with conceptual and material associations. When asked about her work, Papp is quick to reference her variety of interests in science, vulnerability, outsiders, biographical comics, folk art, junkstores, outsider music, horror movies, true crime, medical history, death studies, harsh environments, survival situations and museums/collections of any kind.

Papp has shown her work in galleries across Canada and beyond, including University of Lethbridge (Lethbridge), University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon), The New Gallery (Calgary), Gallery Gachette (Vancouver) and the City of Craft (Toronto). 

Papp is also an active participant in the Arts community she was a board member for Trap\door (Lethbridge) and AKA (Saskatoon). She was employed in various capacities at PAVED arts (Saskatoon), The Galt Museum and Archives (Lethbridge) and The Southern Alberta Art Gallery (Lethbridge). Papp sells her work under the name Yarnmoth on etsy, at the SAAG gift shop and she Is a Co-Organizer, for Craftateria (Lethbridge).

story:
Hello!

I'm Alex Peña. I've been drawing since I was a kid. Drawing is my passion and being a mangaka is my dream. I've been working on Sen & Kai with my best friend Thai-Binh in the last 3 years, and printing a full volume of Sen & Kai would be our first great achievement!

Sen & Kai Manga is a digital Manga and it is FREE to read on our website MangaChasers.com, but with your help you can hold a hard copy of Sen & Kai Manga Chapters 1 through 7 in your hand! That would make our first volume.

What We Need 

  • Our goal is to get $500 in pledges, the minimum required for funding & printing.
  • Last year we had a Kickstarter project which succeeded in funding. You can check out our first Sen & Kai Manga Debut edition here.
  • Help us reach our $500 goal and receive a hard copy of Volume 1 in your hand!

What You Get


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help spread the word about Sen & Kai Manga to anyone or anything you know!
  • One day Manga Chasers will be at a manga or anime convention in your city!

And that’s all there is to it. Easy!

Love, Manga Chasers :D
