story:
Patric Makes Comics

Hello, my name is Patric Lewandowski, also known as the Marvelous Patric.  I make comics.  I've made a lot of comics.  I made comics for the defunct website Graphicsmash called The Twisting and Aces High.  I did a long-running strip called Freaks N Squeeks for about 10 years that I'm probably best known for.  These days, I make a comic called Fun Factory.  Fun Factory updates four days a week, but I want to make more comics!

But, to make more comics, I need your help.  See, not only do I make comics, but I've got an awesome day job and an ever-growing family that also desire my time.  And, as we all know, through the power of capitalism, time is money.  

I want to make more comics, but to do that, I need some help.  I need YOUR help.  I'm asking you to help fund my artistic output in 2014 through your contributions to this campaign.  With your help, not only will I keep making Fun Factory, but I will be able to concentrate on making more Freaks N Squeeks comics and maybe even more than that!  

So Why $3,000?

$3,000 is a very specific number.  Essentially, my 6 year old Mac Pro is on its last legs.  Various components on it have been failing and at some point in 2014, I'm going to need a new computer.  I need my computer to make my art.  $3,000 is essentially the cost of a new comparable computer.  Now, instead of just asking you for $3,000, I'd rather ask you to let me earn that three grand by making art.  

This is a flexible funding campaign.  That means I get money even if I don't hit my goal.  All the money I get up to that first $3,000 goes towards a new Mac Pro.  Any funds after that go towards other needs that come up with making comics, like convention fees, book printing, advertising, etc.  

What You Get Out of This

That's what I get out of this, but what about you?  As you can see, every pledge comes with a variety of rewards.  Here's the basics:

Pledges and Rewards

  • $5 - $25 gets you a variety of PDFs of comics.  
  • $100 or more and you are directly funding the creation of new Freaks N Squeeks strips.  The number of new strips that are created for everyone to read with your name attached depends on how much you spend.  
Funding Goals
  • Basic Funding Goal: For every $100 this campaign raises, four new Freaks N Squeeks comics will be generated for 2014, up to 365 new strips. 
  • Stretch Goal #1: $5,000.  If we get to $5,000 I will print up Freaks N Squeeks Pretty Much Everything Volume 2 which will contain all the comics through the end of the regular series in 2012 (the prom story).  Everyone who contributes $25 or more will get a physical copy.  
  • Stretch Goal #2: $7,500.  Freaks N Squeeks returns to updating 4 days a week for all of 2014.    
  • Stretch Goal #3: $10,000.  As I've said, I've got a ton of ideas for different comics.  If we reach $10,000 I will hire another artist to produce art for one of those. 
  • Stretch Goal #4: $25,000.  Fun Factory and Freaks N Squeeks update 7 days a week.  
  • Stretch Goal #5: $50,000. I don't just have ideas for comics, but there are animations I would love to do.  If we reach $50,000, I will produce 1 12 minute animation in 2014.
  • Stretch Goal #6: $75,000.  I quit my awesome day job.  No, not really, because I love it, but I basically invert the amount of time I spend teaching with the time I spend making art.  Art becomes my new day job for 2014 and teaching becomes my side gig.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Tell all your friends, enemies, and frienemies.  Tweet this campaign, Facebook it, etc.  Follow me on twitter!  RT my links!  Talk about this campaign and my comics with people everywhere.
story_txt:
Patric Makes ComicsHello, my name is Patric Lewandowski, also known as the Marvelous Patric.  I make comics.  I've made a lot of comics.  I made comics for the defunct website Graphicsmash called The Twisting and Aces High.  I did a long-running strip called Freaks N Squeeks for about 10 years that I'm probably best known for.  These days, I make a comic called Fun Factory.  Fun Factory updates four days a week, but I want to make more comics!But, to make more comics, I need your help.  See, not only do I make comics, but I've got an awesome day job and an ever-growing family that also desire my time.  And, as we all know, through the power of capitalism, time is money.  I want to make more comics, but to do that, I need some help.  I need YOUR help.  I'm asking you to help fund my artistic output in 2014 through your contributions to this campaign.  With your help, not only will I keep making Fun Factory, but I will be able to concentrate on making more Freaks N Squeeks comics and maybe even more than that!  So Why $3,000?$3,000 is a very specific number.  Essentially, my 6 year old Mac Pro is on its last legs.  Various components on it have been failing and at some point in 2014, I'm going to need a new computer.  I need my computer to make my art.  $3,000 is essentially the cost of a new comparable computer.  Now, instead of just asking you for $3,000, I'd rather ask you to let me earn that three grand by making art.  This is a flexible funding campaign.  That means I get money even if I don't hit my goal.  All the money I get up to that first $3,000 goes towards a new Mac Pro.  Any funds after that go towards other needs that come up with making comics, like convention fees, book printing, advertising, etc.  What You Get Out of ThisThat's what I get out of this, but what about you?  As you can see, every pledge comes with a variety of rewards.  Here's the basics:Pledges and Rewards
$5 - $25 gets you a variety of PDFs of comics.  
$100 or more and you are directly funding the creation of new Freaks N Squeeks strips.  The number of new strips that are created for everyone to read with your name attached depends on how much you spend.  
Funding Goals

Basic Funding Goal: For every $100 this campaign raises, four new Freaks N Squeeks comics will be generated for 2014, up to 365 new strips. 

Stretch Goal #1: $5,000.  If we get to $5,000 I will print up Freaks N Squeeks Pretty Much Everything Volume 2 which will contain all the comics through the end of the regular series in 2012 (the prom story).  Everyone who contributes $25 or more will get a physical copy.  
Stretch Goal #2: $7,500.  Freaks N Squeeks returns to updating 4 days a week for all of 2014.    

Stretch Goal #3: $10,000.  As I've said, I've got a ton of ideas for different comics.  If we reach $10,000 I will hire another artist to produce art for one of those. 

Stretch Goal #4: $25,000.  Fun Factory and Freaks N Squeeks update 7 days a week.  

Stretch Goal #5: $50,000. I don't just have ideas for comics, but there are animations I would love to do.  If we reach $50,000, I will produce 1 12 minute animation in 2014.

Stretch Goal #6: $75,000.  I quit my awesome day job.  No, not really, because I love it, but I basically invert the amount of time I spend teaching with the time I spend making art.  Art becomes my new day job for 2014 and teaching becomes my side gig.  
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:Tell all your friends, enemies, and frienemies.  Tweet this campaign, Facebook it, etc.  Follow me on twitter!  RT my links!  Talk about this campaign and my comics with people everywhere.

story:
$ MONEYMAKER Duo $

  The sketch comedy team MoneyMaker Duo was conceived in 2011 at an actor networking program in New York City. After this expensive intensive, which had promised the actors immediate success, the only connection Anni and Mia made was with one another. True to their feminine nature, they spent the majority of the program pretending to hate each other until they realized they were actually in love. If there was a word that combined goofy and sexy, it would describe their sense of humor. Any project they put their minds to is a product of equal parts hard work, passion and playfulness with a dash of sexy.

Where is your $ going?

1. A year supply of diet coke. (We may seem high maintenance, but at the end of the day all we need is a diet coke. So hydrating.)

2. A 10 day vacation for Mia and Anni to Tahiti. (Your money will cover the cost of their private villa which rests on the ocean. The Villa has a glass floor allowing Mia and Anni to look at the fish. So relaxing.)

3. Disguises for us to wear when we go out in public. (Paparazzi is so exhausting.)



BUT SERIOUSLY...
Your money will go towards helping us fund our upcoming season of digital shorts. It will help cover the cost of our directors, assistant directors, directors of photography, set designers, lighting designers, costume designers, hair and makeup artists, camera and lighting equipment, location fees and finally for all post production work.

Our first short film "APPETITE" received official selection this year at the SOHO International Film Festival. We will be submitting this film to more festivals around the world. Your money will also help us pay for the applications! You can watch the trailer at http://youtu.be/8UGOioQ5w-Q.

Can't give $? STALK US:

1. 'Like' us on Facebook
2. Check out our website www.MoneyMakerDuo.com
3. Tell your friends. Tell your enemies. Help us get MoneyMaker Duo's name out there!

Feel free to email us at contact@MoneyMakerDuo.com


After all, as Kate Moss once said, 

“My face is my money maker.”

story:
Hej!                                                                                    For english, please scroll down

Jag har skrivit en erotisk bok som ligger mig mycket varmt om hjärtat. För att jag ska kunna ge ut den behöver jag dock er hjälp. 

Stöd projektet genom 1) en donation 2)  att förhandsbeställa ett signerat exemplar av boken – eller något av de olika paket du hittar till höger. Där finns bland annat Lars Krantz fenomenala originalillustrationer. Se dem i sin helhet samt läs mer om och ur boken på vår hemsida.

                                                                           *

En SS-dolk. En SS-man. En satanist. En bankrånare. En polisarkivarie. Och ett black metal-band på Europaturné. 

Detta är några av huvudrollsinnehavarna i Achtung Blitzkrieg, min debut som författare, illustrerad av Lars Krantz.  

Achtung Blitzkrieg är en fristående fortsättning på Krantz och Pär Thörns bok Äganderätten måste ständigt omförhandlas. Ett stycke sexualkarnevalisk fanfiction. 

Achtung Blitzkrieg är en bok som utspelar sig i fantasins allra mörkaste rum.

Achtung Blitzkrieg är boken där allt kan hända.

Achtung Blitzkrieg är en avancerad form av humor. Kanske allt för avancerad.

(OBS! Boken innehåller illustrationer och ett språk som kan verka stötande för vissa personer.)

                                                                             *

An SS-dagger. An SS-man. A satanist. A bankrobber. An archivist. And a black metal band on eurotour. 
These are some of the main characters of the erotic tale Achtung Blitzkrieg, my first book. Read an excerpt and see Lars Krantz's amazing illustrations here. 
And please support my project by making a donation, preorder a signed copy of the book or maybe one of the original drawings in black & white by Lars Krantz (see perks to the right). 

                                                                            * 



"Den hårdaste svenska porrprosan sedan "Jägarna på Karinhall"!"                              Jakob Abrahamsson, Non Stop Entertainment

"Riktigt snuskigt och härligt samt skrattfest!"                                                      Lois Hansson, verksamhetsutvecklare

"The perfect coffee table book"                                                                                 Yair Rubinstein

                                                                            *

Dethär är storyn: När jag fick Pär Thörn och Lars Krantz bok Äganderätten måste ständigt omförhandlas i mina händer på bokmässan 2014 blev jag väldigt exalterad: en bok om en SS-dolks väg genom tid och rum via dess olika innehavare – vilket genidrag! Och vilka illustrationer! 

Men, sa jag till Pär, med tanke på att SS-dolken är en sådan uppenbar fetisch är det ju konstigt att det inte är något sex i boken. Jag ska skriva en porrversion! Gör det, sa Pär.  

Resultatet är, att döma av mina vänners reaktioner, både roligt, upphetsande och upprörande.

Äganderätten, som är en resa tillbaka i tiden, börjar med att polisarkivarien arkiverar SS-dolken, som använts vid ett självmord, och går och tar kafferast.

Det är efter den kafferasten som Achtung Blitzkrieg tar vid...   

                                                                         *

Achtung Blitzkrieg kommer att tryckas i en liten och begränsad upplaga. Det är en häftad bok i kvadratiskt format  (ca 22 x 22 cm) på 32 sidor där samtliga illustrationer är tecknade som uppslag. 

Målet är att få ihop 10 000 kronor. Men med 20 000 kronor utkommer boken i en betydligt finare och lyxigare version med ett högintressant nyskrivet efterord. 

Achtung Blitzkrieg ges ut av mig i samarbete med Apart förlag. 

Den innehåller material som av vissa kan uppfattas som stötande och ingår inte i Aparts ordinarie utgivning, utan är en indie-utgåva som distribueras genom Apart. 

Achtung Blitzkrieg kommer att finnas i butik från och med hösten 2015.  Den kommer dock att finnas till försäljning redan på Bokmässan i Göteborg (24-27 september) i SF-bokhandelns monter (A02:42). Jag kommer även att presentera boken i Aftonbladet Kulturs monter (B07:40), samt delta i ett samtal om erotisk litteratur med Carl-Michael Edenborg och Åsa Linderborg lördagen den 26/9 kl 17-17.20. Missa inte det!    

                                                                         *

Jenny Högström är kulturskribent, översättare och författare, med en särskild förkärlek för perversioner. Hon skriver bland annat för Aftonbladet Kultur & HD/Sydsvenskan. Detta är hennes första bok.  

Lars Krantz debuterade med serieboken Dödvatten och håller för tillfället på med den tredje och fjärde boken i sin Svarta Jorden-svit. Han älskar rollspel, serier och skräck. Han vill göra seriernas motsvarighet till ett The Sisters of Mercy-album.

                                                                         *

Här några detaljer ur illustrationerna (originalen finns alltså att köpa här till höger – och kan ses i sin helhet här): 

SS-mannen och motståndskvinnan 1:


SS-mannen och motståndskvinnan 2:


Bankrånet 1: 


Satanisten 1:


Polisarkivarien 1:


Holländska groupies:


Orgie 1:


Orgie 2:



Alla som stöder boken kommer att få sitt ex signerat av både mig och Lars, ett skäl så gott som något. Men det finns också ekonomiska skäl:  

a) Till att börja med kommer en större del av köpesumman att gå direkt till förlaget – utan att tunnas ut via en massa mellanhänder som tar procent och provision. 

b) På så sätt kan vi snabbare nå break even – vilket innebär att fler smala och alternativa projekt av den här typen kan ges ut.

c) Sist men inte minst: Bokens båda upphovspersoner, Jenny Högström och Lars Krantz, kommer få en högre royalty-ersättning i och med punkt a). 
(Satsar du dessutom på ett av Lars Krantz original kan hans ersättning rent av hamna i närheten av en skälig timlön.)   

OBS! De som stöder projektet kommer att få sina rewards på posten kort efter Bokmässan! Om man råkar vara på Bokmässan kan, och hör av sig i god tid i förväg, kan man hämta sin(a) reward(s) i SF-bokhandelns monter (A02:42). 

Ett stort tack till alla som hjälper till att göra detta vansinnesprojekt möjligt!

story:
Hi, my name is George Goodwin and I am an illustrator based in the UK. I have a strong environmentally conscious ethic that I try to illuminate thematically within my work. 

Having just completed my first book 'Don't Shoot the Long Tailed Tiger.' I now need help in self publishing the release. I have tried to create the biggest and most vibrant book, with the highest quality whilst still keeping it as cheap as possible. The book is A4 in size and paper back.

As a contributor you will help bring this project to life and your support will allow me to self publish the book and help me follow my dreams and continue creating illustrations that will in turn raise awareness towards our dwindling natural environment and increasing number of extinct wild animals. I will be donating 10% from each book sold to the League Against Cruel Sports, a charity that is fighting back against trophy hunting.

The books sold during this campaign will be signed and numbered limited first editions. These editions will only be available for the duration of the campaign.

If you would like to see more images and videos of the book take a look at my Instagram page @omgidrawedit

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

The funds donated to the campaign will go directly into to paying for the printing and the manufacture of the specific perks available. 

£300 will go to printing the first 100 copies. If more than 100 are sold then the extra money will continue to fund the printing costs for more copies. 

£115 will go into creating enamel pins.

£75 will be for digital prints and stickers.

Original artworks will be at cost to me.

10% of each book sale will be donated to The League Against Cruel Sports.

 

The Impact

 

Hopefully many of the people that choose to donate to my campaign will be fans of my illustration that are from the various corners of the internet and social media that I use to show my work. Many of you will have seen the hard work and dedication that it has taken to complete this project and are willing to help learn and show others the importance of protecting nature and our environment. 

This book is a big step and risk for me as I push into my career as an illustrator. I'd love to reach out and show you all what i've been up and hopefully you will enjoy the book and continue following me on my journey in the future!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you don't have the funds at the moment to support my campaign, but would still like to help me reach my goal, please take the time to share the project on Facebook and any other social media platforms. If you have friends or family members that you think may be interested but aren't connected with me then let them know about this! Finally if any of you work in or know any publishing houses then please get in touch with me. I'd love to take this book a step further!

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
Hi, my name is George Goodwin and I am an illustrator based in the UK. I have a strong environmentally conscious ethic that I try to illuminate thematically within my work. 
Having just completed my first book 'Don't Shoot the Long Tailed Tiger.' I now need help in self publishing the release. I have tried to create the biggest and most vibrant book, with the highest quality whilst still keeping it as cheap as possible. The book is A4 in size and paper back.
As a contributor you will help bring this project to life and your support will allow me to self publish the book and help me follow my dreams and continue creating illustrations that will in turn raise awareness towards our dwindling natural environment and increasing number of extinct wild animals. I will be donating 10% from each book sold to the League Against Cruel Sports, a charity that is fighting back against trophy hunting.
The books sold during this campaign will be signed and numbered limited first editions. These editions will only be available for the duration of the campaign.
If you would like to see more images and videos of the book take a look at my Instagram page @omgidrawedit
 

What I Need & What You Get
 
The funds donated to the campaign will go directly into to paying for the printing and the manufacture of the specific perks available. 
£300 will go to printing the first 100 copies. If more than 100 are sold then the extra money will continue to fund the printing costs for more copies. 
£115 will go into creating enamel pins.
£75 will be for digital prints and stickers.
Original artworks will be at cost to me.
10% of each book sale will be donated to The League Against Cruel Sports.
 

The Impact
 
Hopefully many of the people that choose to donate to my campaign will be fans of my illustration that are from the various corners of the internet and social media that I use to show my work. Many of you will have seen the hard work and dedication that it has taken to complete this project and are willing to help learn and show others the importance of protecting nature and our environment. 
This book is a big step and risk for me as I push into my career as an illustrator. I'd love to reach out and show you all what i've been up and hopefully you will enjoy the book and continue following me on my journey in the future!
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
If you don't have the funds at the moment to support my campaign, but would still like to help me reach my goal, please take the time to share the project on Facebook and any other social media platforms. If you have friends or family members that you think may be interested but aren't connected with me then let them know about this! Finally if any of you work in or know any publishing houses then please get in touch with me. I'd love to take this book a step further! Thank you!

story:
About PROXY...

PROXY #1 is a 32-page comic book telling the story of a body hacker or PROXY as she does her best to try and evade the law and just do her damn job... However, she soon finds out her dangerous lifestyle might be catching up with her. In this city, nobody can be trusted. PROXY #1 is part one in a four part cyberpunk comic series set in some mega-city, set in some future dystopia. The series was shaped from the creators love of asian iconography, cyberpunk and body horror.If you're a fan of Akira, Ghost in The Shell and Black Mirror then PROXY will be something you’ll definitely enjoy.

PROXY came about due to a previously failed project and falling out with another creator. However, after some serious re writes and some serious revamps, PROXY is now ready to be published and distributed to the world. 

For this Indiegogo campaign, we target to use the funds to print and ship PROXY #1 to readers all around the world. The funds generated will also allow the artist to not only devote more time to illustrating PROXY #2, but help her start her own art company with her fellow Sydney artists. 

 

SO ...If you find yourself drawn to the following...

Stories that feature robots, androids, body mod, future tech and dystopian futures that for reasons unknown, resemble Japan /Hong Kong

Cyber Punk anime like Ghost in the Shell, Akira and Ergo Proxy

Movies like Blade Runner, The Thing, The Matrix and Tetsuo: The Iron Man .

You're going to have a BLAST.

 

Rewards

Supporting PROXY comic book means you’ll get a copy of our story! This 32-page comic book will not only be SIGNED, but also feature a behind the scenes look at the concept sketches and designs from the author’s sketchbook herself.Feeling generous and thirsting for some pretty sick merch? A higher perk at $25 entails these amazing badges and variant posters as well. 

Feeling more generous? Check out this sick ass PROXY t shirt you can get at the FEATURED Tier along with all of the other merch from the tiers above.

 

Premium Perks

If you go for the $100  tier, we will ship you a personally hand drawn and inked headshot of a character in PROXY along with all of the rewards from the previous tiers. 

Lastly, at $250, a full on painting of PROXY.  

Goals 

4000 USD is our target goal. This amount will mostly cover paying for the printing and shipping of the comic book along with all the other kickass merchandise. If we exceed our financial goal, funds will go to the production of PROXY #2! 

Final Thoughts

I'm very excited to finally get this project off the ground, it's been almost a year in the making and a real labor of love. I wasn’t paid to make this and the look and vibe of the comic needed a lot of research and study so if I can make a few bucks in the end I’d be more than grateful. Thank you all so much!

 

Get Updates about PROXY#1 here :

https://m.facebook.com/comicbyangelawu/

https://www.instagram.com/li_vermin_il/

story:
thee Rowhouse Residency 

I'm passing the hat. If you want to use PayPal Go to http://fundrazr.com/d1Gjk6?ref=ab_16oi89

The Rowhouse Residency in Pittsburgh has been going on for a little over a year now. It's really mutated me. Having "my school" operating and having students come through my door and see me working on my book has changed me. What's the book I'm doing, you ask? I'm doing a comic book memoir about my parents for my French publisher. It will come out in France in a few months.

Since late last year I have been working on this memoir. Well, for years really in stops and starts. Then when the school, the residency, got going last year it really settled me down into a solid routine. My job, as I saw it, was to provide an example to the residents of how to use time and make comics over a longterm schedule. Deadlines and having a daily practice is the name of the game for me and the school. And that is precisely what I was able to communicate to my students in this first full year of the residency.

I made my soft deadline of July 4th 2017 and am now working on revisions as well as the French translation. See, it comes out in France first. In French. But I wrote it in English. So now it is translated and I am re-lettering it in French.

Meanwhile, my parents, want to read the book. They know I have been working on this book for a few years. They're ready. Did I mention that they are divorced and don't talk to each other? Yeah, so there's that. 

So, I sat them down separately and read the book to them. They hated it! Well, not really, but if this is the movie of their life, both of them couldn't help talking back to the movie screen. And I had to be the annoyed usher who told them to keep it down while the movie was playing. Seriously. 

OK, they didn't hate it. But how would you feel if your child drew a comic book about your life when you were 19 years old. Lots of embarassing stories get told. That's just the way it has to be.

Truth is, they loved the book. Well, they loved the unbound original art pages, which are what I carefully presented and read to them. And each asked when they could read it "as a book" and have a copy of the book.

I'd like them to read the book again - in private, in their own homes. I'd like them to be able to flip through the pages and reflect on the memories of our family. This is really made for them, and by presenting them with these printed versions I hope I can make that clear them.

I explained to them that it has to come out first in French and then it will be published in English "in a couple years".

My Dad asked, "I have to wait two years before I can read it as a book?" I replied yes, essentially, it will be roughly two years or so before it is published in English." "Bummer", he said.

Indeed. 

So, here we are. 

I have a good friend is an expert bookbinder. They said they could teach me how to make a handmade book that looks and lasts better than any book currently made by a machine. "Kettle stitch" they call it. Apparently this was how all lenghty books were made, by hand, by stacking the signatures and sewing them in a "kettle stitch" fashion. Now when you get a great big book bound at the overseas printer, it often falls apart after one reading. Most book bindings are done with glue. If it is small enough you can "saddle stitch", which is oftena fancy expression for stapling. So, if you can staple it because it is too thick, you usually settle for a glue binding. Well, I'm only going to settle for a kettle stitch, and that is going to take time and money.

Money to hire my friend to teach me how to do it and then of course my time to do it. However, it dawned on me that this is precisely the skill I should be offering my students and residents here at the school. There are many small press printers, but only a few small press binders. Maybe we could take a different approach simply in order to avoid glue bindings for larger works. It might work.

So, I'm passing the hat. I don't have any money to spare for such a personal project. The crowdfund money for the house from a few years ago is still propping up the house. This money will go into making two copies of the book, one for each of my parents. Any leftover money will go into bookbinding materials for the residency.

I'm asking for $2600. Here's the breakdown: Ink for my home printer is $600. Bookbinding materials are $100. Hiring my friend to teach me how to "kettle stitch", nine 3 hour sessions, is $900. My time for doing this project, which might take 6 months, is $1000.

RE perks: Each PDF is carefully curated with my favorite posts and includes a new intro by me. I've been writing about comics and posting comics online for many years, but sometimes I worry my online archive isn't accessible or well maintained. I don't want the Cold Heat blog, which I've maintained since 2008, to disappear if Blogspot is deleted tomorrow! So a secondary goal of this project is to produce a more polished, archival version of the online work I've made over the years. I think this is an important part of my artistic output and so I'm excited to reintroduce it to my fans.

If 200 people buy one $10 pdf, I'm set. Lots of good stuff to choose from. All available immediately. 

Thanks for looking. Over and out.

Frank Santoro

----------

story:
Hello, I'm Alex A, one of a member of the project team for the fundraising of the company G33KLANDIA. I am a business school graduate who decided to follow his dreams and embark on the entrepreneurship boat to achieve them.

About my dream, what about it? This is to offer a leisure space where the people who are commonly called "geeks" could meet and exchange about comics books but also video games and while getting refreshing beverages.

The project to which my future investors will participate is of utmost importance to the extent that they will not finance only the dream of a young graduate, but above all an attractive and profitable project that will bring them an interesting return on investment.

To begin our operations, we will need the sum of $ 6,000 in order to purchase the items that will be present in our shop and that will allow us to provide the quality service we want to provide our valued customers.

As compensation offered to investors, it will be free tickets to enjoy a preview of the use of the service. These will be an overview of how we will treat our dear customers and that is something priceless.

To the extent that the funding target will not be met, the funds will be donated to charitable organizations, with a view to somehow make feedback to the community.

As explained earlier the company G33KLANDIA is primarily a recreation area for fans of comics and video games. The latter will be able to meet and interact, organize events such as hackhatons, video games competitions or organized quizzes on their knowledge of comics universe. A refreshing drinks offer (hot & cold drinks) will be offered to customers who want to take advantage of this service provision.

Project investors will not only fund a dream, but a profitable project done by people passionate about what they do. This in itself is a guarantee against the risk of declining employee motivation and also the employees will handle much of the business they have funded.

The project already has a well-developed business plan that will reassure all investors of the viability of the project. In that case, why hesitate to invest in G33KLANDIA?

As the level of project risk is concerned, we can say that this is a project that, although there are risks but the project is less risky than others because it is innovative. Because of that they will be nullifyed not only by the innovative nature of the project but also by the rigor of established planning for the project.

On the other hand, there are still plenty of challenges for the company that is to succeed in getting a spot in the highly competitive market of the city of Abidjan. However, this does not constitute an insurmountable obstacle to the extent that the team that has the company's very dynamic and ready to accomplish all the tasks to be done to ensure the success of the project.

Even if you can not participate in investing in the project, you can always get the message around you in order to attract investors who might be interested in a profitable project directed masterfully by a passionate team.

story:
Printed editions and ebook 's have been mailed and emailed... Thank you so much for your support!

When you receive an email from me with a link to download your ebook version of Invariant, I will include information on how to upgrade your ebook to a printed one for only $15.00 plus actual shipping. 

For those who will receive a signed print from me...I will include instructions in the email with the ebook on how to do that. 

Thank you again for your wonderful support!!!

Andrea


How much DNA evidence is needed for a person to be recognized as a person?

The premise of this graphic novel is that of a young girl recruited by the military in the near future to be a soldier. The technological advancements make it possible for battlefield medics to use biomechanical and emergency medical triage in an infusion on site. The combination of flesh and metal makes a generation of people supreme soldiers…but what happens after the war is over? 

The story follows the young soldier in her journey from the battlefields to indentured servitude in the home of a retired general who brings the war home with him against his own family. The future is a place of fantastic sights and advancements but the problems that have plagued humanity for thousands of years have not gone away. Issues such as slavery, child abuse, bullying, and who deserves human rights are all things that concern us today and will tomorrow. 

  • Every page will be as detailed as the next there will be no disappointment when you open this book, every page has full attention given to it.
  • The book will be formatted for mobile applications such as the Kindle for example. Paperback and Hardback versions will be available as well in varying sizes.
 
In the perks section to the right and below lists all the goodies you will receive if you decide to donate to this project.
With every donation from this site that I receive I will donate 10% to the Fred Hutchison Cancer Research Center in Seattle, Washington.
 

 My mothers battle with Leukemia continues and without places like Hutch the last eight years of her life would have been impossible. As most things in life, nothing ever happens at a good time, I recently graduated from Portland State University with a Criminal Justice Degree but traveling between states to spend time with my family has made it not possible to be employed at the same time, so I started working on this book to perhaps able to show my mom that no matter what happens, everything is going to be alright and she won’t have to worry.

Donations from this site will go toward finishing the book, promoting it and sending the perks out and if anything is left over to spend more time with my mom.
 
Every donation of 10.00 or more will receive a copy of the eBook when it‘s finished!

On with the perks….

 

 I just did a small run of prints from the book in 8x10s and 8x20s and they came out fantastic, the 16x20s are sure to be outstanding.  I will update the site on the progress of the test print runs, so far it's looking beautiful. 

5 Prints to choose from!

Images that are 8x20s can replace donations with 16x20 prints on request.

The paperback and hardbacks will be of a good size more that of an art book then a typical graphic novel.

I hope to have the book completed by December 2012.  I will be in the Portland, Oregon area from July 4th to late October.  Then back to Indiana for a while, hopefully looking at a Jan 2013 release for the book.

Please visit my facebook and send your friends to visit!

http://www.facebook.com/andreawriter77
story_txt:
Printed editions and ebook 's have been mailed and emailed... Thank you so much for your support!
When you receive an email from me with a link to download your ebook version of Invariant, I will include information on how to upgrade your ebook to a printed one for only $15.00 plus actual shipping.  
For those who will receive a signed print from me...I will include instructions in the email with the ebook on how to do that.  
Thank you again for your wonderful support!!!
Andrea

How much DNA evidence is needed for a person to be recognized as a person?

The premise of this graphic novel is that of a young girl recruited by the military in the near future to be a soldier. The technological advancements make it possible for battlefield medics to use biomechanical and emergency medical triage in an infusion on site. The combination of flesh and metal makes a generation of people supreme soldiers…but what happens after the war is over? 
The story follows the young soldier in her journey from the battlefields to indentured servitude in the home of a retired general who brings the war home with him against his own family. The future is a place of fantastic sights and advancements but the problems that have plagued humanity for thousands of years have not gone away. Issues such as slavery, child abuse, bullying, and who deserves human rights are all things that concern us today and will tomorrow. 


Every page will be as detailed as the next there will be no disappointment when you open this book, every page has full attention given to it.



The book will be formatted for mobile applications such as the Kindle for example. Paperback and Hardback versions will be available as well in varying sizes.

 
In the perks section to the right and below lists all the goodies you will receive if you decide to donate to this project.

With every donation from this site that I receive I will donate 10% to the  Fred Hutchison Cancer Research Center in Seattle, Washington.


 
 My mothers battle with Leukemia continues and without places like Hutch the last eight years of her life would have been impossible. As most things in life, nothing ever happens at a good time, I recently graduated from Portland State University with a Criminal Justice Degree but traveling between states to spend time with my family has made it not possible to be employed at the same time, so I started working on this book to perhaps able to show my mom that no matter what happens, everything is going to be alright and she won’t have to worry.
Donations from this site will go toward finishing the book, promoting it and sending the perks out and if anything is left over to spend more time with my mom.
 
Every donation of 10.00 or more will receive a copy of the eBook when it‘s finished!

On with the perks….
 
 I just did a small run of prints from the book in 8x10s and 8x20s and they came out fantastic, the 16x20s are sure to be outstanding.  I will update the site on the progress of the test print runs, so far it's looking beautiful. 
5 Prints to choose from!

The paperback and hardbacks will be of a good size more that of an art book then a typical graphic novel.
I hope to have the book completed by December 2012.  I will be in the Portland, Oregon area from July 4th to late October.  Then back to Indiana for a while, hopefully looking at a Jan 2013 release for the book.
Please visit my facebook and send your friends to visit!
http://www.facebook.com/andreawriter77

story:
Short Summary

Genesis. We have a brilliant idea. 

Like many tech savvy entrepreneurs we turn to Kickstarter to bring the idea to fruition. 

After much research we understand the necessity of creating a professional campaign in order to be successfully funded. 

Problem. We have no funds to create a professional caliber campaign. 

Solution. Please see video above. 

The State of Affairs

   * We are in the midst of a great game.

   * Follow the rules, exchange widgets for wallops, set up social media sites to self monitor, and determine to make yourself better than others - borrow if necessary.

   * Redeem points with a plastic game card issued from bank scoring institutions.

Your Contributions Matter Because It Makes...

A. Successful campaign 

B. Successful campaign pays for creation of pretty good Kickstarter production. 

C. Pretty good Kickstarter production makes for successful Kickstarter campaign. 

D. Successful Kickstarter campaign makes our brilliant idea become reality. 

  * If you thought this video was okay, be prepared for more and a little better. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Send the campaign to someone you don't like. 
  • Drink five glasses of water everyday. You're grumpy because you are dehydrated.

story:
Quick Links & Important Info

Shipping for your perk needs to be added manually. Please review the cost of shipping your perk HERE or in the perk description before you finalize your contribution amount. You can change the contribution amount at the bottom of the
"Step 1: Perk & Amount" section.

For example: If you choose the $25 Espresso Package and you live in the United States, the shipping is $10. Change your perk amount to $35 and proceed through the checkout.

I have a PayPal Merchant account. You can pay for your Starcrossed perk via PayPal with your PayPal account OR your MasterCard, Visa or American Express all through my PayPal checkout. Thanks for the support! 

Hi folks!
Welcome to the Starcrossed: Volume 1 Indiegogo campaign. If you’re new to my work, Starcrossed is a weekly comic strip that I have been drawing since 2009. The comic follows single thirty-something Charlie Decker and his loveable blue alien roommate Sam as they navigate the cosmos of dating in the internet age. After nearly three years it’s finally time to bundle Charlie, Sam and my love of comic strips into a book for everyone to enjoy. This is where you and Indiegogo come in. With your support, Starcrossed: Volume 1 can become a reality!

I've outlined the details of the project below and I will be posting a video soon. Please feel free to get in touch with me if you have any questions.

Thanks for reading!

More about me and my online shenanigans here:

StarcrossedOnline.com
@joelduggan on Twitter
Google+ Page
The Starcrossed Facebook Fan Page 

Volume 1
This is my first book, but I feel like I have been planning for it since I was in high school pouring over my favorite comic books. Starcrossed: Volume 1 is a traditional comic strip collection with a few tweaks. The book is a 6” x 9” paperback with over 80 pages of content including never before published sketches of Charlie, Sam, other favorite characters and of course lots and lots of comic strips! Starcrossed: Volume 1 will be printed on high quality paper, black and white comics inside and a glossy color cover.

For You. By You
Over the past three years the greatest reward for drawing Starcrossed has been you, the readers. With your continued support, my long time goal of publishing my own book can become a reality. Funds received will be used to print and ship Starcrossed: Volume 1, for an estimated October release date.

Inside
Here’s a quick look at some of what you will see in Starcrossed: Volume 1. Click to enlarge.




Get Your Perk On: Package Details


Available Original Comics
All of the available original Starcrossed comics are listed in the table below. Indiegogo pledges will be time stamped. Any Pumpkin Spice Latte or Big Bean packages will be honored on a first come, first serve bases with regards to choosing your original Starcrossed comic. I will keep this document as up to date as possible.

Available Original Starcrossed Comics Doc

More info on Starcrossed Original Comic Strip Art


Through the air. Across the ocean.
All shipping and handling has been divided into Canadian, US and International costs for each perk package. Shipping must be added to your perk manually. Using the table below, line up your perk package with its destination and follow the grid to the shipping amount. Add the shipping amount to your contribution at the bottom of the "Step 1: Perk & Amount" section.

For example: If you choose the $25 Espresso Package and you live in the United States, the shipping is $10. Change your perk amount to $35 and proceed through the checkout.

If you have already contributed and forget to add shipping to your perk? No problem! Use the FORGOT YOUR SHIPPING perk to add it. Claim the perk and change the total contribution amount to the appropirate shipping cost.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Following the table below, the shipping cost of the Espresso Package to the USA is $10.00.

story:
About this project.

 

Hello, my name is James Gilarte. I'm the writer and creator of the webcomic series Vengador, which I have been writing for the last 2 years. I have spent majority of this year working on a new book titled "D.I.D" which is a psychological thriller that focuses on a young girl who developes multiple peronsalities. In this book we see how someone with this condition is affected as well as how it affects their friends and family. We get to dive in and explore the human psyche in a way that has never been done before and see what happens when a person struggles with their inner demons. My artist Rowel Roquel is working hard on the art to this book - each week turning in more and more pages of awesome art.

 

I would like to make a nice paperback trade of this novel and have it distributed through out as many shops as possible for everyone to have the opportunity to read it. Writing is a passion of mine and I want to share my ideas and stories to as many people as possible in the world. I need $3500 to complete a small print run of this book and need your help to make this a project a reality.

 

I will be keeping keeping everyone who contributes up to date with the latest progress stages of the book as well as uploading images of the art at different stages, all the way from concept to final versions. Of course anyone who helps contribute to this project will recieve some awesome perks as a thank you from me. 

 

Vengador Comics

James Gilarte

Enough talk. Let's see some work.


Below are several images from the first chapter of the book including the cover.

Here is the final version for the cover of "D.I.D" (Which I love!!!!)

 

Page 6 Inked:


Page 9 Inked:

 

Page 9 - Colored

 

 

Page 10 - Roughs


Page 10 - Inked:


Page 10 - Colored:

Page 16 - Colored

Page 17 - Colored:

I would like to thank you for viewing this project which I hope you can help make a reality!

 

Thanks you

 

James Gilarte

story:
Hello, 

My name is Beldan Sezen and I am a graphic novelist. 

I live in Amsterdam where I freelance as a videographer, caretaker and image manipulator. Flexible jobs which allow me to draw and write my stories. 

My first short story "A Girl Named Halt", published as a matchbox booklet in 2009, has by now become a collector's item. My first book, Zakkum: A Graphic Murder Mystery, was published last year by Treehouse Press in London.

Currently I am working on my second book, "Snapshots of a Girl" which will be published by Becco Giallo in 2013. 

Snapshots of a Girl is a graphic novel about my coming out years in Germany, Turkey, Amsterdam and the US; about what it is to be a young woman growing up in islamic and christian societies finding her sexual identity.  

I was happy and proud when Becco Giallo, a small independent publishing house based in Padova/Italy, asked me to publish my graphic memoir with them. To finish this book in time I must focus fully on it for the upcoming months. And here is where you come in:

I am on my way to telling a wonderful and unique story. And I am telling it in a way that'll grab you right away, very intense and honest. As my friend Bouwine puts it: "I love your simple and very direct tone that comes straight from your heart. You make it palpable what it is to be a young woman looking for her identity in a society where you are by definition not accepted: the confusion, shame, denial and grief which arise from that. 

What works well is that each memory-fragment stands on its own, and all together create a sense of a whole life. I love your variety of drawings, the comic style in some, and the more mood-setting ones!"

Your support will allow me to accomplish my goal. To make sure that I can work intensely and without interruption for the three month so that I can met the publisher's schedule.

Any amount you see fit to donate will allow me to focus full-time in the month of February, March and April of 2013.

 

The perks I offer you together with a big fat "Thank you!" are handmade gifts  "materialized" from the Snapshots of a Girl comic world.

They'll give you an insider's glimpse into the Girl's world through eating, reading or through a kind greeting simply received through looking at your refrigerator each and every morning.

 

 

 Snap 1: 

As a Thank You you will recieve the Snapshot of a Girl magnet!

  

 

 

 

Snap 2:

The Girl's ABC-cookies! A box of home-made cookies specially baked for you. Read your cookies before munching...

*Caution: animal-free.

 

 

 

 Snap 3: 

You get a signed print of one of the yet unpublished Snapshots of a Girl pages!

 

 

 

 

Snap 4:

A silkscreened Snapshot on handmade paper of the Girl's artwork. Ready to be signed, rolled and posted to you! 

Limited edition only available during the campaign.

 

 

 

 

Snap 5:

You will make an appereance in Snapshots of a Girl. I will draw you into the book as a comic character!

 

 

 

 

 

plus 1 EXTRA: 

As a Thank You everyone will recieve the pocket-sized Snapshot of a Girl pamphlet!

 

 

 

 

To be perfectly clear, you're supporting me in the MAKING of the book. As such I invite you to be part of the process and share with you the world of the Girl.

In what ever way you can contribute, by donating or spreading the word, I do appreciate it!

 

Questions? Problems? Inquiries? Feel free to ask me anything.

 

                          *click* the button

 

 

 

The song you hear in the video is played by my friend Patrick on his Ukulele.

story:
HELP US PAY PROFESSIONAL RATES!

Short Summary

Once funds have been raised, open submissions will begin and a deadline will be announced.

In the Hour of Our Death is an apocalyptic anthology of stories focusing on how people respond when facing death, when the chips are down, when there are no choices left. What do they do? Are they brave? Cowards? Loyal? Self-serving? The stories may involve zombies, Cthulhu or other Mythos characters, or any other type of apocalyptic or post-apocalyptic scenario. Stories may also explore these scenarios from different cultural, political and religious viewpoints. The pay rate is .05 cents a word up to 3,000 words. Longer works may be submitted, but please note that the pay rate is capped at 3,000 words. Contributors will also receive both electronic and print copies, as outlined in the contracts.

In the Hour of Our Death, edited by Nancy O. Greene, is the first anthology by Unpopular Publications — the brainchild of Jeffrey L. Shipley. "UnPop" is a new publisher dedicated to clawing at the boundaries of storytelling. Since achieving success with its first venture, Tales of Blood and Roses (a beautiful zine of dark fiction, poetry and artwork), Unpopular Publications has expanded to bring its audience more of what they want. Horror and dark tales of massive proportions.

While many successful anthologies featuring apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic stories have been published, there are few on the marketplace that also feature comics as part of the package. With this work, Editor Nancy O. Greene and Publisher Jeffrey L. Shipley aim to bridge the gap between the written word and the visual representation.

Confirmed Contributors To Date

Bram Stoker Award-winning writer and instructor Thomas F. Monteleone heads the successful Borderlands Press, which has published multiple novels and short stories by writers like Peter Straub, Brian Keene and F. Paul Wilson. He is the author of over 30 books, hundreds of short stories and countless articles, including the best-seller The Idiot's Guide to Writing a Novel and The Mothers and Fathers Italian Association, a collection of articles from his column regularly published in the popular dark fiction magazine Cemetery Dance.

R. Thomas Riley is the author of the short story collection The Monster Within Idea (2009-2011), published by Hugo-nominated Apex Publications and re-released as a Kindle exclusive in 2011. His second story collection, Their Last Dying Acts, was released in July 2012; and Husks was released in August 2012. If God Doesn’t Show - a Gibson Blount novel (co-written with John Grover) - was published by Permuted Press and Audible.com in August 2012. The Flesh of Fallen Angels - a Gibson Blount novella (co-written with Roy C. Booth) - was published by Grand Mal Press in February 2012. Diaphanous (co-written with Roy C. Booth) is available now on Kindle. The Day Lufberry Won It All was adapted to short film by Frosty Moon Omnimedia in 2010.

Publisher

Jeffrey L. Shipley served in the United States Air Force as an Airman in the Middle East during Desert Shield and Desert Storm. Since then, he has taken his love for writing and art and created the popular and critically-acclaimed zine, Tales of Blood and Roses. Unpopular Publications sprang up from that first venture. As the creative force behind UnPop, Mr. Shipley strives to provide audiences with the type of horror fiction, poetry and artwork they love. He has or will have work in Smile, Hon, You’re in Baltimore!; Tales of Blood and Roses; Rhyme and PUN-ishment; and KamiKaze Woman. In the Hour of Our Death, the first anthology from Unpopular Publications, will be of the same standard which The Examiner called “exceptional, post-normal, bleeding-edge quality.”

Editor

Nancy O. Greene started writing at the age of nine. Her short story collection, Portraits in the Dark, received a brief mention in The Year's Best Fantasy and Horror 2007. Other works have appeared or will appear in FEARnet.com; ChiZine; Lovecraft eZine; Cemetery Dance; Tales of Blood and Roses; Haunted: 11 Tales of Ghostly Horror; Shroud Publishing's The Terror at Miskatonic Falls; Dark Recesses; Flames Rising; Smile, Hon, You're in Baltimore!; and others. She has a BA in Cinema (Critical Studies) and a minor in English (Creative Writing) from the University of Southern California, and is a Film Independent: Project Involve Fellow.

Artists

Tyrell Hill & Kat Miller.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised will be used to:

  • Pay the contributors professional rates
  • Pay the artists
  • Promote the anthology
  • Release a limited amount of print copies
  • The book also will be available in electronic format

Shipping costs will be included for all domestic donations.

For your support you will receive many awesome thanks, as well as the perks listed.

See our websites, http://www.unpopularpublications.com and http://www.talesofbloodandroses.com for more details on our publications.

Also visit the anthology's Facebook Page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hour-of-Our-Death-anthology/160951070695146.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may also let people know about our campaign. Promote it on your Facebook pages and your Twitter accounts, your websites and at your events. Whatever, wherever, just get the word out! Thanks!

"UnPop" is a new publisher dedicated to clawing at the boundaries of storytelling. Since achieving success with its first venture, Tales of Blood and Roses (a beautiful zine of dark fiction, poetry and artwork), Unpopular Publications has expanded to bring its audience more of what they want. Horror and dark tales of massive proportions.
While many successful anthologies featuring apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic stories have been published, there are few on the marketplace that also feature comics as part of the package. With this work, Editor Nancy O. Greene and Publisher Jeffrey L. Shipley aim to bridge the gap between the written word and the visual representation.


Confirmed Contributors To Date
Bram Stoker Award-winning writer and instructor Thomas F. Monteleone heads the successful Borderlands Press, which has published multiple novels and short stories by writers like Peter Straub, Brian Keene and F. Paul Wilson. He is the author of over 30 books, hundreds of short stories and countless articles, including the best-seller The Idiot's Guide to Writing a Novel and The Mothers and Fathers Italian Association, a collection of articles from his column regularly published in the popular dark fiction magazine Cemetery Dance.
R. Thomas Riley is the author of the short story collection The Monster Within Idea (2009-2011), published by Hugo-nominated Apex Publications and re-released as a Kindle exclusive in 2011. His second story collection, Their Last Dying Acts, was released in July 2012; and Husks was released in August 2012. If God Doesn’t Show - a Gibson Blount novel (co-written with John Grover) - was published by Permuted Press and Audible.com in August 2012. The Flesh of Fallen Angels - a Gibson Blount novella (co-written with Roy C. Booth) - was published by Grand Mal Press in February 2012. Diaphanous (co-written with Roy C. Booth) is available now on Kindle. The Day Lufberry Won It All was adapted to short film by Frosty Moon Omnimedia in 2010.
Publisher
Jeffrey L. Shipley served in the United States Air Force as an Airman in the Middle East during Desert Shield and Desert Storm. Since then, he has taken his love for writing and art and created the popular and critically-acclaimed zine, Tales of Blood and Roses. Unpopular Publications sprang up from that first venture. As the creative force behind UnPop, Mr. Shipley strives to provide audiences with the type of horror fiction, poetry and artwork they love. He has or will have work in Smile, Hon, You’re in Baltimore!; Tales of Blood and Roses; Rhyme and PUN-ishment; and KamiKaze Woman. In the Hour of Our Death, the first anthology from Unpopular Publications, will be of the same standard which The Examiner called “exceptional, post-normal, bleeding-edge quality.”
Editor
Nancy O. Greene started writing at the age of nine. Her short story collection, Portraits in the Dark, received a brief mention in The Year's Best Fantasy and Horror 2007. Other works have appeared or will appear in FEARnet.com; ChiZine; Lovecraft eZine; Cemetery Dance; Tales of Blood and Roses; Haunted: 11 Tales of Ghostly Horror; Shroud Publishing's The Terror at Miskatonic Falls; Dark Recesses; Flames Rising; Smile, Hon, You're in Baltimore!; and others. She has a BA in Cinema (Critical Studies) and a minor in English (Creative Writing) from the University of Southern California, and is a Film Independent: Project Involve Fellow.
Artists
Tyrell Hill & Kat Miller.



What We Need & What You Get
The funds raised will be used to:

Pay the contributors professional rates
Pay the artists
Promote the anthology
Release a limited amount of print copies
The book also will be available in electronic format

Shipping costs will be included for all domestic donations.
For your support you will receive many awesome thanks, as well as the perks listed.
See our websites, http://www.unpopularpublications.com and http://www.talesofbloodandroses.com for more details on our publications.
Also visit the anthology's Facebook Page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hour-of-Our-Death-anthology/160951070695146.
 
 



Other Ways You Can Help
You may also let people know about our campaign. Promote it on your Facebook pages and your Twitter accounts, your websites and at your events. Whatever, wherever, just get the word out! Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

In February of 2012, an enterprising young comics fan named Hannah found herself wishing for a community where she could talk to other awesome women about shared nerdy loves.  Thus, Ladies' Night at Graham Cracker Comics was born!

Two years later, and we are putting together the second volume of an anthology that features original comics from more than twenty-five contributors.  This volume explores the inescapable theme of death...with a side of corsages and tulle for prom.

What We Need & What You Get

To make all this awesomeness happen, we need some cash on hand to print the book and some amazing original artwork in the form of prints and buttons.  Your contribution to our $2000 goal will help us with:

  • First run print of Volume 2: Death and Prom.
  • Hundreds of buttons and prints to send to our campaign contributors and sell along with the book.
  • Marketing online and in person at events like C2E2 (Chicago Comics and Entertainment Expo) and Free Comic Book Day.

Any money left over will contribute to starting up a third (and fourth?) volume of the anthology as well as running our meetings--all of our contributors are volunteering their time and talent.

So check out our awesome perks! Contribute at any level and you get the PDF of the full anthology, but there's a bunch of amazing swag and art that is available.  We're even taking advertisers to help defer the cost of printing.

*Clarificiation: There have been some questions about the $10 perks.  You DO get the printed copy of the anthology at this level, sorry for any confusion!*

STRETCH GOAL:

$3000 will get a reprint of Volume 1: Chicago. We are currently down to a couple dozen copies of Volume 1, and if we reach $3000, everyone that contributes $50 or more will get a copy of Vol2 and a copy of Vol1 (or an extra print, if they prefer).

International supporters PLEASE NOTE: if you need to ship internationally, please add $10 to your contribution.

(If you contribute and your perk includes a button or print, you will be given an option of which of our varient three pieces of original artwork you would like to receive.)

The Impact

We all know that women and other minorities are grossly under-represented in mainstream comics.  The success of Womanthology and similar books prove that this doesn't need to be the case! Whether you exclusively read superhero titles from the Big Two or you're an avid webcomic fan, every fan wants a place to feel like they belong, surrounded by other enthusiasts.  Our goal is to continue our ongoing anthology that features the amazing talents of women who love comics in every form they come in, and the much-needed diversity that they have to offer to the industry.

Let's show the big guys how it's done.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily at this time, please help us spread the word!  We have a Facebook page and a website to tell you more about GCC Ladies' Night and our awesome community of readers.

Regardless, we hope to see you at our next Ladies' Night!

Our Contributors

A. Grenier
Aileen Nichols
Ali Gator
Alice Urbino
Anissa Espinosa
Brianna Parker
Caitlin Rosberg

Ellen Linzer
Elizabeth Fogarty
Emily Rosen
Hannah Chapman
Karen Burch
Kris Mackenzie
Lauren Burke

Lisa Kwon
Lydia Makepeace
Maureen Skaggs
Megan Byrd
Monica Ras
Rachel Simon
Raven A. Moore

Sarah Benkin
Shawnee
Shawnelle Gibbs
Shay Barron
Summer Sparacin
Wendi Freeman

story:
Marriage is for Suckers.... 

....is what we always said.  Well, guess what?  Things Change (cough taxes cough).  We DO still plan on throwing an out of control shindig in the years to come.  We want to celebrate our love with all of our loved ones, but we aren't going to ask you to foot that bill ;) 
However, we are hoping our friends and  family will come together and gift us with a little elopement.... This way our future party can be ceremony free (you're welcome).  

What's the Plan?

Let's Break down the deets: 

Originally our plan was to court house it up before the New Year.  It seemed drab, but doable.  As you all know, we've  been living on student loans and teensy bits of income while Tyler has been in school... so we knew any wedding would be very very minimal.  But on one of our morning walks, our dreams wandered to a sunny, kid free, paradise... And Vegas is cheap, right?  We could celebrate our love, just us, while legalizing things - and still plan to have a down right shindig for our loved ones in a few years!! Let's break down the basics:

Fly in and out of Vegas  - Pick up a marriage certificate  -  See a show  -  Eat buffet food  - Drink sugary liquor  -  Rent some bikes and ride through a drive-thru window  -  Lay by a pool without ANY children (NONE!)  - Fly home.  

Heaven. Help us get there?

Why should YOU pay for OUR wedding? 

Real Talk.  We merely want to give our friends and family the opportunity to send us away together to celebrate our love.  These donations will be our wedding gifts, and will be a HUGE success story for us in knowing how supported our relationship is and our marriage will be.  Because neither of us have ever had a want for 'things', we can not think of any better wedding gifts than these donations, and this trip together. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, but you still want to help us get to Vegas, please please share.  Maybe we will reach another family who has fought the 'battle' of life and come out stronger, happier, and even more in love. 

      And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to the Steampunk Apocalypse!

The OVERSIZED (8" x 10.88") Hardcover Edition of Last Ride of the 4 Horsemen - Cover by Rando Dixon, with colors, effects and logo by Gavin Michelli.

Last Ride of the 4 Horsemen is a Steampunk-Western comic book set in a world where the Apocalypse systematically eradicated human life, as monstrous Steampunk Horsemen destroyed food and water supplies and pitted the remaining, diseased peoples against one another in cannibalistic and genocidal wars.

Softcover Edition of Last Ride of the 4 Horsemen - Cover drawn and digitally painted by Gavin Michelli.

The Story

The core, 80-page story is the tale of Cager Dobbin, a local shootist, and his successive battles against the monstrous Horsemen who emerge, one by one, to destroy his town of Promise. Cager is assisted by the local tycoon who employs him, the mayor wed to this tycoon, and the town sheriff on the payroll of that same tycoon. Turns out, every Horseman attacking the town also has some strange connection to this very man. What power draws them there? And what power do they wield so destructively?

Also included is a 24-page set of Horsemen origin stories spotlighting the origins of three of these Horsemen - War, Famine & Pestilence - revealing how they turned from betrayed denizens of their little town of Promise into sinister Horsemen of the Apocalypse.

The Books 

Last Ride of the 4 Horsemen is a 116-page graphic novel written by Kevin LaPorte (Vicious Circus) and illustrated by Nathan Smith, Ari Arnaldsson, and Armando C. Rillo, Sr. Color art is by Gavin Michelli and Andrew Pate. The book is available in a digital (PDF) format and in two different physical formats:

The softcover graphic novel in standard comic size (6.625" x 10.25") under a digitally painted cover by Gavin Michelli featuring all Four Horsemen and autographed by writer Kevin LaPorte

The hardcover graphic novel in OVERSIZED (8" x 10.88") format under a cover by Rando Dixon (The Absentee) and digitally painted by Gavin Michelli and including autographs by Kevin and Rando.

The Interior Art

There are few to NO risks in the completion and fulfillment of this project. As the IndieGoGo campaign launches, this book is FULLY COMPLETE and has been submitted to our printer, so only fulfillment must be accomplished. We anticipate fulfillment will occur in mid- to late April, 2021. Printer delays are obviously beyond our control, but we are working with a high-end, reliable company that we are confident will deliver within the prescribed timeframe for fulfillment.

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! It's Kerrigan and William here to ask you guys to be a part our comic project, In God's Name. We are busily creating this good-lookin' comic (as you can see from the images on this page) but finding the funds to print it is another story. So help us! Click "Contribute Now" and be a part of one of the most awesomely bad-ass of awesomness-i-tude comics ever made!

What We Need & What You Get

All the funding we will receive will go towards the comic. Printing, copyright, equipment, and anything else we need along our journey of making the most fucking awesome comic in the history of god yes. You will be receiving such cool perks as: A No More Heroes poster which is totally bad-ass as fuck, like look at this shit: 

 

LIKE JESUS F**KING CHRIST HOW GOD DAMNED BAD-ASS IS THAT!? IT'S OFF THE MOTHER F**KING CHARTS. THAT'S HOW BAD-ASS.

The Impact

The impact you will make on this world could change the balance between the dark side and the jedi, like, do you not? You must understand that comics are the only thing keeping this world intact, without comics this world will crumble, and Kim Jong-Il will rise from the grave, to become Zombi-Is-Il and he'll destroy us all! You don't want Zombi-Is-Il to totally fuck our shit do you? No you don't, and by donating to this comic, you're preventing him from arising from the grave.

Other Ways You Can Help

Go tell your friends! Mention how amazingly bad-ass we are and how awesome this comic is going to be, just throw some pocket sand in their direction and they'll know what's up!

Your friend Will, and his beautiful girlfriend declare, don't be a dick.


The cover!
I came.

story:
Short Summary

Do you think about what Proto Indo European was like, or wonder what language they spoke in France before the Romans arrived? These are the kinds of questions that are what make language interesting. It's amazing that something as interesting as language can be made so dry by poor quality textbooks and unengaged teachers.

I aim to bring fun and humour to your language world. Did you know that the French word for "avocado" and "advocate" are the same? So in court, people are always talking about avocats, and you wouldn't know if they are talking about avocados or advocates, but I suppose you could make a good guess :)

Hi, by the way. My name is Rolf Weimar. I am a programmer by trade, but recently I have gotten into language more and more. I have always been interested in language, but never spent too much time in it. When I went freelance in 2014, I had plenty of time to spend much more time in language than I had before and I found that there is a lot of material here to make a great comic out of.

In 2015, I started making the Silly Linguistics comic and publishing it on Facebook. It was a good place to get my footing. Since then I have published over 50 comics and I plan to keep going. Social media is a great way to get the word out about a project, but I want to reach out even more, so I decided to come here to you guys.

I want to make a physical book version of my comics, but printing books is very expensive. Most of the cost comes in at the beginning where you need to get designers involved, you need to buy ISBN numbers and of course you need to pay for the printing of actual books.

I need your help to make this happen. With your contribution, I can get books out to people who really want them first, and then start selling them on online book stores like Amazon. While my website and my Facebook page is growing, it is simply not big enough yet to support this endeavour by itself, so I need your help in getting this book printed and into the hands of reader here on Indiegogo, but also all language fans around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $1000 for all the designing and printing that is needed to get this book off the ground. But it doesn't have to come all from on place. You can give a single $20 contribution and know that you will get a copy of the comic book as well as helping making this whole project a reality.

If you want to contribute more than $20, you will get some exclusive perks. Have you ever wanted a comic about a certain language or language topic but no one has ever done it before? Well, if you contribute $30, I will make a comic (with your name on it!) just for you and include it in the book. There are limited numbers of these of course. It would take too long to make lots and lots and lots of individualised comics. So get them while they're hot :)

If you want to help out even more, contribute $50 and get the book, with personalised comic and a tshirt from the Steve the vagabond tshirt store of your choice (check out our range at http://stevethevagabond.spreadshirt.com/)

For the truly generous contributor of $100, I will make a 30 minute video for you about a linguistic topic of your choice.

What's not to like about these perks? :)

The Impact

Before crowdfunding, things like this would simply not be possible. You would either have to raise of money yourself, or you would have to find a publisher willing to publish your book. But by going directly to language fans from around the world, we can get this comic book out to everyone who wants one and avoid any potential problems with publishers and third parties getting in the way.

I started Silly Linguistics on Facebook with a mission to provide a fun way of looking at language and that group has since grown to over 20 000 members and my page "Steve the vagabond and silly linguist" has gained over 30 000 likes. It has all been possible through languages fans everywhere and now you can make this next project a reality too!

Risks & Challenges

I feel in some ways I am pioneering new ground. People have made comics before, and people have made language textbooks before, but no one has tried to bring language information and comics together in this way. The challenges I see ahead are about convincing people that this is a worthwhile thing to do, and also change people's mind about how cool languages are.


I have already been receiving great comments on my page and on messsages to my page about how my approach has changed their mind about a lot of things. I hope to continue forging new ground in this very unexplored area. I hope you come along on the journey with me :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign, I completely understand. But this comic is really about the community of language fans that I have met from around the world. Tell them about the Silly Linguistics comic book and tell them what we are trying to do here. Maybe even just tell them how much fun language fans have with languages. Even that will be a great step forward in getting people to see language differently.
