What's not to like about these perks? :)


The Impact
Before crowdfunding, things like this would simply not be possible. You would either have to raise of money yourself, or you would have to find a publisher willing to publish your book. But by going directly to language fans from around the world, we can get this comic book out to everyone who wants one and avoid any potential problems with publishers and third parties getting in the way.
I started Silly Linguistics on Facebook with a mission to provide a fun way of looking at language and that group has since grown to over 20 000 members and my page "Steve the vagabond and silly linguist" has gained over 30 000 likes. It has all been possible through languages fans everywhere and now you can make this next project a reality too!

Risks & Challenges
I feel in some ways I am pioneering new ground. People have made comics before, and people have made language textbooks before, but no one has tried to bring language information and comics together in this way. The challenges I see ahead are about convincing people that this is a worthwhile thing to do, and also change people's mind about how cool languages are.
I have already been receiving great comments on my page and on messsages to my page about how my approach has changed their mind about a lot of things. I hope to continue forging new ground in this very unexplored area. I hope you come along on the journey with me :)

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to the campaign, I completely understand. But this comic is really about the community of language fans that I have met from around the world. Tell them about the Silly Linguistics comic book and tell them what we are trying to do here. Maybe even just tell them how much fun language fans have with languages. Even that will be a great step forward in getting people to see language differently.

story:
We're Funded!

Thank you everyone! This could not have happened without your support. Now, we move on to stretch goals, and we have some great stuff in works. We're gonna need your help to share this around as far and wide as we can.

STRETCH GOAL - $3200: Additional content package! ***Unlocked****

You will receive additional content within the comic, including pin-up art, dossiers, and additional lore to shed further light on the world of The Ferryman created by artists Timothy Lim (Trump's Space Force), Aliza Forrest (Rags #3 Cover Artist), Troy Torres (JuanPool), Ibai Canales (Ironsights), and James Liswed (Lucky).

 

 

Summary:

In 2051, new technology has given rise to mankind's greatest invention; The afterlife. All it takes is a simple implant and upon your death, if you can afford it, your consciousness can be recovered and uploaded to Glory, a user-created paradise where any indulgence is possible.

 

Miles Armstrong is a Recovery Agent, downloading the dead on the midnight shift and trying to keep the job from taking it's toll on him. However a special client, one of the inventors of Glory, is about to be murdered on his shift and Miles is now at the center of a vast conspiracy that threatens to destroy Glory from within and without.

 

Meanwhile on the other side of the world, underground journalist Tara Mitnick and her bodyguard Nakoa have an exclusive interview with cybernetically-enhanced soldier-turned-terrorist Amar Amadi, a religious zealot who claims to have proof of this conspiracy and the horrifying reality of Glory. Proof that has made him the most wanted man on earth; Dead or alive.

What's growing in the bowels of the afterlife, and how are the dead suddenly returning to life? Is Glory even real at all, or is it nothing but an elaborate, dangerous lie?


The team creating this comic is:

Sean Campbell - Writer/Editor

Dennis Tirona - Artist

Ester Salguero - Colorist

Jonathan Moore - Cover Art

James Liswed - Layout Design

Troy Torres - Logo Design

 

PAGE SAMPLES

The comic is completed as-is and ready for printing. No long wait to get it in your hands!

What We Need & What You Get

The comic pages for issue one are complete  and the team have already been compensated for their work.

The requested funds are to cover printing and shipping costs, as well as to fund the creation of content for the stretch goals.

In addition to a physical copy of issue one, we are also offering a digital PDF version as well as a higher perk that will include an additional high-quality poster print featuring Jonathan Moore's  gorgeous cover art.

 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk with a project in this stage would be delays in the printing process. It will be sent to the printers as soon as possible after payment is received. Expect delivery date will be 6-8 weeks after the receipt of funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

If it's not possible for you to contribute to the comic but you still want to help, it would be fantastic if you could share this link wherever you can. It really helps us out when you do that.

Thank you,

The Ferryman Team

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE FOR NEWCOMERS: All orders from "The Opportunist" on up will now receive a PHYSICAL COPY of the book along with all of the other rewards.

The world known as Thratas is a planet covered by sand, dust and death. What little green there is has been harvested by the lords of the lands to further their wealth and power. The weak die or become slaves, eternally in service to those of means. The lords create weapons and machines of industry in their great cities that cause pollution, making the world even more of a wasteland. Groups of orcs, elves, humans and other races roam the land, scavenging what they can to build their own weapons and ammunition to destroy. Slavery is rampant, both in the wastes and the cities.

 

 

Ra’ek, once the leader of a great crime syndicate, has been missing for years. Lacking their leader, his once feared cabal is scattered. Ra’ek has returned though, with one problem; He has forgotten who he is. His past, his memory and even his name are lost to him when the story begins.

As Ra’ek wanders, picking up bits of his memory, he is caught up in a prophecy that speaks of a great leader who will lead the people of Thratas out of the time of strife. It seems that Ra’ek may be the one that was prophesied. As the man learns more of his past and where he came from, he makes no effort to right his wrongs. Instead he seeks out his brethren and decides to lead a reign of crime and terror across the lands.

Lowlife is a comic for mature readers as it contains graphic violence, nudity, adult language and some sexual situations. It is intended to be an ongoing series following the exploits of a band of criminals in a Fantasy meets SciFi/Post-apocalyptic environment. 

 

"Panel from Lowlife"

"Inked teaser page from Lowlife"

"Teaser page in full color."

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funds contributed go toward the production of the comic.  From the art, coloring and lettering as well as shipping and printing costs for all of the physical rewards.

You can get anything from digital wallpapers, digital copies of the book, digital speed paintings of your choice from Lowlife artist Ewelina Mroczkowska as well as physical posters to hang and display.  You can even help design some of the characters in the story!

 

"Sample physical poster #1."
Note: This poster comes in normal and risque (adult only) versions.

"Sample of Physical Poster #2"
Note: This poster comes in normal and risque (adult only) versions.
 
"Sample Speed Painting video from Ewelina."

About Us:

Kenny Groom is the co-creator and writer of "Upstarts." published by Ink Forged Studios.  He has also recently worked with Identity Comics Studio on their upcoming Anthology "The Blueprint 2," to which he wrote two of the four stores found in the book.  He has spent many years learning how to write comics and tell wonderful stories and will continue to write until the day he is given to the sands.

 

Jason Humm has enjoyed a public-sector career focused on writing and editing. His self-published, autobiographical book of poetry, Dodged, sheds light on depression and thoughts of suicide. Writing for Lowlife is his first venture into comics.

 

Ewelina Mroczkowska is an accomplished freelance artist who has done the illustrations on titles such as; "Legends of Steragos: Damsels of Distress" by Kevin M. Scott and "Princess Lucinda: Book One: Black Rose of the Empire" by Malcolm Harris.

 

First Extended Goal $1500, Jose Jaro Print: (UN-LOCKED) Early!

Should we hit an extended goal of $1500 dollars, Upstarts co-creator and artist, Jose Jaro, will be doing a print for Lowlife.  This will be added to the perk levels "The Opportunist" and up!  Check out a sample of Jose's work below!

 

 

"Sample Queen Card."

 

"Sample card set."

 

 

Risks and Challenges:

Every production has obstacles to overcome.  From printing and shipping to cost of the artwork. If we make our goal, we will have no problems bringing this comic to life however and put it in your hands!

 

 

Other ways you can help:

There are plenty of ways to help and we will take all we can get.  Feel free to tell your friends, family, acquaintances and even strangers about this book!  Share it on social media and of course utilize the indigogo share tools provided!

story:
My name is Drew Ford, and I am the author behind the new comic book short story collection SPECULATE.  With each issue of SPECULATE, I will delve into a different region of genre fiction, be it science fiction, fantasy, horror, crime or just plain good ol' weirdness.  With your help, SPECULATE can become a regular part of the comic book landscape.  The plan is release SPECULATE four times per year.


This first issue focuses on the genre of science fiction, and contains seven stories.



1. THE COVER UP (illustrated by Tony Lorenz & Larry Blake)
Aliens are real...and you won't believe just how deep THE COVER UP goes!


2. AND EVEN THE PEOPLE ARE FORGOTTEN (illustrated by Russ Miller)

In the far flung future, one zookeeper tries to save some very familiar animals!



3. THE PARABLE OF TWO MARTIANS (illustrated by G.M. Danzey)

Life lessons can be rather tough...especially on the surface of Mars!



4. ONE (illustrated by Chris Eisert)

An extraterrestrial struggles with the fate of ONE human child.



5. THE COST OF FREEDOM (illustrated by Helmut Eppich)


People love to fight...and hate.  Both now, and in the future.




6. UNIQUE (illustrated by Yul Tolbert)

What if the artificial life we create doesn't want to live?


6. UNTITLED MYSTERY STORY!!! (written and illustrated by Drew Ford)


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If successful, the $3000 will be used to design, print and distribute the first issue of what will hopefully become a regularly recurring title.  If we are able to raise more than $3000, the extra money will go directly towards SPECULATE 02!

As for rewards, I have tried to keep it simple.  For $10 flat, you get a digital copy of SPECULATE 01 sent to your e-mail box.  For $15 ($10 plus $5 s&h), you get a physical copy of this science fiction issue of SPECULATE 01 mailed to your front door.  For $20 you get one of each!  For $30 you get one of each, plus one set of my 90s science fiction and fantasy anthology COSMIC WAVES #1-3.  For $50, retailers can get 10 copies of the book at 50% off the cover price!  For $100 you can pick up one digital copy, two print copies, and a phone call from me to talk comics and such.  For $250 you get one digital copy, two print copies, a phone call from me to talk comics and such, and an ORIGINAL PAGE OF ART from the story I am illustrating.  It is only a 4 page story, so obviously there are only 4 of these available!

And that about does it!  The stories (writing AND art) are completed.  We simply need to raise the money to design the book, print the book and distribute (which includes those NASTY shipping costs!) the book.  I hope you will see something that piques your interest, and will consider throwing us a few dollars towards making this FIRST EVER science fiction issue of SPECULATE 01 a reality!  Thanks for taking a look!

-Drew Ford

story:
October 30th, 1938. CBS Broadcasts Orson Wells' The War of the Worlds. A small Washington town reacts poorly.



You loved Part One?  Part Two will BLOW YOUR MIND!!  



(Cover to Part One. Check out pages 1-5 in the gallery section!)


Concrete Martians written by Mitch Cook, illustrated by Keith Grachow - October 30th 1938, Orson Wells produces a radio show for Halloween. The Mercury Theatre Presents, H.G. Wells The War of the Worlds.


The tiny lumber/concrete town of Concrete, Washington, becomes the epicenter of Martian Invasion Hysteria when, at just the point when the Martians in the radio play attack, the power goes out and so do the phones.
The power that radio displayed in those early days of mass media showed us that, even without meaning to, the theatre of the mind can and often does wreak havoc amongst the masses. Local sheriff Ted "Teddy" Wilson has his hands full when a radio play combined with a powerful electrical storm stirs up Martian invasion fever amongst the residents of Concrete, Washington.  As the rains progress an overburdened power substation decides to quit. Of course this only fuels the hysteria and "proves" that the Martians are indeed invading with cruel intent.
In the end, the story is revealed to be merely a radio theatre play .

Most, if not all of the town’s people felt understandably embarrassed and went on to live their lives. However what happened on that day was never fully documented, and that's where our story takes us. This story is to be presented in two installments (52 pages total) but can be combined into one graphic novel. It isn't a terribly long story as the events take place in a matter of hours and just one stormy night.
Interspersed within the narrative is a retelling of the Mercury Theatre’s War of the Worlds broadcast. Up until the power goes out anyway.
The events depicted are based on anecdotal evidence by people who experienced them. Newspaper reports from Concrete, Washington have aided in telling this story.  Many such events occurred across the country that night.　


LISTEN to the original Broadcast narrated by Orson Welles here- War of the Worlds

WATCH A REVIEW OF CONCRETE MARTIANS BY THE GOOD LOOKING NERD



Goals, Stretch Goals, and Rewards

Part One SOLD OUT pretty quickly so we had to produce a second edition print run.  That cost us plenty leaving nothing left for Part Two.  Sales from the second print run will go towards the printing of Part Two and other expenses, Cons, etc. .

We need to raise a minimum of $5500 to produce the second issue, 24 pages of limited color digital art. With this amount we will be able to create a digital copy that we can send out to all of our donors as well as apply to digital web comic sites like Comixology.


Each page costs $200 to produce, so, for every $200 contributed, we add another page.  So we are relying on you.  Every little bit helps. We are limiting the type of rewards offered for donations because the costs associated with fulfilling the rewards, producing, shipping, etc, defeats the purpose of the donations.

We do have stretch goals if we get over the $5500. Really this is just the start.


Beyond $5500- A full graphic novel with BOTH parts PLUS an extra short story, a childrens story, sketches and limited prints would be GREAT.  So anything beyond $5500 would be a great help!

With thanks to both TLAC printing and Print Ninja who helped us with our printing needs.

(Shipping copies is $20 International.  FYI)


BECOME A MARTIAN or CITIZEN of CONCRETE!

Want to be part of book 2?  Have you always desired to be on the cover a comic book? Then donate to  the MARTIAN GLAM, FLEE TO THE HILLS!! , or ATTACK! perks.


ORIGINAL ART

We are very lucky to have some amazing artists donating original art for Concrete Martians. These artists are giving their spin on Martians playing havoc with "Theatre of the Mind". Each piece will be around 8x10 and in different types of medium. 

David Bishop (Stranger, Of Stone)

Indiegogo Artwork


Sam Agro (Monstrosity, Monstrosity 2)

Indiegogo  Artwork


Richard Pace (Ashes, Savage Sword of Conan, Pitt)

Placeholder Artwork Only


Jacob Crippen (Jet Girl, Arcane Awakening)

Indiegogo Artwork


Mike Rooth (Variant cover artist for Nailbiter and Captain Canuck)

Placeholder Artwork Only

Keith Grachow (Digital Ink and Paint Artist, Winnie the Pooh)

Indiegogo Artwork


David Cutler (GFT presents:Wonderland, Zombies vs Cheerleaders)

Indiegogo Artwork 


Dan Holst Soelberg (author/illustrator of Oddities of West Blankshire, Dwellers of Lurching Swill, and Eight Pound Fly)


Indiegogo Artwork


Mike Boldt (123 vs ABC, Get Me Another One, Ode To Underwear)

Placeholder Artwork Only

Andy Stanleigh (Titan, Hobson's Gate)

Indiegogo Artwork

Indiegogo Artwork

Mike Boldt (123 vs ABC, Get Me Another One, Ode To Underwear)




Placeholder Artwork Only



Andy Stanleigh (Titan, Hobson's Gate)


Indiegogo Artwork

story:
Valhalla Awaits is a comic series that draws heavily from the Poetic Edda and Viking and Norse mythological themes.

The story follows characters Hildr and Erik and their journey through the Viking afterlife, where they encounter Norse gods, and legendary creatures.

Valhalla Awaits #1 is the first issue of a comic book series.

  • 32 Pages (plus covers)
  • Full Color
  • Standard Comic Book Size

Take a look inside the issue and see what's in store for you when you read it!

Phil Buckenham

Phil Buckenham is an English sequential and comic book artist. He is known for his commission work and on books such as Metal Made Flesh, Rented to the dead, Tpub’s The Theory, The Gatecrashers and many more.  His favourite artists and influences include, Todd McFarlane, Frank Miller, Caspar David Friedrich, William Blake and Becky Cloonan. He studied Illustration and Animation at the Kent Institute of art and design and has been working in comics, TV and films since 2010

Agnese Pozza

I'm a 30-year old colorist from Biella, Italy. My career began in 2014 with Luigi "Bigio" Cecchi with Drizzit strips, for the publisher Shockdom. Collaboration resumed in 2019. From 2014 to 2016 I worked with Arancia Studio, as an assistant colorist. For the Turin studio I worked with Mirka Andolfo at Sword of Sorrow: Chaos volume 1 (2015), for the publisher Dynamite. In 2016 on Morgan Lost, for Sergio Bonelli Editore and with Dentiblù Edizioni, working on Sacro / Profano: Nel Nome del Padre and Deficients & Dragons. In 2017 I colored Lo Zukkupuh, a story by Luigi "Bigio" Cecchi for the anthological collection I Tre Trighi. From 2017 I also work with No Lands Production, for the realization of comics like the Quantum Fantasy series and using watercolors in mixed technique, manual and digital on role play manuals. In 2018 for Saldapress on Nanowar of Steel. I am currently involved with Manfont, the Dutch Southeast Comics e the American Evoluzione Publishing.

Justin Birch

I was born in the hills of West Virginia and raised on a diet of pepperoni rolls and Ecto Cooler Hi-C. I surprised everyone, including myself, by surviving to adulthood on that diet. Now, I letter comics. My eventual dream is the same as everyone else – to work full time from home in my underwear.

I have a Bachelor's in graphic design and have been lettering comics for over a year. In that short time I've worked with numerous publishers and I know I can meet any deadline you may have. I offer a quick turnaround and competitive rates. Email for a quote.

I would love to letter your next comic.

story:
STRETCH GOAL UPDATE!

Yesterday a gent who goes by the Twitter handle “Archsider” sent me some gorgeous TILT fan art! I like it so much that I’ve decided to include it as a pin-up in the $4K Stretch Goal! So, if the TILT campaign reaches $4,000, you’ll receive both the pin-up of the virgin cover by Jordi Armengol (see below) and this:

Beautiful, no?

$4K STRETCH GOAL ADDED!

If the campaign reaches $4,000, everyone will receive a free pin-up of the "virgin version" of the standard cover!  

Illustrated and colored by Jordi Armengol, you will love having this!

So, let your friends, families and anyone else interested comics know that they should help TILT get to $4,000!

 

Hello All You Great Tilted IndieGoGo Backers! Welcome to the campaign to fund TILT!  

Note: All physical copies of TILT will be signed by David Hogberg, and all pin-ups will be signed by Leanore King!

Is Justice or Revenge In The Cards?

Jennifer Polar is in danger!  Her father, Larry, was murdered by mobsters and now they are after her!

In the after-life, Larry begs a powerful spirit to protect his daughter. The spirit gives Jennifer the power to make the Kings, Queens and Jacks in a deck of cards come alive!  

They will protect her, but for a price: Jennifer must use this power to eliminate the mobsters who killed her dad!  The Kings, Queens and Jacks are ready for action, but what about Jennifer?

Issue 1 of a Three Issue Series!

 

TILT has:

1. A plot that makes sense and takes NO prisoners!

 

2. Characters who DON'T emotionally validate each other!

 

3. And lots of NON-APPROVED body type!

SJWs won't like it, but you'll LOVE IT!

Created and written by David "Doc Hog" Hogberg, illustrated by Marcos Lima, colored by Leanore King, and lettered by D. Jason Meadows, TILT is a 32 page comic book! Sixteen pages are already completed--inked, colored, lettered. Doc Hog will have TILT ready to send to the printer the minute this campaign ends, so he can get it in the hands of the customer as quickly as possible!  UPDATE: 22 Pages are now complete! We are on schedule!

 

PERKS!

Backers of TILT can purchase physical copies of the comic with standard and variant covers, a PDF copy, a pin-up and a special TILT deck of cards!

Backers at the highest levels will receive all of the above perks and, best of all, have themselves drawn into Issue 2 of TILT! They will interact with other characters, kill some people and have their choice of GRUESOME DEATH:  Stabbed in the back, slashed in the throat, dagger thrown into the eye, or head chopped off from the nose up!

Standard Cover -- by Jordi Armengol

 

Variant Cover -- by Jeff Kraven

 

Pin-Up -- by Leanore King

 

Deck of Cards, Image on the Backs -- designed by Marcos Lima, colored and graphic design by Leanore King.

 

Additional Art:

1. Opening Page.  The character in the middle is the head mobster, Johnny Ricca. On the left is one of the mob hit-men, Jack Tessio, and on the right is his brother, Marco Tessio.

2. The Spirit Realm. I so love this page! I envisioned it as "Heaven,", a glowing white with some gold trim. Leanore took a look at the script and thought this was a very somber, foreboding scene--which it is! Jennifer's Dad, Larry, is about to agree to give Jennifer a power that she has to use to kill mobsters. Leanore decided to color it a blue/indigo and make part of the spirit's outfit blood red.  It wasn't what I expected--it turned out much better!

3. The Queens Arrive. In this scene, Jennifer and the Queen of Hearts have just found out the names of all of the mobsters involved in her Dad's murder. They will need to find out when the mobsters are most vulnerable for attack, so she asks Jennifer to bring forth the other three Queens for some reconnaissance. My artist, Marcos Lima, and I decided to give the Queen of Hearts traditional royal garb, but decided to give the other Queens outfits based on superhero costumes. There is something to be said for going against tradition!

4. Mobster Loses His Head!

5. Passed Over.

3. The Queens Arrive. In this scene, Jennifer and the Queen of Hearts have just found out the names of all of the mobsters involved in her Dad's murder. They will need to find out when the mobsters are most vulnerable for attack, so she asks Jennifer to bring forth the other three Queens for some reconnaissance. My artist, Marcos Lima, and I decided to give the Queen of Hearts traditional royal garb, but decided to give the other Queens outfits based on superhero costumes. There is something to be said for going against tradition!

4. Mobster Loses His Head!

5. Passed Over.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are BROOKS PERMISSIONS, demonstrating the continued relevance of the life and works of Gwendolyn Brooks in the 21st century… and beyond. Our company has licensed, promoted, printed, and performed the works of Gwendolyn Brooks for nearly 20 years. Our president, Nora Brooks Blakely, is the daughter of Gwendolyn Brooks and has a personal commitment to continuing this legacy. This is no fly-by-night crowdfunding campaign.  We are enthusiastic and we are determined to see the Graphic Gwendolyn illustrated poetry series prosper.

 

With this introductory issue (8 pp) of our illustrated poetry series, Graphic Gwendolyn, longtime fans and literary rookies can see her poetry in a new light. Monthly issues (16-24 pp) of the series will begin with a 5 month run in February, 2020 and a trade paperback volume of all 5 issues with additional materials will be released in late August of 2020.

Currently, the plan is for future volumes to contain 10 issues and to be released monthly from September to June with a paperback to follow

 

WHAT WE NEED:

Our campaign goal of $20,000 will put Graphic Gwendolyn on the map. 

 

HERE’S WHAT WE’LL DO WITH YOUR MONEY

  • Print more copies of the introductory issue and —get them into the hands of educators, poetry lovers, cultural and literary influencers. 
  • donate bundles to schools, shelters, adult literacy programs and more.  (We’ll ask for our supporters’ recommendations!)
  • Pay for the layout & design people of the first issues of the 2019/2020 series.
  • Pay our artists!!
  • Produce materials for educators.

 

AND WE WON’T SPEND A LOT OF YOUR MONEY ON…

SHIPPING.  We’re proud of our Perk Packages which focus on online goodies and information as well as live experiences. We’ve kept product mailings to a minimum.

MARKETING. We’ve been carefully building a strong word-of-mouth campaign composed of Gwendolyn Brooks’s admirers, everyday poetry lovers, poets and other writers, educators, parents and comic book fans interested in GRAPHIC GWENDOLYN’s use of the form. We’re focusing on the content and future of the project so we’ll spend very little of your money on traditional marketing. (Now, if we surpass our goal…)

 

Here's the good news: There is no risk to this campaign!!! 

That's right Wendy! If we don't meet our goal, we'll still print more copies of the introductory issue and at the very least produce the first two issues of the 2019/2020 season. Sadly, our print runs and donations would have to be smaller and fewer but the project you supported would exist in the world. 

And if we significantly exceed our goal (by $5000 or more), donations of bundles will increase, the word can be spread to much larger audiences and we'll create a new Gwendolyn Brooks “artifact” which we'll gift to each of our backers as a sign of our deep appreciation.

 

WHAT YOU GET:

Most importantly, you get our issues of Graphic Gwendolyn. Each issue focuses on one work with enticing color and artistry providing time-honored words in an easily accessible format.  

 

But That's Not All!! 

We appreciate everyone who takes time out of their busy lives to support this campaign. Backers at each level are crucial and that's why EVERYone who joins our campaign gets a link to The Gwendolyn Connection. 

In these private pages you'll get :

  •  insights into the world and works of Gwendolyn Brooks.  (Not just the poetry but the person, not just the words but the woman.)
  • early access to news and information on Brooks-related projects and events across the country.
  • a gallery of pictures from her past and from Brooks programming going forward.
  • special backers-only discounts on Brooks books and gear.
  • a simply inCREDible blog packed with opportunities to interact with our team and other supporters, insights from Brooks scholars and friends, quizzes and other activities, etc. 
  • carefully selected quotes and excerpts suitable for sharing with people of different ages.

At different tiers you’ll find exciting perks such as words from Gwendolyn Brooks on a birthday card customized just for YOU.  Also books, webinars, live classes and so much more.  Even an opportunity to have dinner with Gwendolyn Brooks’ daughter and get answers to your questions about her life and times.

It's a 360° look at Gwendolyn Brooks 

that is simply not available anywhere else.

 

WHY YOU SHOULD CARE:

Because this is IMPORTANT! In an increasingly visual world it gets easier to “lose” someone like Gwendolyn Brooks.  She hated pictures of herself, avoided videos wherever possible and never went on a talk show. 

BUT she was and is a critical figure in Black culture and American literature. 

She was 

  • the first Black person to ever win the Pulitzer Prize for anything. 
  • the Poet Laureate of Illinois for over 30 years. 
  • the Poetry Consultant to the Library of Congress (just before they changed the title to Poet Laureate of the United States!).

 

Her words still speak to today’s world:

For a young boy shot down in the streets

“Our flash of Influence interrupted.”

  • from "Patrick Bouie of Cabrini Green"

 

To people imprisoned by external or internal bars 

“I call for you cultivation of strength in the dark.

 Dark gardening

 in the vertigo cold.

 In the hot paralysis.”

  • from "To Prisoners"

 

To those with a need for the New

    “I've stayed in the front yard all my life. 

 I want a peek at the back.”

  • from "a song in the front yard"

 

To the world

“…we are each other's harvest: 

     we are each other's business: 

     we are each other's magnitude and bond.”

  • from "Paul Robeson"

 

Her work is studied today as an example of meticulous form and an ingenius use of language. Countless writers and other creatives continue to site her as an inspiration for their work.

And now, with GRAPHIC GWENDOLYN we have a new and exciting way to bring the artistry and legacy of Gwendolyn Brooks forward into this visually-addicted time.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

  •  Pass the word to friends and associates with large online followings.

  •  Create your own marketing. Come up with your own fabulous ideas on how to spread the word. (We know they'll be GREAT!!) 

  • Use a timely quote from Gwendolyn Brooks on Twitter and mention the campaign. 

  • Post a picture on Instagram of you or someone else reading Gwendolyn Brooks.                        and mention the campaign. 

  • Go live on Facebook and read a poem by Gwendolyn Brooks and… (you get the idea!)

  • Buy bundles of individual issues of Graphic Gwendolyns and donate them to schools, shelters, hospitals and adult literacy programs. (More information on our bundles at www.gwendolynbrooks.net)

 

THE BOTTOM LINE:

Gwendolyn Brooks made donations, created scholarships and awards. She even put checks and cash in people’s mailboxes and pockets to provide a nurturing soil in which talented artists could blossom. Now it's time for all of us to give back. 

Please join our campaign and through this illustrated poetry series, Graphic Gwendolyn, bring the lessons and inspirations of Gwendolyn Brooks to current and future generations in a whole new way.

story:
Short Summary

Seed Seekers is a fantastic tale of how one king lost in another dimension was wielded away into another world.  Now as the world gains their king back, they need to rebuild and strengthen from others but before they can do that they need to rebuild and find others to do so.  That’s where you come in!  By finding you, I can help rebuild their kingdom and reshape it to the world they need!  Once they help rebuild the kingdom, they can help overcome the challenges that once was. 

What We Need & What You Get

Already an up and coming series, this campaign will combine a lot of the books into graphic novel form with new and exciting stories that will help build the interesting community their kingdom needs.  With your help, we can get these books printed and available to those at a great price!  The goal is to make them available to children so they can be fascinated by the new world with a respect for diversity and team building.  One can plant a seed, but it takes every one to help it grow! You support the campaign, you will be listed in the credits and whatever perk you maintain, you will get that preview as well!  You will help get a bulk of the stories out there!
Also, THIS campaign is an indiegogo exclusive!  You will not find this graphic novel ANYWHERE else as I’m limiting this to this campaign!  So it will be rare and exclusive!


 

Unicorn and Key chain add ons as well!

The Impact

You will be a huge part to this series!  Thanks to your contributions they will go toward helping our series find others.  To help the seed grow!

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge is time and that will be minute.  Most of the book is done, just the printing, and small exclusive story I will add to the series may delay production, but it will be in your hands by January, the latest!

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is the best way to grow a seed!  Tell others that we are here and awaiting them to our exclusive novel!  Tell others to join today!

What We Need & What You Get
Already an up and coming series, this campaign will combine a lot of the books into graphic novel form with new and exciting stories that will help build the interesting community their kingdom needs.  With your help, we can get these books printed and available to those at a great price!  The goal is to make them available to children so they can be fascinated by the new world with a respect for diversity and team building.  One can plant a seed, but it takes every one to help it grow! You support the campaign, you will be listed in the credits and whatever perk you maintain, you will get that preview as well!  You will help get a bulk of the stories out there!Also, THIS campaign is an indiegogo exclusive!  You will not find this graphic novel ANYWHERE else as I’m limiting this to this campaign!  So it will be rare and exclusive!
 
Unicorn and Key chain add ons as well!


The Impact
You will be a huge part to this series!  Thanks to your contributions they will go toward helping our series find others.  To help the seed grow!

Risks & Challenges
The only challenge is time and that will be minute.  Most of the book is done, just the printing, and small exclusive story I will add to the series may delay production, but it will be in your hands by January, the latest!

Other Ways You Can Help
Word of mouth is the best way to grow a seed!  Tell others that we are here and awaiting them to our exclusive novel!  Tell others to join today!

story:
Beastlands #1 doubled its funding goal on another crowdfunding platform and is already printed and ready to be shipped to YOU!

 Beastlands is an action adventure story set in a beautiful medieval fantasy world, where some people have companion beasts known as "Keepers". 

 In Beastlands you'll go on an adventure with a group of 3 teenage friends, Mac, Ava and Ping. They're on a journey to find out what Mac's father, an explorer, was trying to discover before he disappeared. On this quest their friendships will be put to the test all while a tyrannical King looks to outlaw Keepers from the land.

Who will love Beastlands?

  • Fans of Pokemon, Game of Thrones, Monster Hunter, The Witcher, How to Train your Dragon, The Last Airbender and other fantasy worlds filled with unique creatures.
  • Fans of comics like Saga, Isola, Seven to Eternity, Deadly Class, Extremity, Middlewest and Low.
  • People who like the beautiful films by Studio Ghibli and their unique stories and worlds.
  • If you like comics with a unique charming fantasy world, with BEAUTIFUL ART and a heartful, genuine, emotional and impactful story.

What do you get when backing this kickstarter?

  • Beastlands #1 : 21 pages of story printed at standard american comic book size on high quality gloss paper with a thick matte cover.

  • Collectors edition : signed and numbered with high quality numeric foil stamp out of 1,000 - very limited! 
  • Get our other comic series 'The Wild Cosmos #1': 26 pages of story printed on high quality paper and oversized at 8x12 with a matte cover and with back matter (The Wild Cosmos is picked up by SCOUT COMICS now, so this version of the book is SUPER LIMITED  and rare!).
 

Get the limited collectors version with the numeric foil stamp! Only 1,000 made!

 

PRAISE FOR BEASTLANDS #1

We've been sending advanced copies of Beastlands #1 around the comic industry. Check out what some pros and critics said!

ADVANCED REVIEWS OF BEASTLANDS #1

"Curtis Clow unravels a story that is sure to keep our adventuring shoes on nonetheless. Paired with Jo Mi-Gyeong's art, this story is a must read!  ...one of the best indie comics I’ve read in a long time!  I absolutely love BEASTLANDS #1 and cannot wait to see what comes next!" - ComicsVerse.com

 " ...with the delightful artwork results in this first issue of, "Beastlands," being a great read. I'd excitedly rate, "Beastlands," first issue with 5 out of 5 stars... " - TheNewestRant.com

 "Beastlands is a comic that is made with both imagination and heart as it is built with the highest quality of production I’ve seen. The creators have clearly put their blood, sweat, and tears into a story that deserves every reader it can get." - TheModernGafa.com 

 "Beastlands #1 scratches a fantasy itch and could offer a fascinating take on the strength of the bonds between humans and their pets." - OmniComic.com

 

CURTIS CLOW

Writer - Curtis is a professional comic book writer. Some comics that he's written and created include The Wild Cosmos with Scout Comics and The Dragon's Kin with In Hiatus Studios. He's a fan of all things sci-fi and fantasy. He has ran three Kickstarter campaigns, successfully fulfilling all three. Currently living in sunny Orange County, California. Besides writing at his desk, he enjoys practicing jiu jitsu and muay thai and going on backpacking camping trips.

JO MI-GYEONG 

Artist - Jo currently lives in Seoul, Korea. She is a big fan of DC comics and loves to read them when not making art. She also is a Comics Art Challenger!

TOBEN RACICOT

Letterer - Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they create Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne. He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Comic Books at the University of Waterloo.

 

WHY THIS STORY?

 "As a writer they say "write what you know". Now, I love writing high concept sci-fi and fantasy stories that immerse you into a whole new world. But this is so much more than that. This is a story about being a teenager and going after your purpose in life. Sometimes to a fault. This is a story about friendship - but also about owning, caring for and loving a pet. In my mid 20's I finally got a dog of my own, a beagle named Ellie. Taking care of a dog was more work than I ever expected. One day I took her to the park, like I did many mornings, for a game of fetch. That day Ellie was struck by a car. I had to walk back home with her in my arms while I thought her life was drifting away from her little body. She was in rough shape. All I could do was hope that she'd hang in there. Once home, we rushed to the vet so they could care for her. Luckily Ellie survived and made a full recovery. She's 3 now, living her life sprinting through the Southern California beaches. She's already taught me more than I could've expected. This is a story about appreciating what you have, before it's too late. This is a story for Ellie."

-Curtis

(acknowledgements not available anymore)

(acknowledgements not available anymore)

Beastlands #1 is already 100% finished and printed! Now we're using InDemand to find a wider audience!

SHIPPING

 

It's important to us that your comics arrive safe and undamaged!

All comics will be individually bagged and boarded. Then shipped into the secure Gemini Comic Supply Flash Mailers, which provides impact resistant protection.  We'll be doing all the packaging ourselves to ensure it's done right and safe.

 

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

As a group of independent creators crowdfunding is a chance for us to self publish and produce this comic.  Sure, we'd love to have a publisher with us on the series someday. But right now, this is as raw as it gets. This is a group of friends and creators making something for the love and passion of it. This is us trying to get our story out there no matter what it takes.

As a passion project we've already put hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars into this project. We're doing this for the love of comics. Crowdfunding will allow us to cover any more art costs, print the book, distribute the book, take it to conventions and hopefully continue the series of Beastlands!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We hope you decide to join this campaign and go on an adventure with Mac, Ava and Ping!

Thanks

-Curtis, Jo, and Toben

story:
O co chodzi? 

Skoda Fabia – marzenie wszystkich działkowców, osób, które chcą posiadać nowy samochód, ale tak naprawdę ich na niego nie stać i początkujących handlowców. Zmora wszystkich tych, którzy chcą od auta czegokolwiek więcej, niż kierownicy, kół i żeby nie padało na głowę.


Niestety, jest to przy okazji poważna choroba, na która moja rodzina cierpi od 2001 roku, i która przenosi się z pokolenia na pokolenie. Nie pozwól, żeby kolejne generacje musiały to znosić.

Niestety terapia w normalnych warunkach jest długotrwała i kosztowna. Całe nowe pokolenie mojej rodziny zbiera na leczenie, ale nikt nie wie, kiedy uda się je zakończyć i czy będzie to szczęśliwe zakończenie.

Możesz pomóc!

PS: Tak naprawdę mam chwilę luzu i trochę mi się nudzi, więc skoro sałatka mogła coś ugrać, to dlaczego nie Fabia? Poza tym jest czerwona.

PPS: 15% przekazanej na moje konto po zakończeniu akcji kwoty zostanie przekazane na Schronisko dla Bezdomnych Zwierząt we Wrocławiu.

Jak leczyć?

Po konsultacji z licznymi przedstawicielami rynku medycznego i pochodnych, odkryto następujące czynniki, które mogą przyczynić się do wyleczenia Fabizmu:

  • Benzynowe silniki V8
  • Fotele z wentylacją i masażem
  • Automatyczne skrzynie biegów
  • Nadwozia sedan o długości około 5 metrów
  • Wersje przedłużone samochodów osobowych (sedan)
  • Wysokiej jakości wnętrza
  • Systemy ogrzewania postojowego i kontroli jakości powietrza
W związku z moją niewielką wiedzą z zakresu medycyny (psychologii?) pozostaje mi jedynie zgodzić się z powyższymi punktami i zgłosić dobrowolnie na terapię.

Fabia jedzie w miejsca!

Choć wszystko tu jest głównie dla zabawy, kto wie, może się uda? Jeśli tak, Fabia zasługuje na piękne pożegnanie:

  • 10 € - Fabia jedzie na myjnię
  • 100 € - rundka honorowa dookoła Wrocławia
  • 1000 € - runda honorowa Fabią dookoła województwa dolnośląskiego
  • 3000 € - Fabia jedzie zobaczyć polskie morze
  • 5000 € - Fabia odwiedza fabrykę, w której powstała!
  • 8000 € - Fabia wariuje i jedzie na północ do Narwik (Norwegia)
  • 10 000 € - Fabia spełnia swoje marzenia - przejeżdza całą Europę wzdłuż wybrzeża i przechodzi na emeryturę

Ryzyko

Może się okazać, że zakupiony pojazd był serwisowany w warsztacie C&G i nie będzie się nadawał do dłuższej eksploatacji. To nieważne - i tak będę go kochał.

Uwagi drobne

Oczywiście treści na naklejkach nie mogą być wulgarne, nie powinny nikogo obrażać i takie tam. Wszystkie muszą zostać zaakceptowane.

Literatura

Do diagnozy ( i nie tylko) posłużyły następujące pozycje:
  • "Czy posiadanie Fabii czyni cię gorszym człowiekiem? 5 sposobów jak sobie z tym radzić"
  • "Wyjazdy z Fabią, czyli jak w domowych warunkach zamontować ponownie plomby w zębach"
  • "Przyspieszenie Fabii od 0 do 100" - Tomy I-XIX (wydanie rozszerzone, niekompletne)
  • "Fotele samochodowe - najgorsze przykłady w historii motoryzacji"
  • "Brak klimatyzacji - przekleństwo czy tania alternatywa dla sauny?"
  • "Bierz kapelusz i na działkę! Poradnik początkującego emeryta"

story:
La storia

AVVISO SPOILER (per chi non avesse letto a suo tempo la serie): questa nuova avventura di Agenzia Incantesimi è una di quelle appositamente realizzate per rendere la serie perfettamente fruibile anche da quei lettori che non hanno mai seguito Jonathan Steele e serve quindi a coprire uno dei "buchi" narrativi esistenti. In particolare, racconta del ritorno di Myriam dalla dimensione infernale in cui è stata catapultata qualche episodio prima.

FINE PARTE SPOILEROSA.

Una nuova avventura, quindi, con una nuova versione degli eventi eall'insegna dell'azione spettacolare. La storia verrà pubblicata fra qualche mese (più o meno durante l'Estate) su Tapastic, ma contribuendo a questa campagna potrete riceverla, in formato pdf,  con vari mesi di anticipo, immediatamente al termine della campagna stessa.

Dove finiranno i vostri soldi?

La cifra che stiamo raccogliendo sarà così suddivisa: 500€ compenseranno il lavoro di disegno e colorazione. Altri 100€ serviranno invece a pagare sceneggiatura e lettering. I restanti 150€ servono invece a coprire le percentuali trattenute da Indiegogo e Paypal, nonché eventuali spese impreviste che possono saltar fuori all'improvviso.

Il disegnatore

Enrico Simonato lavora come architetto e insegnante di disegno, mentre nel campo del fumetto ha illustrato "Il mistero di Casanova" e "Rigoletto" per Alma Edizioni.

A quali rischi andate incontro partecipando a questa campagna?

La risposta è semplice: nessuno. La storia è già stata completata e vi sarà inviata immediatamente al termine della campagna, qualunque sia il risultato. I vari "perk" che avrete scelto vi saranno inviati o insieme alla storia, nel caso del materiale digitale, o nelle settimane seguenti alla fine della campagna per quanto riguarda le commission e il merchandising.

Come potete aiutarci?

Oltre a contribuire a questa campagna, potete esserci molto d'aiuto anche spargendo la voce della sua esistenza, invitando i vostri contatti a visitare questa pagina. La promozione è fondamentale in queste campagne e il vostro aiuto, in questo senso, può davvero fare la differenza. Ricordate che, se apprezzate Agenzia Incantesimi, aiutandoci aumentate le possibilità di leggere ancora più avventure di Myriam e Jasmine in futuro! E grazie a tutti in anticipo!

Il merchandising

Come potete vedere nei "perk" qui accanto, il merchandising di Agenzia Incantesimi comincia a variare. Oltre alla maglietta, infatti, questa volta sono disponibili anche delle tazze da tè.  Potete ammirarle entrambe qua sotto (nota a margine per le ragazze: il modello non è compreso!).

Come potete vedere nei "perk" qui accanto, il merchandising di Agenzia Incantesimi comincia a variare. Oltre alla maglietta, infatti, questa volta sono disponibili anche delle tazze da tè.  Potete ammirarle entrambe qua sotto (nota a margine per le ragazze: il modello non è compreso!).

story:
Short Summary

First of all, I just want to say thank you to all of my loyal fans and readers! You give me the love and validation that we all crave. (But especially artists! We are historically a delicate people.) You are also the reason why my parents don't think I'm crazy (anymore).

I've been drawing "George the Fear Monster" comics every Friday and putting them online (fearmonster.org) for nearly a year now, and people often ask me, "why is it a weekly comic instead of daily?" Well, drawing a daily comic is a full-time job, and I have rent and bills to pay. 

HOWEVER, that is a full-time job that I would absolutely love to have! 

The web comic is the story of me and my fear, how silly it can be, and learning how to love that part of myself.

A lot of conventional wisdom tells you to just "conquer your fear." As if it was that easy, right? But I've found that having compassion for that part of myself is far more effective than just beating myself up about it.

I'd like to help you learn to laugh at your fear as well, which is why I'm making George into a daily source of inspiration and laughter starting in September!

The New Comics Industry

Remember how happy you were every Sunday to sit down with the comics section of the newspaper and laugh? (Me too!) Back when people actually bought newspapers, you could make a good living as a comic strip artist. Since then, newspapers have been closing and the comics industry has changed.

I won't bore you with the details. . . but the short version of it is, now artists depend on the support of their fans and readers (like you!) to pay the bills.

Where the Money Goes & What You Get

I will start drawing George comics daily in September, regardless of whether or not we reach the funding goal.

The money raised will go toward paying for rent, food, and bills so that I can draw the comic every day! This should get me through the end of 2014 without having to worry. (I got out the spreadsheets and calculated what I need minus the costs of the merchandise, shipping, and processing fees, which is how I decided upon the weird number of $39,000.)

By contributing $35 or more, you get unique merchandise that won't be sold anywhere else ever again! 

And the first 25 people to contribute $50 or more get their t-shirt autographed!

The Cool Perks are:

$15 - Officially Being awesome!

You get my eternal gratitude and the knowledge that you're an awesome person!


$25 - Fear Monster Mediations

You get the illustrated eBook of 15 meditations to help you calm your fear monster!

$35 - Limited edition journal + Meditations

You get this special limited edition journal, that will not be sold again or anywhere else. The only way to get it is by contributing! You will also get the fear monster meditations eBook.

Journal details:

  • Size: 5"x8"
  • 160 college ruled pages
  • 60lb book-weight (24 lb bond)
  • Front cover made of 12pt glossy card stock
  • Back cover made of thin flexible textured plastic


$50 - Limited edition t-shirt + Meditations

You get this super special limited edition t-shirt, so you can show off to all of your friends that you helped George! It will not be sold anywhere else again, so the only way to get it is by contributing! You will also get the fear monster meditations eBook.

The first 25 people to contribute $50 or more will also get their t-shirt autographed by me, at no extra charge!

T-shirt details:

  • American Apparel 
  • Made in the USA (sweatshop-free)
  • 100% fine jersey cotton
  • Men and women's tees available
  • Color options below


Please note: I'll be in contact with you after the campaign is over to get your t-shirt size and preference of color. So keep an eye on your email!


$100 - Autographed poster + t-shirt + mediations 

You'll get an autographed poster (18"x24") of my favorite comic, "The Hero's Journey." You'll also get the limited edition t-shirt and the fear monster meditations eBook!


$125 - ALL the stuff! Autographed poster + t-shirt + journal + mediations 

(Save yourself $10 this way)

You get the autographed poster, the super special limited edition t-shirt, showing that you helped George, as well as the super special limited edition journal! They will not be sold again or anywhere else. The only way to get them is by contributing! You will also get the fear monster meditations eBook.


$500 - YOUR fear monster, drawn by me (autographed poster & digital copy) + t-shirt + meditations

You'll get your very own fear monster! We'll talk for an hour, so I can get to know your fear monster, and I will create digital art of him or her. You'll get the high-resolution digital file, and a one-of-a-kind autographed poster of your fear monster! (18"x24") And your fear monster may even appear in future comics!

You'll also get the limited edition t-shirt and the illustrated eBook of fear monster meditations!


$1,000 - YOUR fear monster, as an acrylic painting! + t-shirt + meditations

You'll get your very own one-of-a-kind acrylic painting of your fear monster! (18"x24") We'll talk for an hour, so I can get to know your fear monster, and I will create a unique acrylic painting of him or her! And if I like your fear monster, he or she may even appear in future comics!

You'll also get the limited edition t-shirt and the illustrated eBook of fear monster meditations!


$1,500 - Be forever immortalized as a cartoon and have a cameo in the comic! + t-shirt + meditations

You'll get to enter the cartoon world of George and appear in a future comic! I will refer to you by name and everything! You'll also get an autographed 18"x24" poster of the comic that you appear in, which is truly a one-of-a-kind gift for yourself!

You could also get this as a gift for someone you love, but you know you want to be cartoon-famous!

You'll also get the limited edition t-shirt and the illustrated eBook of fear monster meditations!


Note: If you are outside the United States, and choose a perk that requires shipping ($35 or above), please include an extra $5 for international shipping. Thanks!

    Stretch Goals

    I would be absolutely thrilled and honored if we reach the funding goal of $39,000, which will mean I can pay all of my bills through the end of the year with no worries (after all the merchandise, shipping, and fees are taken out, it's the right amount)! But if we happen to raise more money, I will do some of the things that scare me and film it so you can experience me laughing at some of my own fears!

    • $50,000 - I will get past my fear of sharks and attempt to learn how to surf!
    • $75,000 - I will get past my fear of jumping out of an airplane and go skydiving!
    • $100,000 - I will get past my fear of needles and get a tattoo of George!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't afford to give anything, please share this campaign with your friends and coworkers! You know those coworkers that hit you up every year for Girl Scout Cookies and stare at you until you order 5 boxes? Yes, we all love Girl Scout Cookies, but that does give you the right to show them this campaign and stare at them until they contribute. Every little bit helps!

    Thank you so much for all the love and support!

    Jillian

story:
Short Summary

"Tommy" (a rascally, cartoon imp) deserves a worthy website of his very own to meet the unsuspecting public and shake it up.      

What We Need & What You Get

I'm Chad Draper, Tommy's creator and resident memorialist.  Back in 1980, when I was an assistant in Don Ivan Punchatz's illustration enclave, this cute little cartoon puck sprang fully-formed from my head and ran around the drawing board.  So naturally I had to transcribe his absurd adventures before the authorities arrived.  I printed "Tommy Quarterly" as a limited edition comic book (only one dollar and 29 cents) as a joke, really, but he caught on quickly and was eventually picked up by Pulse Magazine, The Wahoo Reader, Obscure Gazette and some other long-forgotten periodicals.  Now, with a target of $5000, I hope to have a sanctified Tommy website built to introduce him to a whole new world of like-minded nut jobs out there.  Take a look at his cartoon "clippings" here.  See what I mean?  Ideally, his daffy cuteness will attract a large enough audience to justify his own fancy hardback book.  And then, when nobody's looking, his own YouTube cartoon show!  The proposed website will become self-sustained; selling Tommy printed material, Tommy original comic art, Tommy paintings and even Tommy action figures (yeah, that's reaching).  All of you gracious contributors are one jump ahead.  You get some good Tommy stuff no matter what level.  Launch, he must! 

The Impact

Yes, once again we're bombarded with global uncertainties:  civil wars, epidemics, political prevarication and network television.  So what else is new?  Well, Tommy will be to our spanking-new, cultivated audience.  His "outsider" perspective can bring both joyous laughter and muffled screams.  It's a cartoon twist on this whole reality thing.  In other words, that's show biz.      

    Risks & Challenges

    Some may be offended and others even more offended.  But you can't be afraid of that when you're just making observations and telling the "truth."  That's what Tommy does.  He tells it like he sees it.  With his Magic Eye.  (Check out a cartoon episode here to get that obscure implication.) 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please note, if you will:  I'm a mighty fine artist, but a lousy machinist.  Could really use some volunteer help and advice.  Any creative parties with the skill sets to construct and/or maintain Tommy's site.  After all, it will be his launch pad and ultimate secret hide-out.  You can be there from the get-go.  Thanks a whole heap of a lot for your consideration, folks!

story:
The Project

A 12-episode graphic novel about a reluctant superhero yogini who battles abusive police and government agents without the aid of violence. You can see the first episode here.

When is it acceptable to use violence? Can we fight violence without resorting to violence ourselves? Is violence legitimate when it is committed by those in authority? And what can one person do to combat officially sanctioned violence - when she can't use violence herself?

These are the questions posed by Urban Yogini. They are also critical questions for those of us who are committed to peace and to creating a peaceful society. I decided to create this web comic and graphic novel in order to get people asking these questions, and possibly even coming up with some solutions.

I was a journalist for over a decade, mostly in Asia. I have also studied yoga, ballet and some buddhism. You can see my writing and other work here.


What We Need & What You Get

The $5,000 will go to pay professional artists to do a better job illustrating the remaining eleven episodes than I have done with the first. It will also free me up to write those episodes if somebody else is doing the artwork.

I'm offering some pretty cool perks to those who donate:

EVERYONE who donates will get a copy of the finished product - the 12-episode graphic novel. Anyone donating $20 or more will get a signed copy.

Anyone who donates $100 or more can have their name appear as the name of a character in one of the episodes.

And for anyone who donates $1,000 or more, I will create a supervillain in your image and using your name (that is, a supervillain version of your name). I personally think this is the coolest perk ever. 

Anything raised beyond $5,000 will go to pay me for my time writing the episodes. If the campaign brings in a LOT more than $5,000 ($9,000 or more), then additional funds will go to fund even more episodes! And of course if the campaign doesn't raise the full amount, I will use whatever funds are raised to make as many episodes as we can.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are excited about this project and want to see it happen, but making a financial contribution is not practical for you, there are other ways you can help! 

Help spread the word: Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to share this project on your social networks, and tell your friends about us!

"Follow" Urban Yogini's Indiegogo project (click on the little "follow" heart below the video) so you can recieve updates on our progress and other ways you can help.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ivan Fuentes. I am a father, nerd, batman geek, and inspiring comic book writer and illustrator. I’m from a town called Hacienda Heights, CA (30 minutes away from Los Angeles). I’ve been sketching since I was 9 years old but I’ve been into comics ever since I could read. Comics became important to me because while I was growing up I didn’t have very many friends. I had a very active imagination and comics allowed me to become more artistic and creative as well as develop characters and have my own personal style when it came to super heroes. When I would read comics, it helped me develop my own style. 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, I can raise funds needed to attend the next Comikaze Expo. Comikaze is presented by the legendary Stan Lee; it is one of southern california’s biggest comic book conventions. Comikaze gives comic book fans the opportunity to meet some of your favorite writers, artists, actors, and get some original pieces drawn for you by some awesome artists. It has been a dream of mine to be a part of a comic book convention. This campaign is going to help that dream come true which will in turn help another dream of mine come true: releasing my own comic book. This campaign is to help fund my booth rental as well as promotional items available during the expo. Items such as:

  • my banner,
  • pins,
  • custom cell phone cases,
  • t-shirts, 
  • stickers

Even if I’m not able to reach my goal, the funds raised will still go towards all of the items listed. 

The Impact

Based on the success of this campaign, it will contribute towards the ultimate goal of giving something back to the community. Where I can be able to help the younger generation expand their imagination, help them get on the right track, and educate them on how being a writer and artist can be rewarding.

Aside from that, you’re making a huge difference in my life as well. It’s my dream to be at a comic book convention and it would mean the world to me if I were actually able to see that happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you currently don't have the funds to contribute to this cause. Don't worry! There are other ways you can help: 

  • Share the word about the campaign! Please make sure you're using the share tools from the Indiegogo campaign 

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

 

Thank you for your support. It truly means the world to me.

story:
My name's Stephen.   I've lived in SF for a while; working first at history museum, then as Information & Referral at a community center.  I've seen how many resources, fun stuff, crazy history, and unique community-experiments this city has.  I've also seen the need for better info.  Even natives seem to know a fraction of what's available.

SF is a top choice for runaways, yet there is no concise central access to health info / cheap entertainment / social engagement. etc. The internet has an ocean of info but its often disperse, inaccurate hearsay, or woefully outdated.

I have the info, I have the art, I know the city, I know the best local bands.  I felt it had to be done.  So I did it.

Now you don't have to be "the health nut" to know how to get free vaccines, city insurance, or know whats in-season & local.
You don't have to be "the political one" to know your local reps number, or what companies are still anti-gay, or what your rights at work are.
Now you don't have to "be connected" to be informed. (paper y'all)
You don't have to remember free museum days, concerts, events, or perks for locals.
All that can be right there in your Daily Planner.  Framed with local art, games, local history, & a bunch more stuff.

You can see what's inside farther down.  First, let's get down to business:

It's IN MY COMPUTER now, and getting better, but it needs to be printed soon so it can go in zine stores & send it out.  2014 is approaching quickly.  I also want to give piles away to orgs that serve the poor youth (u can buy a copy for the 'give-away'-pile cheaper than for yourself).  This is why I need your help:

Based on the cost of the first version in 2012, i need $7000.
printing & binding 2,000 copies ($5000),
pressing the CD ($1000)
ruler ribbon & app publishing fees ($500)
shipping to 500 to households ($1000 if I'm lucky)
and of course indiegogo fees. ($500-$840).

as you can see $7000 doesn't quite get there. I hope I will be able to make this difference up by selling in zine store. This is not my get-rich-quick scheme.   This is a thing that I feel needs to exist, and I am the person that needs to put it together,
I know I can do it, cause I've done it before.

i wanted it to be BEAUTIFUL... so me & my talented friends helped fill it with art on every page.

i wanted it to be EMPOWERING.... so i made sure it had democracy hacks: your (SF) rights at work, whistle-blowers resources, local politician info, voter registration, boycott lists, medicine hacks, etc

i wanted it to be USEFUL... so i filled it with essential info for locals: Last Bart, 24hr diners, muni-map, etc.

I wanted it to be FUN....so it's got tons of guides to free weekly open mics, pub quizzes, comedy nights, jam sessions, oyster happy hours, etc.

i wanted it to be an ALMANAC... so i filled it "today in local history", celestial events, voting days, prophecies, local celeb b-days, free concerts, free events, free days at local attractions, etc.  There's even a menstrual tracking calendar.

i wanted it to be MUSICAL..... so i included a CD of excellent unheard local bands, 12 chords charts & music theory worth having on you.

i wanted it to be useful to POOR FOLKS... so there's guides for peeps w/o smartphones, free vaccine programs, harm reduction, hotlines & local resources, free food, etc.  If you look at the incentives, you'll see at-cost rewards that fund the book going to org's that serve the community.

We're almost there.  Let's get it on paper & make it a successful addition to the community consciousness.
story_txt:
My name's Stephen.   I've lived in SF for a while; working first at history museum, then as Information & Referral at a community center.  I've seen how many resources, fun stuff, crazy history, and unique community-experiments this city has.  I've also seen the need for better info.  Even natives seem to know a fraction of what's available.SF is a top choice for runaways, yet there is no concise central access to health info / cheap entertainment / social engagement. etc. The internet has an ocean of info but its often disperse, inaccurate hearsay, or woefully outdated.I have the info, I have the art, I know the city, I know the best local bands.  I felt it had to be done.  So I did it.Now you don't have to be "the health nut" to know how to get free vaccines, city insurance, or know whats in-season & local. You don't have to be "the political one" to know your local reps number, or what companies are still anti-gay, or what your rights at work are.Now you don't have to "be connected" to be informed. (paper y'all)You don't have to remember free museum days, concerts, events, or perks for locals.All that can be right there in your Daily Planner.  Framed with local art, games, local history, & a bunch more stuff.You can see what's inside farther down.  First, let's get down to business:It's IN MY COMPUTER now, and getting better, but it needs to be printed soon so it can go in zine stores & send it out.  2014 is approaching quickly.  I also want to give piles away to orgs that serve the poor youth (u can buy a copy for the 'give-away'-pile cheaper than for yourself).  This is why I need your help:Based on the cost of the first version in 2012, i need $7000.printing & binding 2,000 copies ($5000),pressing the CD ($1000)ruler ribbon & app publishing fees ($500)shipping to 500 to households ($1000 if I'm lucky)and of course indiegogo fees. ($500-$840).as you can see $7000 doesn't quite get there. I hope I will be able to make this difference up by selling in zine store. This is not my get-rich-quick scheme.   This is a thing that I feel needs to exist, and I am the person that needs to put it together,I know I can do it, cause I've done it before. i wanted it to be BEAUTIFUL... so me & my talented friends helped fill it with art on every page.
i wanted it to be EMPOWERING.... so i made 
sure it had democracy hacks: your (SF) rights at

history", celestial events, voting days, prophecies, local celeb b-days, free concerts, free events, free days at local attractions,

story:
I'm Scott, the artist and writer of the online syndicated comic Nerf This (which you can read at nerf-this.com), AND have been doing so since March of 2009. It's been a complete blast, and I wouldn't take any of the many sleepless nights back in a second. 
So what this project is for is the publication if the first official Nerf This: Vomume 1 book, the printer is picked and they've gotten a quote back to me for 1000 books, which will be $7,000 with shipping included.

Since the comic is in full color, the book will also be in full color as well, toting over 140 pages of story (with commentary under most strips), and a few more pages of never seen before sketches (dinosaurs wearing monocles most likely involved). The book itself will be 8" x 8".  A few other things included within the book will be never before seen characters, and other variations of current characters and how they almost turned out to be.



Some Questions...

I don't have a lot of money, but I would still like to show my support!

That's more than alright, you may gladly view my work over at nerf-this.com, if you even slightly enjoy my comic, that alone means the world to me. Even the smallest steps of telling friends on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, and other social networks can be the biggest help to myself and Nerf This.

When will the book/rewards be done?

If everything goes through smoothly, and I reach the pledged amount, the books will be ready and shipped out by mid-Fall (Oct or Nov).

What will you do if you exceed the your goal?

If (crosses fingers) that does happen, I will simply order more books so that I'll have more to sell, and more to take with me to conventions.

Why is this book so important?

Because Nerf This: Volume 1 will be first self published work, and it will provide more for me and those who frequent my store, and conventions. While I'm completely supported off of my comics, it's a very modest lifestyle, and this is one of those steps to better myself as an artist, because the better I can be, the better I can provide more content for my readers

Do you have any other comics?

Yes! If you have a spare minute, you may gladly read my other projects ScoutCrossing.net and Motokool.net

story:
The Impact

Female created content, a fresh, different point of view.

Why This Project Needs YOU!

This is my labor of love and I look forward to sharing it with all of you. It means the world to me to create my own project and to have a voice in the industry. I will be able to bring you great content that is fresh, funny, and heartfelt. The more creative and fresh content we can get into the industry the more the industry will realize there is not only an audience for this kind of work, there is a demand. Let's get great content back in the wheel.

If 350 people donate $20, I will make my goal! Your donations will go to paying the set and costume designer, director of photography, sound designer, editing, costumes, hair and makeup... did I mention food? People need to eat on sets apparently.

Bringing this fresh new story to life is impossible without your generous donations. No amount is too small, every single dollar will be put to use! I can't even tell you what your support means.  In addition to a small bit of joy you will get knowing you have contributed, we can also guarantee Team Squirrel's hard work and dedication to bringing you the best entertainment!

Short Summary-

"A Bag of Squirrels" is a view into an improv classroom where aspiring improvisors do bad improv well. The group is eager to create comedy, yet each person is challenged by his/her odd, quirky, bold personalities. It is so much fun to watch these characters' passion colliding with their natural selves, which are funnier than the actual improv. My motley crew is born from my own experiences in improv classes and richly colorful people I have met along the way.

*Good News! Because A Bag of Squirrels is sponsored by New York Women And Film, your donations are tax-deductible! 

If you are "borrowing" money out of your daughters doll purses...I understand for sure.  If financial support is just out of the question there are other things that support so much!  Sharing is caring...tell your friends and neighbors!

Tweet and Follow  "A bag of Squirrels" @abagofsquirrels

Share this campaign on Facebook and Like our page! Join the email list on the website! Share the link to the campaign and other pages.

story:
Hello, I'm Justin Cristelli. I am the writer and creator of Red Knight. It's an ongoing series from Primal Paper Comics. One question I've been asked since day one is, "When is the trade coming out?", well...now is the time.

RED KNIGHT is an ongoing comics series featuring Todd McClain. He's Norfolk's one and only super hero! He's got the powers, but he has no idea how to fight crime.

Todd grew up in a world of super heroes that would stand for truth, justice, and the American way. Today, America has super criminals, licensed super heroes, and unlicensed vigilantes. Licensed heroes are mainly has-been celebrities that are living off their past glories. Vigilantes are out for vengeance that have lost touch with humanity. Super villains? Well, they're still super villains. The only people that can help Red Knight, are his Uncle, Nathan R. Anderson and Norfolk Police Detective, Martha Brown.

RED KNIGHT : A KNIGHT WITHOUT A SWORD
In the first story arc, Todd jumps head first into the world of super powers. The bad guys and the cops are out to get him. Will Red Knight survive long enough to make his mark in such a cruel life?

Writer and Creator: Justin Cristelli

Artist for the main storyline: JC Grande

The art for The Struggle short story: James Harmon

Color by Forrester (Dogs And Sailors)

Lettering: Lindsay Mays

Editors: Aaron Kessel and Lindsay Mays

Introduction by Captain Logan of You Tube's Geekvolution

Art Gallery featuring the work of:

JC Grande

Mandy Anders

Shiloh Penfield

James Harmon

Nikole MacDonald Jones

With your pledge, the first story arc of Red Knight can finally be collected in color!

story:
Deutsche Version am Ende der Seite!

Hallo Breaking Bad Fans! 

I myself am a Breaking Bad fanatic from day one. I allways was interested in Merchandise for my favorite show. But i rarely  was abled to come across something that was made with the same amount of love for detail as the show itself, So I made it my task to create special fan articles made by fans for the fans! My first project is the Tortuga Bobblehead.

Please notice that this is a prototype. One change will be made: The slogan "HOLA DEA" will be painted and not modulated in the final version!


Now its up to You to make it happen! 


You got the exclusive opportunity to secure the Collector’s Edition of the 5 inch figure via Indiegogo!

The Collector’s Edition comes with an Art book, which illustrates the process from first concept Arts to the final product!
The Collectors Edition is limited to 200 units!!




                                                 !!!Please Make It Bobble!!!

     Risks 

    I´m glad to tell you that most of the obstacles are already taken care of!

    It has been a long way from first idea to the Prototype you see here. 
    After long search I was abled to find a manufacturer who is willing to produce a small number, and at the same time meets my quality requirements.
    So the only risk left is me paying for all Bobbleheads myself!

    This means You as a Supporter are guaranteed to receive a Bobblehead !!






       Other Ways to help / Share to win!

      If you like my project but are short of money right now I´m thankful for you helping me spread the word about my campaign !

      Share it on Facebook and tell your friends about it!

      You won´t be doing this for nothing. Like my Facebook page and share the Link to the campaign and you will participate A !! GIVA AWAY !!


      https://www.facebook.com/pages/Tortuga-Bobblehead-BY-STFU/246503548873758?ref_type=bookmark


      Selbst Breaking Bad Fanatiker der ersten Stunde verfolge ich auch den Bereich der Fanartikel stets mit Interesse . Bisher habe ich aber nur selten einen Fanartikel finden können, der mit ähnlich viel Liebe zum Detail, wie die Serie selbst gestaltet ist .  Daher habe ich es mir zur Aufgabe gemacht , selbst besonderer Artikel von Fans für Fans herzustellen.  Als erstes  Projekt möchte ich nun den Tortuga Bobblehead realisieren.
      Nun liegt es an euch, ob es gelingt !


      Ihr habt exklusiv über Indiegogo die Möglichkeit die limitierte Collectors Edition der ca. 14 cm großen Figur zu erstehen. 

      Die Collectors Edition beeinhaltet neben dem Bobblehead ein Artbook, welches den Prozess von den ersten Konzeptzeichnungen bis hin zum finalen Produkt illustriert. 

      Die Collectors Edition ist auf 200 Stück limitiert!!

      Risiken

      Glücklicherweise sind ein Großteil der Hürden bereits genommen. Es war ein langer Weg von der ersten Idee zum fertigen Prototypen. Nach langer mühseliger Suche konnte ich einen Produzenten gewinnen, der bereit wäre diesen Artikel in der von mir geforderten Qualität, in dieser zunächst recht geringen Stückzahl zu fertigen. 

      Das bedeutet, dass du als Unterstützer garantiert eine Bobbleheadfigur bekommst, auch wenn das Gesammtziel nicht erreicht wird.

      Es liegt an Dir, ob dieser Artikel in Kleinserie oder sogar darüber hinaus produziert werden kann. 

      Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

      Wenn Dir mein Projekt gefällt, du aber zur Zeit zu knapp bei Kasse bist, freue ich mich natürlich darüber, wenn du hilfst mein Projekt bekannt zu machen.

      Teile es auf Facebook oder erzähl es deinen Freunden.

      Und auch das soll nicht umsonst sein.  Like meine Facebookseite und teile den Link zur Kampagne und du nimmst am Ende der Kampagne an einer Verlosung von 3 Bobbleheadfiguren teil!!!
