story:
• What is Scrumdillyumptious?

    Jill Bryan's Scrumdillyumptious is a sketch comedy/variety show starring the very talented Jill Bryan.

    Jill has teamed up with the Creator, Producer, and Director of the show Adrian Cordero to bring viewers original sketch performances, entertaining YouTube clips, and pretty much anything that's going to make you laugh.  The show will also introduce very talented local comedians and comedic actors from the Phoenix and Los Angeles area.

     Producer/Director, Adrian Cordero has been in the entertainment industry for the last 7 years. Starting as a Booking Agent/ Promoter, Adrian realized that with the overwhelming talent here in Phoenix, he could put together something special.  After producing multiple successful standup comedy shows around town, he then decided to take it one step further and start filming sketch comedy routines. A big fan of Saturday Night Live, and The Chapelle show made this an easy decision for Adrian. After shooting multiple sketches he then realized that the next step would be to reach an audience via the Web and Television. Thus, Jill Bryan’s Scrumdillyumptious was born. Official Pilot-  http://vimeo.com/75921199

     Jill is a very versatile comedian/comedic actor who has worked with Jimmy Fallon, DL Hughley, Jeffrey Ross, Norm MacDonald, and Kevin Nealon to name a few. Ms. Bryan has been in the comedy game since 2006 and has never looked back. Jill is the only female in The Comedy Squadron, a group of five very funny comedians who perform for the U.S. military. In the spring of 2013, the group traveled to Germany, Belgium, and England to provide some much-needed comedic relief and help boost morale at eight different military bases. It was the experience of a lifetime that Jill cherishes as her greatest comedic accomplishment to date.

    On Friday's you can catch Jill on the syndicated Lu Valentino Radio Show in over 150 cities! Ms. Bryan also has had the opportunity to be apart of a sketch comedy routine on The Jimmy Kimmel Live Show. Comedy is Jill's passion and this makes Adrian very excited to embark on this creative venture with such a versatile and talented comic. 

    We appreciate all the support in getting this project off the ground. This will not go unnoticed.  Your generosity will be rewarded. Whether it’s a thoughtful email, a t-shirt, an autographed DVD, or an Associate or Executive Producer credit for the whole first season.  Take great pleasure in knowing that you have just embarked on this creative venture along with us. 



    •  What You Will Be Helping With:

    The goal is to produce a television show that will be televised here locally in Phoenix AZ. Not to worry if you do not live in the Phoenix area. We Plan on also putting together a website where everyone will have the ability to view every episode. There unfortunately are production costs involved. This is where I ask for your support.  Production Insurance, Camera Crew, Sound Crew, Post Edit, Advertising and Marketing, Website Builder, Equipment Rentals, TV Spot, Costume and Props, are just some of the production expenses we will endure during this venture.

    The Impact 

    Your contribution whether small or big is greatly appreciated, and is going to help us get one step closer to attaining our goal. We look forward to bringing original, refreshing new comedy into your living rooms.  Thank you very much for taking the time to view our campaign!

    Other Ways You Can Help

     If for whatever reason you are unable to make a monetary contribution, we just ask if you could help spread the word and take the time to post the link on any social media you can. Facebook, Twitter, email, anything helps. I will post the Indiegogo share tool instructions below for assistance.  You can follow Jill via twitter @JillBryan for the latest on the show and what's going on in her exciting career. Feel free and check out our official pilot at the link provided. http://vimeo.com/75921199 

    Hope everyone has an amazing holiday season!

    How to Use the Share Tools-

    Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update.

    Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks

    Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.

    Send a direct email from Indiegogo

or an Associate or Executive Producer credit for the whole first season.
 Take great pleasure in knowing that you have just embarked on this
creative venture along with us. 


 What You Will Be Helping With:

The goal is to produce a television show that will be televised here locally in Phoenix AZ. Not to worry if you do not live in the Phoenix area. We Plan on also putting together a website where everyone will have the ability to view every episode. There unfortunately are production costs involved. This is where I ask for your support.  Production Insurance, Camera Crew, Sound Crew, Post Edit, Advertising and Marketing, Website Builder, Equipment Rentals, TV Spot, Costume and Props, are just some of the production expenses we will endure during this venture.


The Impact 




Your contribution whether small or big
is greatly appreciated, and is going to help us get one step closer to
attaining our goal. We look forward to bringing original, refreshing new comedy
into your living rooms.  Thank you very much for taking the time to view
our campaign!
Other Ways You Can Help
 If for whatever reason you are unable to make a monetary
contribution, we just ask if you could help spread the word and take the time
to post the link on any social media you can. Facebook, Twitter, email,
anything helps. I will post the Indiegogo share tool instructions below for
assistance.  You can follow Jill via twitter @JillBryan for the latest on
the show and what's going on in her exciting career. Feel free and check out our official pilot at the link provided. http://vimeo.com/75921199 
Hope everyone has an
amazing holiday season!




How to Use the Share Tools-


Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update.
Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.
Send a direct email from Indiegogo

story: Okay, I'm calling in a favor, if I have one to call in. Back in 1984 I did an extensive interview with the King of Comics, Jack Kirby. It was produced with professional equipment on high-grade video tape.It's two hours of Jack discussing his early life in the Lower East Side of New York, his time at War, and his first brush with art. Well, thirty years later I've decided to package the interview and offer it to the public. I've already had the tape transfered to HD digital and it looks pretty good.  Here is where you can help: it's going to take some help to correct the color, edit, add titles, find some music, locate stock footage and stills, and some cost I have yet to foresee If you would like to help with JACK KIRBY: COSMIC CARTOONIST, please contribute

story:
Elish and the Wicker Tale is a children’s book by the author, Kamran Salayev. It follows the life of Elish, a young boy who has trouble communicating and coping with the world around him. Elish would rather keep to himself, doing what he loves more than anything, crafting wicker artifacts. Once trouble stirs in his world, however, Elish is set on the path of adventure, forced to step outside his comfort zone and confront his fears in order to help those around him.


Elish’s behavior and insecurities mirror those of children around the globe who suffer from autism. Just like Elish, children with autism find it hard to understand and relate to people, so they end up devoting their time to something they can understand, usually a hobby or craft such as wicker-making. Kamran Salayev’s goal is to promote awareness of this subject through his book, and I’ve decided to join him in that endeavor.


As of spring 2020, I’ve been working on a comic/graphic novel adaptation of Elish and Wicker Tale, with the first issue due to be completed this summer. With support from crowdfunding, I’ll be able to publish the graphic novel, allowing children both with and without autism to access this story in a more visual and engaging form. Sales will also contribute to the cause, with 20% of profits going directly to charities and organizations that tackle autism and make the lives of children affected by it easier and happier.

 

The main objectives of the project:

  • Draw attention to the social inequality of autistic and healthy children.
  • Show the main opportunities and values through the character of the comics based on the book “Elish”
  • To create a new tolerant look for children through the illustrations.

This crowdfunding project will help to take a fresh look at the whole social problem and change the established human worldview through a comic book!

 

All sponsors will be written on the ‘thank you page’ in the book.

 

  1. Everyone who supports the project with 10 pounds or more will be indicated as sponsors.
  2. All sponsors who support the project with 25 pounds or more will be mentioned as sponsors and will receive an electronic copy of the book + autograph of the comic book author 
  3. Sponsors who support the project with 50 pounds or more will be mentioned as sponsors and will receive an electronic copy of the book + autograph of the comic book author + gift copy for any world library that will be sent from the UK (free shipping)
  4. All sponsors who support the project with 100 pounds or more will be mentioned as sponsors and will receive an electronic copy of the book + autograph of the comic book author + gift copy for any world library or institution that will be sent from the UK + original book Elish and the Wicker Tales by Kamran Salayev.

Once the book has been published by the Hertfordshire Press, it will be available for sale on the Amazon.
Thanks in advance for your support!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Видео Камрана Салаева о своей книге и проекте:

  
 

Поддержите детей-дождя: новый комикс от Тимура Ахмеджанова

 

«Илиш и плетеные истории» — детская книга авторства Камрана Салаева. Она повествуют о жизни Илиша — мальчика, которому трудно находить общий язык с миром вокруг. Поэтому Илиш предпочитает оставаться сам по себе, занимаясь тем, что любит больше всего на свете — плетением. Но когда наступают тяжелые времена, Илиш встает на путь приключений; он вынужден выйти за пределы зоны комфорта и побороть свои страхи, чтобы помочь людям вокруг него.

Поступки и комплексы Илиша отражают поведение детей с аутизмом по всему миру. Всем, как Илишу, детям с аутизмом сложно понимать людей, поэтому они зацикливаются на чем-то, что они понимают, чаще всего этим хобби становится плетение. Цель создателя книги — Камрана Салаева — в том, чтобы повысить внимание этой темы через книгу, поэтому я решил присоединиться к нему в его начинании. С весны 2020 года я работаю над графической адаптацией "Илиша и плетеных историй", первая часть которой должна выйти в свет уже этим летом. 

С помощью краудфандинга, я смогу опубликовать серию комиксов, дав возможность детям с и без аутизма прочитать историю в более наглядной форме — в виде красочных иллюстраций. Также 20% полученных средств будут перечислены благотворительным фондам и организациям, которые делают жизнь детей с аутизмом легче и счастливее

Задачи проекта:

  • Обратить внимание на социальное неравенство между детьми с аутизмом и без него;
  • Показать основные возможности и ценности через персонажа комикса по мотивам книги «Илиш»;
  • Создать новый толерантный взгляд на мир через иллюстрации.

Этот краудфандинговый проект поможет людям по-новому взглянуть на социальные проблемы и изменить устоявшийся взгляд человека на аутизм с помощью комикса!

Все спонсоры будут перечислены на странице благодарности в готовой книге.

  • Все спонсоры, которые поддержат проект 10 фунтами и более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры.
  • Все спонсоры, которые поддерживают проект 25 фунтами или более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры, получат электронную копию книги + автограф автора комикса
  • Все спонсоры, которые поддержат проект 50 фунтами или более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры, получат электронную копию книги, автограф автора комикса и подарочную копию, которая будет отправлена ​​из Великобритании (бесплатная доставка)
  • Все спонсоры, которые поддерживают проект 100 фунтами или более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры, получат электронную копию книги, автограф автора комикса и подарочную копию, которая будет отправлена ​​из Великобритании (бесплатная доставка) + оригинал книги Камрана Салаева "Илиш и плетеные истории".

 

Как только книга будет опубликована издательством Hertfordshire Press, она будет доступна для продажи на Amazon.

Заранее спасибо за вашу поддержку!

story:
Our Story

Alterna Comics is a small press indie comic publisher.  We only publish graphic novels (with the exception of one children's comic called The Unlikely Trio) in paperback form.  Our books are almost always in black and white; featuring unique stories from horror, sci-fi, fantasy, and action genres.  The company was started in 2006 by one person - Peter Simeti - who owns, operates, publishes, funds, and designs everything that the company does.  Without him, there would be no Alterna, end of story.  Peter is a substitute teacher with a love for comics and if things keep going the way they are, Alterna will have to cease operations within a year or two. 



The Impact

I wish I could say that we are a failing business because we don't have a good product.  But unfortunately, success is what has been killing us.  Credit companies and banks have slashed our financing to the point that we can't even afford to fund for advertising, promotional items, and BOOKS.  Credit lines that used to be $10,000 are now $2,000.  We used to put out 1 to 2 books a month, we now put out 4 or 5 a year - we don't even fund the print runs for these books anymore - the creators now fund them and in turn they get a higher profit percentage to compensate their financing.  We would much rather shoulder the print run burden but it's become impossible to do so.


Sales don't come in quick enough (book distribution takes up to 6 months to pay us) and we end up accumulating over $4,000 worth of interest ever year, even though we've maintained a small profit for the past 3 years, that profit has been quickly eaten up by the bills we have.  The most ridiculous part about all of this is our company debt is around $28,000 - which isn't even a lot for most small companies. It's practically nothing compared to a lot of the debt that most small businesses have. But due to the fact that we can't even make new books to spur new income - the debt has become stifling and will eventually take its toll on us within 1 to 2 years.


The most heartbreaking aspect about the possibility of Alterna going bankrupt is the fact that a lot of people will see their dreams die with Alterna.   Sure some creators may move on to other publishers - but even that is highly unlikely because Alterna has been publishing a lot of books that everyone else has already rejected for being too "out of the box", "weird", "not sellable", or any other various reason to reject quality work. All of our books are critically acclaimed and have even won awards and the hearts and minds of readers all over the world.  We're sort of the Island of Misfit Toys in the comics world.  But without us, a lot of these books, writers, and artists, will lose a home.


What We Need & What You Get

The goal of $1,000 is extremely small compared to what we need (which would honestly be at least in the $10,000 range) but anything helps. The $1K goal will help keep us alive for at least another year as we try to weather the storm we are currently in.  We can make the $1K go far and it might just provide the cushion we need.


For your generous donations, we will be rewarding you with books, signed copies of books, original art, commissioned art, and even a grand prize of all our books that are currently in print as well as some original artwork from the artists and creators of these books. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to donate, please spread the word about our campaign.  If you can put a good word for us in your Twitter, Facebook, MySpace, - any kind of social media - then that would be terrific.  We need as many people to know about this as possible so we can hopefully try and avoid bankruptcy.  thank you!!

story:
Outworld: The Summary

Hey, there!

I'm Jiba Anderson, owner of Griot Enterprises and creator of its flagship title, The Horsemen. This spring, we're releasing the next addition to our roster, Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers, and we need your help to make this happen.

Outworld: The Premise

Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers is a science fiction, kung-fu epic spanning 3 generations.

The Master Teachers have been outlawed and hunted to the brink of extinction by one of their own. The Diaspora System is under the iron grip of Oro, The Despot and his Beret Sheri armada led by his acolyte, The Paladin. The Diaspora, once a galaxy devoted to peace and diversity, has become the Utopia, a totalitarian society dedicated to expanding its territories through war, subjugation and destruction.

However, a rag tag band of rebels led by a disgraced Master will provide to the key to the Diaspora’s liberation and will ignite a revolution that will restore the glory of the Master Teachers and bring justice to a beleaguered solar system.

Outworld is a property geared towards males aged 10 -35. In addition, females in the same age bracket may become a large part of our audience as well due to a strong, capable female cast in the series. Finally, we may find a large adult audience as well. Outworld is reminiscent of such properties as Star Wars, Dreadstar & Warp and kung-fu films such as Hero and The Five Deadly Venoms. 

Outworld: The Final Package

Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers will be released as two 24-page issues in digital format as well as a 64-page “Expanded edition” print graphic novel. The book will distributed through Amazon, Comic Flea Market, Drive Thru Comics, Graphicly, IndyPlanet and Lulu.

Real Talk, we need some dough... 

Here’s the deal: we are looking to raise $6000.00 to help with production, marketing and printing costs. Here’s a breakdown of how the funds will be disbursed:

•         $2000.00 will go to finishing the production of the book

•         $1500.00 will go to the printing of the graphic novel

•         $2000.00 will go to funding convention appearances throughout the spring    and summer (C2E2, ECBACC, Motor City Black Age & SDCC)

•         $500.00 will go to advertising the book via pay-per-click channels.

The Cool Stuff

Of course you’ll get some really cool incentives based on how much you donate…Here they are!

•            $1.00 – You will have a place in the thank you section of the upcoming Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers digital issues and printed graphic novel.

•            $3.00 – In addition to being added to the thank you section, you will get a FREE PDF copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers’ FIRST issue.

•            $5.00 – In addition to being added to the thank you section you will get a FREE PDF copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers’ FIRST AND SECOND issues.

•            $15.00 – All of the rewards above PLUS a FREE PRINTED copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.

•            $30.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers 11” X 17” promotional print!

•            $50.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers T-shirt!

•            $100.00 (limited to 20) – All of the rewards above plus the entire Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers promotional poster series (8 prints) FREE!

•             $150.00 (limited to 10) – All of the rewards above plus an ORIGINAL sketch of a character from Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we’ll still push on. The book will be completed and all incentives will be honored. That’s how we do at Griot… Can’t stop, won’t stop!

 The deal about Griot…

Since 2000, Griot Enterprises has existed for one reason: To tell great stories featuring heroes of color.

We have seen many great African American superheroes in comics, but we never saw an iconic African American superhero team. We didn’t have our Justice League, our Avengers. We, as comic book fans of color, young and old, didn’t have a universe where our heroes reside...

... With the release of The Horsemen in 2002, Griot Enterprises filled that void.

Now, we are expanding our horizons and redefining what makes a hero for future generations. From pulp fiction to science fiction, from prose to graphic novels and animation, Griot Enterprises knows no boundaries…

… And honestly, Black heroes are cool.

Other ways to help

We understand that you might not be able to financially assist us, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help us out:

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/horsemengraphicnovel

And share this on your page, follow our blog, The Afrosoul Chronicles: http://jazintellect.wordpress.com/

Listen to our podcast, Ghetto of the Mind: http://jazintellect.podomatic.com/

tweet, tweet, tweet!: https://twitter.com/jazintellect

The more people knowing about us, the better…

…And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks in advance, fam and keep supporting Indie Comics and Black Sci-Fi… Cheers!

http://www.griotenterprises.com
story_txt:
Outworld: The Summary
Hey, there!
I'm Jiba Anderson, owner of Griot Enterprises and creator of its flagship title, The Horsemen. This spring, we're releasing the next addition to our roster, Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers, and we need your help to make this happen.

Outworld: The Premise


Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers is a science fiction, kung-fu epic spanning 3 generations.
The Master Teachers have been outlawed and hunted to the brink of extinction by one of their own. The Diaspora System is under the iron grip of Oro, The Despot and his Beret Sheri armada led by his acolyte, The Paladin. The Diaspora, once a galaxy devoted to peace and diversity, has become the Utopia, a totalitarian society dedicated to expanding its territories through war, subjugation and destruction.
However, a rag tag band of rebels led by a disgraced Master will provide to the key to the Diaspora’s liberation and will ignite a revolution that will restore the glory of the Master Teachers and bring justice to a beleaguered solar system.
Outworld is a property geared towards males aged 10 -35. In addition, females in the same age bracket may become a large part of our audience as well due to a strong, capable female cast in the series. Finally, we may find a large adult audience as well. Outworld is reminiscent of such properties as Star Wars, Dreadstar & Warp and kung-fu films such as Hero and The Five Deadly Venoms. 
Outworld: The Final Package
Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers will be released as two 24-page issues in digital format as well as a 64-page “Expanded edition” print graphic novel. The book will distributed through Amazon, Comic Flea Market, Drive Thru Comics, Graphicly, IndyPlanet and Lulu.

Real Talk, we need some dough... 
Here’s the deal: we are looking to raise $6000.00 to help with production, marketing and printing costs. Here’s a breakdown of how the funds will be disbursed:
•         $2000.00 will go to finishing the production of the book
•         $1500.00 will go to the printing of the graphic novel
•         $2000.00 will go to funding convention appearances throughout the spring    and summer (C2E2, ECBACC, Motor City Black Age & SDCC)
•         $500.00 will go to advertising the book via pay-per-click channels.
The Cool Stuff

Of course you’ll get some really cool incentives based on how much you donate…Here they are!
•            $1.00 – You will have a place in the thank you section of the upcoming Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers digital issues and printed graphic novel.
•            $3.00 – In addition to being added to the thank you section, you will get a FREE PDF copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers’ FIRST issue.
•            $5.00 – In addition to being added to the thank you section you will get a FREE PDF copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers’ FIRST AND SECOND issues.
•            $15.00 – All of the rewards above PLUS a FREE PRINTED copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.
•            $30.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers 11” X 17” promotional print!
•            $50.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers T-shirt!
•            $100.00 (limited to 20) – All of the rewards above plus the entire Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers promotional poster series (8 prints) FREE!
•             $150.00 (limited to 10) – All of the rewards above plus an ORIGINAL sketch of a character from Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.
If we don’t reach our entire goal, we’ll still push on. The book will be completed and all incentives will be honored. That’s how we do at Griot… Can’t stop, won’t stop!

 The deal about Griot…


Since 2000, Griot Enterprises has existed for one reason: To tell great stories featuring heroes of color.
We have seen many great African American superheroes in comics, but we never saw an iconic African American superhero team. We didn’t have our Justice League, our Avengers. We, as comic book fans of color, young and old, didn’t have a universe where our heroes reside...
... With the release of The Horsemen in 2002, Griot Enterprises filled that void.
Now, we are expanding our horizons and redefining what makes a hero for future generations. From pulp fiction to science fiction, from prose to graphic novels and animation, Griot Enterprises knows no boundaries…
… And honestly, Black heroes are cool.
Other ways to help
We understand that you might not be able to financially assist us, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help us out:
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/horsemengraphicnovel
And share this on your page, follow our blog, The Afrosoul Chronicles: http://jazintellect.wordpress.com/
Listen to our podcast, Ghetto of the Mind: http://jazintellect.podomatic.com/
tweet, tweet, tweet!: https://twitter.com/jazintellect
The more people knowing about us, the better…
…And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks in advance, fam and keep supporting Indie Comics and Black Sci-Fi… Cheers!
http://www.griotenterprises.com

story:
Hey there, folks!

My name is Chris Otto, and in 2010, I decided to sit down and reach for my dream of becoming a cartoonist.  Although I was not an artist, I decided to go ahead and try to write and draw the comic myself.  I got a few ideas for strips about my dogs, which blossomed into more ideas, and sat down and created "A Dog's Life"!  The comic follows the shenanigans of my chocolate lab, Hunter S. Thompson, his adopted sister, Gillian, and many other dogs and other creatures.

One day a few months later, Ben Taylor, a friend I met at the Virigina Comicon, sent me a message; "Have you ever considered having a guest writer for your comic? I think I might have the inkling of an idea for a story arc..."  I said, "Sure!"  His reply; "Alright well I have 4 words for you....

'Bark to the Future.'"

I was sold.

We started posting the story in June 2011, and the story ended in July 2012. Ben wrote the first 150 strips, and I wrote the epilogue.  This book will put the entire story into one collection for easy reading.  Follow Hunter as he and Gillian are sent back in time by "Dog" Brown, an old friend of Hunter's.  Trapped in 1999, they must find "Dog" Brown to help them figure out how they can get back to their own time and their people.  Of course, things don't go smoothly.  A gang of street dogs, Hunter's flighty mother, and many other obstacles stand in their way of getting bark....er...back to the future!

What We Need & What You Get

We really want to print the book in color, which drives up the printing price considerably.  I am looking to raise $700 to cover the cost of printing 50 copies of "Bark To The Future" in full color.  All money donated will go directly into printing the book.  If our goal is exceeded, the extra funds will go towards shipping perks and printing additional copies of the book.  If the goal is not met, all funds will go into printing the book, and I will cover the remainder.

As an added bonus, the cover (which you can get a print of at the $15 or higher level) has been drawn by Matt and Shawn Fillbach!  The Fillbachs are most famous for their work on "Star Wars: Clone Wars Adventures" for Dark Horse Comics, but have also put out many fantastic and mind bending graphic novels of their own!  Search them out on amazon.com, you won't be disappointed!  http://fillbachbros.com

The book itself will be at least 160 pages, collecting every strip from our "Bark To The Future" story line, plus some early character development sketches, fan art, "How To Draw Dog Brown", and a new original cover!

Why is this important to us?

This was a true labor of love by both Ben and myself.  He wrote a fantastic story, and since I only had to draw the strips, it gave me time to really concentrate on improving the way I draw and color the strips.  I grew tremendously as an artist over the course of the story, and really enjoyed drawing Ben's creative ideas!  We are both quite proud of our work and want to spread it to as many people as we can, in the form it is meant to be read in; one collection of a long form story.

This book WILL be published with your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you CAN help spread the word!  Please tell anyone you think may be interested in this project not only about this campaign, but also about the comic itself, which can be read online at http://adogslifecomic.com

story:
***Update***

Thank you to all of our contributors for helping make this happen. You will all be contacted for addresses, shirt sizes, etc. after the book returns from print (aproximately September 7th). I would like to let our Cosmic Deity / Other God level contributors Andy and Owen know that there will be no need for a raffle, as they will both be drawn into the Anubis graphic novel when it comes out. Thank you again.

 

Who Are We?

Christopher Sage is a writer from Tacoma, Washington. He entered the comic industry in 2009, where he's since worked as an editor and creative consultant. Anubis will be his first self-published work and will mark the first book under his new independent label "Savage Comics".

Levi Hoffmeier is an artist and illustrator from Columbia, Missouri. Following his commencement in 2010, he's worked writing and illustrating comic books and graphic novels, as well as creating storyboards and concept art for games and film.

About "Anubis"...

Anubis will be a 32 page, full color comic book illustrated by Levi Hoffmeier and written by Christopher Sage. It follows Anubis on his quest to uncover dark forces with ancient Egypt and begs the question, "if the gods of yore once existed, are they gone, or just forgotten?" The story combines elements of historical fiction, fantasy, horror, mystery, suspense, the occasional humor, and of course, action and adventure. To give you an idea of what the interior art looks like, here's a couple completed, but unlettered pages.




What We Need & What You Get

We're always seeking out cheaper ways to print and are in constant contact with printing companies all across the world, most of them locally. Currently the best rate we're getting for 1,000 full color 32 page books is about $1.40 a book ($1,400) plus shipping ($250). Not a huge chunk of change, but its still a bit of a strain on a writer's budget.

That is why we've decided to turn to IndiGoGo (and you) in hopes of raising the funds to get this project off the ground. In return for your support we'll reward you with a plethora of limited edition material; such as posters, t-shirts, artist proofs and of course, the comic itself.

All contributors, big and small, will be given access to up-to-the-minute news about Anubis (and other future projects) as well as sneak peaks at where the comic is headed and what is in store for the death god!

What If We Exceed Our Goal?

That would be fantastic! Every extra bit of money will go into packaging and shipping of the comics and rewards to you! Anything above that will be reinvested into the book, whether it be printing more books in the future or promotional materials for Anubis.

What If We Don't Meet Our Goal?

We're still going to print this comic because it's truly a labor of love. It may be a bit of a financial setback, and it may take a little while longer to get out, but we're fully prepared to pay out of pocket to make sure this sees the light of day.

Questions? Comments?

Anything else you want to know about Anubis, our team, or Savage Comics? Please feel free to drop Sage a line and He'll get back to you as quickly as possible! He can be reached at hans(dot)foodler(at)gmail.com.

Like Levi's artwork? Have a job or commission? Feel free to contact him at levihoffmeier@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, share the links:

indiegogo.com/anubis

facebook.com/anubis.comic

Beyond that, your continued interest and support of our work keeps us going.

Thanks a bunch!

- Sage and the whole Anubis team

story:
Short Summary

SUPER CAT is a new all ages friendly superhero adventure comic.  It follows the exploits of a short, overweight, heroic alley cat named, of course, Super Cat and his caretaker the ever trustworty Professor as they battle crime and evil everywhere.  Each issue of SUPER CAT comes jam packed with one long "feature" story written by Justin Mitchiner with art by Jason Contini; two short "back-up" stories, also written by Justin Mitchiner but these are drawn by Chris Hegland and Neil Basconcillo; AND at least one activity page so that everyone can interact with, and be a part of, the Super Cat story.

What We Need & What You Get

We have already completed TWO issues of SUPER CAT.  There is a preview issue entittled SUPER CAT #0.1 SPECIAL POINT ONE JUMP ON ISSUE and we are just now releasing SUPER CAT #1 which is the first full issue of our new book.  Issue #1 is also almost twice as long as our regular issues will be and features TWO "feature" stories, THREE "back-up" stories and TWO activity pages.

Since we are in full swing of getting our book done and printed (we're well into working on issue #2 now in fact) what we need help with is promotion.  With your donation, we will be able to print promotional postcards, small posters, and other such promotional material.  We will also be able to print extra copies of our first issue to include in press kits that will be sent out to comic shops all across the country.  So, in a way, you'll helping us get our book into a comic shop near you!

We also enjoy meeting with fans and collectors and so some of your donations will help us make special appearances at comic shops for signings and meet-and-greets.  In fact we're planning on being at the Wizard World Convention in Chicago this August to meet people and some of your donations will help us print the free giveaways that we have planned to bring with us for that apppearance.

In return for your donation we have many cool gifts ready to be sent out to you.  Everything from the actuall comic itself to exclusive trading cards to original art...EVEN an exclusive, custom made, hand painted, Super Cat action figure!

 

The Impact

Super Cat is a project that has been in the works for the last two years, although you could say that we have been working on this book since 1987...in a manner of speaking.  That was the year that artist Jason Contini first created Super Cat.  In 2008, as Contini began to work on the comic book LEGACIES END, he joked with the writer of that book, Nicholas J. Hearne, that he would find a way to work Super Cat into this very serious super hero mythology.  The jokes continued this way untill it was decided that maybe doing an actuall Super Cat book wouldn't be such a bad idea.  Justin Mitchiner came on board to take the writing reigns and we were off.  So this book means a lot to us.  We are not looking to take the world by storm here.  We simply have had an absolute blast plotting out the first two years worth of Super Cat stories and we just really want to share them with everyone and hope that they have the same fun with Super Cat that we have had.

Other Ways You Can Help

This project, for us, is all about sharing the crazy fun that is Super Cat with as many people as possible.  We appreciate any help you  can.  Follow us all on twitter.  www.twitter.com/#!/SuperCat_ALC

http://twitter.com/#!/archlightcomics

http://twitter.com/#!/JasonContini

http://twitter.com/#!/justinmitchiner

Retweet us even.  Friend us on facebook.  Like our facebook pages.  http://www.facebook.com/supercatcomics

http://www.facebook.com/archlight.comics 

Tell your family, friends, co-workers, cat groomers, dog walkers,...anyone that will listen.

www.legaciesend.yolasite.com (The Official Archlight Comics website)

Thank you so much for taking the time out to visit our page here and donate.  And just remember.....Super Cat is protecting the world...one hairball at a time!

story:
THANK YOU!

All contributors will be listed on the credits page of the full-length book.

Every little bit helps and moves this art further into the light.

My appreciation goes out to you all. Thanks for making it happen.

*******************************

On Becoming Butterflies...

We are all feeling into transcendence this year, as individuals, in our communities, and within the whole of humanity. The current is strong and so are are we! Kudos for coming this far!

 

I am a visual artist with a graphic novel in the works. It is called Black Dragon Year, and it is a story of the transformation that is currently unfolding as we embark on 2012. 


The story for this book, and the paintings/drawings that accompany it, have been coming through me daily and THIS IS THE YEAR to publish this work. I am so excited to share my art with the world, as I have been working on these paintings and this story for 2 years! What is special about this book is the style: I am using original paintings as the artwork and then using a mixed media approach with photographs, collage, and drawing to lay out the pages. 


The themes of this work include: Permaculture and (R)evolution of Consciousness, and the magically realistic story unfolds in real-time throughout the year.


You are INVITED!

   I am calling on YOU my glorious community to help me make this dream into reality. I need YOU to support my project so that I may create a high quality piece of work.  There are many ways* that you can be a part of this! The best way is to make a contribution to this campaign! 

  The first installment of Black Dragon Year will be 25 pages of full-color story-telling, and will be in print and available online this Summer! All funding raised will be put towards art materials, printing costs, and distribution of the book in installments. In return, all contributors of $15 or more will receive a copy of this first publication (in Ebook or in Hard Copy). You will also have the opportunity to:



         *Receive the Second Installment of Black  Dragon Year in advance!

         

* Have a character based on YOU in the full-length graphic novel!

           

*Advertise your business on the Sponsor's Page!

           

*Receive Bodywork and Astrology Readings!

 

                                       AND!

             

*Pick up an ORIGINAL PAINTING from the BOOK!!!


All funds raised beyond the goal will be put towards more chapters so that the book can be complete by the end of the Black Dragon Year (December 2012) !  AND if the Juju is REALLY FLOWIN, I would like to release a musical soundtrack alongside the book to create a truly multi-media experience.  It is a big year and I have BIG DREAMS. I hope that we can inspire each other towards the realizations of our most grand goals as we each step into this transformative  year.


I am so grateful to have an inspiring/supportive community as I venture into the mysteries of creation! Thanks in advance for your graciousness and your generosity. I can assure you that, with your help, you will have a high quality piece of artwork/literature in your hands (or on your screens) when the summertime rolls around.


 ~Alexandra Maida


*Collaboration and conversation are important to my process as an artist, and so I welcome feedback, ideas, and comments on the work as it is in progress (keep an eye out for updates in the coming weeks!)

***Please see the gallery section for paintings and art as the project develops. 

***More art and updates here: 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Living-Arts-Welln...



PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!

Tell your friends and Share! 


Thank you so much for your support!

The themes of this work include: Permaculture and (R)evolution of Consciousness, and the magically realistic story unfolds in real-time throughout the year.

You are INVITED!


   I am calling on YOU my glorious community to help me make this dream into reality. I need YOU to support my project so that I may create a high quality piece of work.  There are many ways* that you can be a part of this! The best way is to make a contribution to this campaign! 
  The first installment of Black Dragon Year will be 25 pages of full-color story-telling, and will be in print and available online this Summer! All funding raised will be put towards art materials, printing costs, and distribution of the book in installments. In return, all contributors of $15 or more will receive a copy of this first publication (in Ebook or in Hard Copy). You will also have the opportunity to:


         *Receive the Second Installment of Black  Dragon Year in advance!
          
* Have a character based on YOU in the full-length graphic novel!
           
*Advertise your business on the Sponsor's Page!
           
*Receive Bodywork and Astrology Readings!
 
                                       AND! 
             
*Pick up an ORIGINAL PAINTING from the BOOK!!!

All funds raised beyond the goal will be put towards more chapters so that the book can be complete by the end of the Black Dragon Year (December 2012) !  AND if the Juju is REALLY FLOWIN, I would like to release a musical soundtrack alongside the book to create a truly multi-media experience.  It is a big year and I have BIG DREAMS. I hope that we can inspire each other towards the realizations of our most grand goals as we each step into this transformative  year.

I am so grateful to have an inspiring/supportive community as I venture into the mysteries of creation! Thanks in advance for your graciousness and your generosity. I can assure you that, with your help, you will have a high quality piece of artwork/literature in your hands (or on your screens) when the summertime rolls around.

 ~Alexandra Maida

*Collaboration and conversation are important to my process as an artist, and so I welcome feedback, ideas, and comments on the work as it is in progress (keep an eye out for updates in the coming weeks!)
***Please see the gallery section for paintings and art as the project develops. 
***More art and updates here: 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Living-Arts-Welln...




PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!
Tell your friends and Share! 

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Hello friend! 

My name is Natalie and I invite you to a thrilling journey to the dark world of religious dictatorship!

Impious kind is a brutal sci-fi novel with edgy social and religious background. The story starts when christian sect accomplishes "coup d'etat". Everything falls apart. New authority literally speaking divides people in two parts: the righteous and the sinners. The righteous ones will be able to taste the Cure that provides salvation and eternal life. Well... sinners are not so lucky... 

Meet the characters!

Ivory is the 26th years old nurse in local hospice. Oh… she became a nurse. Former wunderkind, genetic scientist. Non-human rational, soulless, ready to do everything if the end justifies the means. She used to lead New age inf. project (in Solution laboratories) based on nazi eugenics trying to create a immortal super human, the next age of human evolution, ready to live and able to breed. One day after experiments on pregnant girl she realized what she is. She had to disappear, die to the science world. And she did, but she could not go alone. 

NO NAME. He may had the name, but…  it is forgotten. He looks older than Ivory, about 29 years. He is a product of Ivory experiments. 

Ned is nearby liquor store redneck cashier. He represents men hurt by system, but who found themselves after the revolution.

John Blake is christian sect leader. Charismatic, truly believer that WORLD IS POSED BY SATAN. And his role is to save each and every sole. He arrived from Spain, because the only country that can make difference in the world is… 

Mary is his right hand. Enlightened, God spoke to her and told exactly what to do. She is his direct line to God.

Take a peek to Chapter: Origin of evil! 

What's next? 

Impious kind will contain 5 full chapters:

1. Origin of evil

2. Rebirth

3. Faith vessel

4. Blind Shepard

5. Final genesis

Today you can pre-order Chapter: Rebirh! Issue date August 2013.

Rewards

Take a look at those geeky staff ;-) 

Thank you all! 

P.S. Special thanks to Przemyslaw R. Dedelis who helped me to make this happen.

P.P.S. If you want to be part of impious kind team please CONTACT me!

story:
NAUGHTY "NOOR" NICE (NNN)

Naughty "Noor" Nice is a rebellion against the endless drone of insipid commercial Christmas music. Inspired by the likes of Weird Al Yankovic, Tom Waits, and local groups Kopi Kat Klan and Budak Pantai, NNN's music is the illegitimate lovechild between Jazz music and toilet humour.  

Who are we?

NNN comprises vocalist/actress Joanna Dong and pianist Aya Sekine (who are interchangeably "Naughty" or "Nice") and drummer/percussionist extraordinaire Mohamed Noor (who is steadfastly "Noor"). Over the years however, our guest performer lineup have expanded to include an almost embarassingly stellar lineup of local musicians and singers (just to name drop, last year's concert alone featured Alemay Fernandez, Michaela Therese, Vanessa Fernandez and Lily Anna Nuris).


This December, NNN  celebrates five years of creating Christmas music mayhem. For three prolific performers with such diverse commitments, it is incredible even to ourselves that once a year, every year, for five years since 2010, we have put aside everything else in the precious month of December just to do this. Nevertheless, we foresee that some changes in the near future might mean this is the last time we get together, before moving on and taking some time off to allow the jokes to fallow. 

WE WANT TO SAVE THESE SONGS FOR POSTERITY. WE WANT TO RECORD THE SONGS SO THAT THEY CAN BE SHARED ON THE INTERNET, IF ONLY TO FADE INTO OBLIVION AFTER SOME TIME. 


THE ALBUM

We've done it all. X'mas songs were never this wild, NNN took them to Japanese traditional, Surf-Rockabilly, Dangdut, French softporn sound track(ish), Gangsta-rap, Evergreen classic (twisted and twisted further), extreme mash-ups, ching-chong Chinese style, hard-rock and more... apparently our audience has ripped their rib cages laughing. 
Amongst those experimental arrangements, our album will feature the smash-hits which have been familiarised to some of you since our birth in year 2010. We are finalising the song list, but if any of you have any request, you can message us! 

THE GUEST MUSICIANS

Besides 3 of us, we have been going through miracles and now officially smeared with Singapore's both local and foreign talent :
  • Tama Goh (drums/percussions)
  • Brandon Wong (upright / electric bass)
  • Alemay Fernandez (diva vocal / dialogue)
  • Bani Rahman (electric bass / vocal)
  • Rizal Sanip (drums / percussions)
  • Shawn Letts (saxophone/backup vocals)
and we also have wonderful friends like actor Zachary Ho and vocalist Dawn Ho as part of some of the 'crowd' chorus!

1-Hour long documentary video full of our 5 years footages, behind the scene clips and exclusive interviews are also in the works. 


NNN NEEDS

Because our material is risqué, and potentially offensive (albeit we always try to do so in good taste), it is difficult applying for funding from you know, the proper channels. 
But just because we aren't PROPER, doesn't mean we can't get props. And I don't mean whips and handcuffs. We need your PROPS (read: support), in cash or kind. (Preferably cash!)
We are looking to raise $8000 SGD in cash and sponsorship for the following :

  • Studio Rental and setup
  • Recording, mixing, mastering
  • Video shoot and editing
  • Print and press of CDs
  • Marketing and promotional materials
  • Licences for non-public domain Christmas songs we mash-up/alter
and last but most importantly we want to pay the musicians and friends who would help us out!


HELP!

Please take a look at the various options we are offering and see if you can contribute!  We have included a wide range of options for all budgets, failing which, it costs you nothing but a few minutes to SHARE AND REPOST THIS CAMPAIGN so we can get the word out. We really can't wait to let you hear our music today.

THANK YOU! 
Naughty 'Noor' Nice
Winter 2014

story: Comics have travelled a long road to currently being seen as a form of art thanks to independent creators taking the lead and producing their own comics. However, there is still more work to do and this exhibition is one format that can be used to continue the journey of comics towards independence. This exhibition, which will be held in a recognized public gallery, will feature the work of five independent comic artists who currently continue the journey of comics independently with their creativity and dedication to the medium. An exhibition like this will help engage members of the public who may not be aware of the potential of comics in their cultural community and give credit that comics are art and that the creators are artists. All we ask of you is to help us cover the rent of the gallery space. Your contributions will help these artists gain the recognition they deserve and help increase public awareness that comics are art.

story:
Stretch Goals Reward Chart (these additional rewards will be given out if the final amount raised has reached these stretch goals!)

$2000 (REACHED!) - All $3+ contributors will also receive a brand new 1.25" Jim button in addition to the original one!

$2500 - All $8+ contributors will also receive a short bonus e-book based on a special memory from Jim's childhood adventures!

$3000 - All $12+ contributors will also have themselves drawn in Jim style next to their names on the "Backer's Page" inside the book!

$3500 - All copies of "I'm Sorry Jim" will include a "Making Of" section where the author will discuss the themes in the book in detail and talk about the inspiration for the book's story based on personal experiences.

$4000 - All $3+ donators will receive an exclusive 5x7" art print in metallic paper signed by the author!

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

This is Jim, but something's very wrong.

I'm Sorry Jim is the second chapter in Jim's unfolding narrative of self-discovery, remembrance, and life's beautiful unpredictability (with a few toilet jokes thrown in for good measure).

And I'm Tanner Simmons, an illustrator and writer who loves a good story about humanity, with plenty of nonsense and wit thrown in to spice things up. After successfully funding my previous campaign for the physical printing of This Is Jim, I felt flooded with inspiration to continue building this naive and wondrous character's intriguing backstory. But what could I do differently this time? I didn't want to do a simple repeat of what I'd created with the previous chapter, so I dove deeper into my own personal memories and stories to create what became the much more narrative focused plot of I'm Sorry Jim.

I thought about moments from my youth both good and bad. What it meant to be afraid. What it meant to lose things to time as we get older and how that can change our lives in ways both big and small. What resulted was an incredibly cathartic project that stoked my love for this character, and for storytelling as a whole.

In the first chapter of Jim's tale, he learned about his own potential, and that he could strive to be a better version of himself with every passing day. In I'm Sorry Jim, however, the tables have turned for the worst. Jim is sick, and is faced with a number of repressed fears that have bubbled over and now haunt his memories. Leading us to question, what is Jim so afraid of?

After funding the original book's physical printing, and then publishing the pages online through webcomic hubs like Tapastic and Webtoons, I was able to build a larger fanbase for this project and decided to take the opposite approach with this sequel. Every page of this new chapter is currently available to read online (alongside the first chapter, This Is Jim) for FREE through the Tapastic and Webtoons links below.

Tapastic: https://tapas.io/episode/585576

Webtoons: https://goo.gl/i8Fa7C

(Both Tapastic and Webtoons are also available as downloadable apps on Android and iOS devices! You can read them while you're taking a dump, nice!)

I implore you to read through both books online if you haven't already, as I don't want to hoard this project from the world. I made it for everyone, and want everyone to be able to experience it, no strings attached. I think everyone can find something to relate to or gravitate towards in this story, and I think that's truly powerful. Even if you only get a chuckle out of it here and there, that's plenty for me.

That being said, I would graciously appreciate your support in funding this first printed run of I'm Sorry Jim. Funding this book will not only help me as an independent artist by allowing me to create new self-published works, but will also allow me to have extra physical copies for sale at conventions and shows, as well as books to use as pitch products for potential publishers of current and future iterations of Jim, whatever form that may take!

Here Comes The Good Stuff

Aside from having I'm Sorry Jim physically printed into both hardcover and softcover copies, you can expect riches abound for contributing to the campaign! Below is a list of reward tiers you can pledge toward that'll net you some fantastic Jim swag that's up for grabs. We've got some digital and traditional goods available for donators both high and low, and even if you can only spare a single dollar, you'll get something for contributing to the cause. Be sure to read up on each reward tier below to see what perks are being offered and find a pledge amount that works for you! Digital e-books, exclusive wallpapers, stickers, buttons, custom drawings, and much more!

GOLDFISH ($1 TIER) - Exclusive "This Is Jim" themed desktop/mobile wallpaper!

GUPPY ($3 TIER) - Wallpaper + 1.5" x 2" Jim Sticker + 1.25" Jim Button!

SALMON ($8 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + Digital PDFs of "I'm Sorry Jim" and the first chapter "This Is Jim!"

BLUEGILL ($12 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Your name on the "Backer Page" in the back of the book!

BASS ($30 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Physical Softcover "I'm Sorry Jim" Book!

RAINBOW TROUT ($35 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Softcover + Author's Signature in the front of the book!

STARFISH ($45 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Physical Hardcover "I'm Sorry Jim" Book!

SWORDFISH ($50 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author's Signature in the front of the book!

KOI ($60 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author Signature + Special Dust Jacket designed by the author!

OCTOPUS ($75 TIER) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author Signature + Dust Jacket + Personal illustration of you in Jim style inside the front cover of the book!

WHALE ($100 TIER - LIMITED QUANTITY!) - Wallpaper + Sticker + Button + E-Books + Backer Page + Hardcover + Author Signature + Dust Jacket + Personal Illustration + An additional softcover copy of the first chapter "This Is Jim!" (2nd Edition)

Risks & Challenges

Although I've had experience with getting physical copies of books printed before, I will be going the extra mile to minimize errors in the printing process and make sure you get a shelf-worthy product for all of you who choose to contribute to the cause. The final dimensions of the book will be 8.5" x 8.5" inches, fitting nicely on the shelf and in your hands and rests at a whopping 176 pages!

Another big reason I'm choosing the Indiegogo route with this project is that This Is Jim and I'm Sorry Jim contain some adult language and suggestive themes that aren't suitable for very young readers. By self-publishing, I can avoid having to edit out sections of these two books that I consider to be important despite their more adult-oriented content. These moments are few and far between, but it is worth mentioning that these are NOT books meant for children. Please be aware of this if you intend to purchase a copy of either book for a child. The content will either make them giggle incessantly or will go right over their precious little heads, so be mindful before letting them read through it.

I wrote this new chapter of Jim not as someone who thinks they understand all there is to know about life, but as someone who feels they have the agency to express their current understanding of it the only way they know how: through art. It's how I find a way to connect with other human beings that may have similar or even vastly different life experiences than my own. To triumph over the obstacles in my life and be able to be the voice in someone's ear that says "you're more human than you realize" is what I hope to achieve, and I hope you choose to join me in that same mission. Just like our pal Jim, we aren't perfect, but we're doing what we can to be that much better every step of the way.

Just like our pal Jim, we aren't perfect, but we're doing what we can to be that much better every step of the way.

story:
Beyond Lovecraft is a portmanteau horror story that draws directly on the works of H. P Lovecraft. Drawn by award winning artist Rob Moran and written by award winning writer Jasper Bark, it's a 96 page graphic novel featuring four stand alone tales and one on going story that links them all together. This is a grim and cosmic love letter to the mythos that means so much to the creators.

THE STORY ARC


The linking story is set in the apocalyptic aftermath of the return of the great god Cthulhu. The scattered band of humans that survive this catastrophe scratch a bare living, hiding in the shadows of what’s left of their civilisation.

A tiny group of scientist from Miskatonic university find a way to access the fabled Library of the Yith. This is an alien archive that contains the entire history of the universe and was first mentioned in Lovecraft’s novella: ‘The Shadow Out of Time’. 

The scientists hope to find a way to stop humanity’s extinction and win back their planet from the Elder Gods. Instead they uncover four tales of cosmic terror, and personal loss, that will forever change the way you view the Cthulhu mythos. 

THE STORIES

OCCUPY THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS

In ‘Occupy the Mountains of Madness’ a band of eco warriors, protesting arctic oil drilling, uncovers an evil far greater than the 1% who own all our wealth.

THE COVER OUT OF SPACE


A Fortean journalist travels to Arkham’s blasted heath to investigate the mysterious disappearance of legendary, underground cartoonist Victor Rodriguez and the rumours of an alien visitation. He discovers the unimaginable truth lies between the covers of a living comic book, a sentient being, made of ink and paper, that gets high when you read it.

OUT IN INNSMOUTH


Growing up gay in the poverty ridden town of Innsmouth leaves 16 year old Zeke desperate to escape. When he meets Jay on-line he doesn’t realise that the older man is grooming him, but the sinister currents of Innsmouth’s murky past are about to catch them both in it’s inescapable undertow.

THE THRALL OF CTHULHU


In an alternate world, the Cthulhu Mythos has infected all literature like a virus. Few people can remember a time when every story ever told wasn’t about the dark Old Ones. A handful of readers must work with a tiny group of fictional characters to repel this invasion and keep their reality safe from the Elder Gods.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Beyond Lovecraft has already been picked up by top UK publishers Markosia, so the publishing and distribution are covered. Unfortunately, due to the current economic realities of comics publishing, Markosia can’t afford to pay us a page rate. Sadly this is an increasingly common state of affairs in the comics industry and that’s why campaigns like this are SO IMPORTANT.

Traditionally comic creators are paid a page rate for their work, like an advance against royalties. This page rate can be anything from $50 to $5000 depending on whether the creator is providing pencils, inks, colours, script or letters, and how big a name they are in the industry.

If we meet our campaign goal, you will have helped us raise just enough money to pay ourselves a third of the page rate that we usually make. That’s right, only a THIRD OF OUR USUAL PAGE RATE. We don’t mind about this though. This is a Dream Project for both of us and we are obsessed with making it a reality.

Even though we will be working for a third of our usual fee, we will still be able to pay most of our bills and that will mean we can devote all our time to this project without having to take on other work to feed our families.

You will be helping us pour our twisted hearts and dark souls into this project. And if you knew how dark our souls were, you’d realise what a service you’re doing the world by giving us a place to pour them.

WHERE THE CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO:

This is a breakdown of where all the funds raised will go:


We would love you to get involved with our campaign and share the passion and excitement we have for this project. If you are able to contribute we have some really unique perks on offer.

Every perk is designed to put you at the heart of this campaign and to share ownership of the whole project. We’re offering bespoke gifts and some completely unique experiences, because we believe this is a special project and we want you to be an integral part of it.

If you don’t feel you can contribute straight away we do hope you’ll come back and check us out over the course of the campaign. If you could share the campaign with your friends, maybe tweet about it or post on other social media, we will be just as grateful. 

If you don’t get around to sharing our campaign, please do leave a message and let us know what you think. Every bit of feedback is important to us and we really welcome your thoughts.

Thank you for checking out our campaign and we hope you can join us for the ride, as we travel Beyond Lovecraft.

story:
Help us print a collected volume of the "Rogue Soup and Bug" mini-comics. It was written by Rand Borden and illustrated by Jeremy Arambulo. It is an action/comedy using characters from Kaiju Big Battel and parodying the manga "Lone Wolf and Cub". The 176 page book is finished and ready for printing. We need your help raising the funds to print the first edition. 

The Story

It is the story of characters from Kaiju Big Battel that takes place away from the wrestling ring. Kaiju fighter Kung-Fu Chicken Noodle has decided to rase the orphaned baby Sky Deviler, who has been prophesied to become the greatest kaiju fighter of all time. He takes him on the road to teach him the ways of Kung-Fu. Soup is hired to assassinate a rogue scientist and takes the baby along. 

The evil Dr. Cube has decided the future power of the baby will be his to control and attempts to forceable seize the baby using his army of Minions and Monsters.

The story behind the story

Kaiju Big Battel is a Boston/NY based collaborative that is mostly known for its live action spectacles featuring elaborate monsters fighting it out in a miniature city that is placed inside a wrestling ring. Often sited as a product of the cultural feedback loop between American and Japanese pop culture. You can go to kaiju.com to learn more about us.

We also produce a lot of video content and this comic started out as an ambitious film project. Early on it was split into two directions; the comic and the film. The script was given to artist Jeremy Arambulo and he was told to do what he liked with it. He was left in the dark about the film version and the people working on the film wouldn't see his version till it was complete. It was my experiment in different perspectives of the same material. 

In case your wondering the film is about half way done but that is a whole other fundraising project for a later time.

story:
All of Our Feelings at Once is five oversharers who have been performing completely original, monthly comedy shows for over a year. We were selected for participation in The Araca Project, which means we will be bringing our show to an off-Broadway venue for the last two weekends of October.
 
All of Our Feelings at Once always gets personal, but that’s the fun. Whether it’s through original songs, multimedia presentations, or interactive games, we reveal, share, amuse and embarrass ourselves by any means necessary.

What We Need

Like any thrilling adventure involving feelings, our Off-Broadway run brings some expenses. To list just a few examples, Feelings needs to buy insurance coverage for the performances, rent lights and speakers, invest in a few basic props, and print programs.

What You Get

Customized artwork with your face in it! Custom poems about your life! Advice just for you. MASH fortune-telling just for you. And, just for you, horrible things done to our real-life hair.

The Impact

We want to bring our very best selves to New York. With your help, our show will retain its unique, intimate voice and heart while reaching unprecedented heights.
 
Each New York show, like each Chicago show, will feature special guest artists, too, so your help means you'll also be supporting local NYC comics and musicians.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of ways you can get involved with Feelings!

  • Come check us out live! We have at least one show every month.
  • Laugh at and share our web videos.
  • Suggest yourself, and your most talented Chicago and NY friends, to be our comic and musical guests.
  • And of course, please share this Indiegogo page!

Thanks for reading and watching!

 

With All of Our Feelings,

 

Rebecca, Robert, Alison, Britta, and Jesse

story:
About Me

Hi I’m Ross, but if you follow my music then you probably know me better as ManGo. Originally from Bristol I moved to France from a young age, spending 6 years in Toulouse before moving back to the UK. France has such a vast and vibrant collection for graphic novels, and this is where I fell in love with illustrations. I’ve been making music since I was 14-15 years old, but I’ve been drawing since I can remember.

Now based in Cardiff I am a university graduate of which I studied Graphic Communication. Alongside university, I have run numerous successful club nights, while DJing at most of the top venues in South Wales. I now work as a Design Assistant at ‘Motel Nights’, a cafe / bar in Cardiff, looking after their brand and social media.

(You can check out more about my music and my work for Motel Nights at the bottom of the page.)

The Project

Til The Lights Go Out  is a project that illustrates the struggles of DJs and other performing artists during the pandemic. Back in March the UK Government announced a nationwide lockdown lasting around 3 months, which put a halt on retail, hospitality, pubs & restaurants, and the nightlife industry. Although since then many restrictions have been eased there hasn’t been any plan to revive the nightlife industry, which has left many performing artists in the dark. This is why I have decided to name the project ‘Til The Lights Go Out’, which also represents the end of the night at a club, along with touching upon mental health.

The Comic  focuses mostly on my experience, including the ups and downs of life during the pandemic whilst touching upon other people’s experiences, and poking fun at some situations I’ve encountered along the way.

The EP  acts as almost a sound diary, consisting of 5 songs, featuring some of my favourite artists from Cardiff & Bristol, touching upon similar topics as the comic. I’ve designed it to coincide with the comic, so both can be experienced together.

Rewards

You didn’t think you’d be donating to the project without copping yourself some juicy rewards did you? Taking a look below for what you’d get for each tier:

Costs

Currently funds are pretty tight (as I’m sure they are for many other artists), so producing this piece of work is going to come at a cost. Here’s a rough idea of costings for the project and where your money will go:

£150 - Printing the Comic

£100 - USBs

£50 - Keyrings

£50 - Mastering Songs

£250 - Artist Features on Songs

Specifications

Comic Specs:

A 40-page A5 Perfect Bound Booklet, with a 350gsm matt laminated cover and 150gsm silk paper pages, which has a slight sheen to it while being soft to touch.

EP Specs:

The songs will be on an 8GB USB, delivered with the comic, fully mastered in both WAV format (for the DJs out there) and MP3 with all the necessary track information (song ID, artwork, etc.) ready to be pasted into your personal music library. The USB will also feature a digital version of the comic in PDF format.

Keyring Specs:

The keyrings will be locally produced, made of black acrylic with the detail being engraved and finished with a coat of white paint.

Stretch Goals

It would mean the world to even reach my initial target, but I guess there's nothing wrong with considering the "what-if"!

£600  - Great! I can make the project as planned.

£1000  - Woah, I guess that means comic number 2! Those of you who purchase 'The Comic' perk (or higher) will receive the 2nd book free of charge, once completed in the new year!

The Impact

This project is the next step in my creative adventures, but it also has a deeper impact too. In the current climate where we’re constantly wondering what tomorrow will entail this piece of work offers somewhat of a reflection on what many of us have experienced in recent months. I believe it will be something that most people will be able to relate to, whether you’re an artist or just love a good rave, we have all been affected in some form or another.

By donating to the project you will not only be supporting me but also other people including the local businesses printing and cutting the physical products, and funding the music artists featuring on the EP.

Considering how underfunded the music industry already is, you will be directly contributing to artists continuing their craft and helping to spread awareness about the topics discussed in the project.

Risks & Challenges

Along with every project comes potential risks & challenges. Most of the timely stuff comes from me, including creating the comic and finishing off the EP. I have a strong relationship with the printers and Amy who creates the keyrings - both I have used for projects in the past with no issues whatsoever.

The main risk I see is if I don’t hit my target by the time the fundraiser is complete it could potentially delay you getting your juicy rewards. I am 100% determined on creating the project, so it would mean me personally funding the remainder of the money.

Regardless of any potential struggles along the way I will be posting updates about the project on both here and on my socials! (Check them out at the bottom of the page)

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that helping out isn’t always about donating, and I appreciate any form of support for the project! The best way to help me out aside from donations is sharing the project and making some noise. Not only will it help me a great deal, it will exercise the topics of the project to more people. Also check in on your mates! Mental health isn’t a big part of the project but it can be a big part of people’s lives, especially through lockdown.

Socials

Motel Nights: https://www.instagram.com/motelnightsuk/

My Music: https://soundcloud.com/mango_uk

Facebook*: https://www.facebook.com/mangoukg

Instagram*: https://www.instagram.com/mango_uk/

Twitter*: https://twitter.com/mango_ukg

*I'll be posting updates about this project on these socials. If you have any questions about the project then feel free to hit me up on these socials too!

 

Thanks for reading my waffle and I hope you consider contributing to the project! <3

story:
What is BAM?

Hello good people and welcome to my fund raiser page. Please allow me to fill you in on what "BAM" is exactly. Founded by myself Terrell Culbert, illustrator, photographer and director (Breathe Again Magazine) is a small press publication. It is a pop-culture magazine created for comic book fans and all who are awesome! I interview writers, artist, musicians and models! The big focus of my book are the independent creators out there putting together those sometimes hidden gems.

Who does the art?

Guest artist and the fans help bring "BAM" to life! As creator of the magazine I surround myself with an army of talented artist! I have been fortunate enough to collaborate with some really multi talented creators such as Dan Dougherty. Aside from being a all around just cool dude, Dan is also a writer, artist and musician. He is also the creator of Beardo, winner of the "Shel Dorf Award"!

The Women of Cosplay and Gaming!

 

Over the past couple years I've met some really cool costume designers. Largely women who pull together these outstanding costume designs each year for conventions. In essence they are "The Ultimate Fans"! And lets face it, what is a convention without those young ladies who transform into our geeky fantasies! Breathe Again Magazine has a book chapter where we talk to these women and showcase some of their painstaking work.

 

What do I need the money for?

I am looking to make this issue 52 pages of cool comic art, pin-ups, interviews, industry tips and cosplay photography! This magazine serves as a voice not only for the guys who've been in the business a while, but also the ambitious new creators as well. Think of "BAM" as a preview book for the independent comic book creators, artist, writers, Cosplay models and more!

But I need money for printing cost. The amount of copies made will depend on the amount of money I make from fund raisers. If the goal is not met I will put the money we did make toward the book and you will recieve your purchased rewards, when the donations are transfered.

The magazine is pretty much completed, the main challenge at this point is money for printing cost and promotional tools.

 

 Lets talk rewards for your contribution!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What's International Shipping?

Just add $12 dollars to your order!

I have no money but still want to help!

Awesome! Thank you! Please just tell all your friends. Spread the word via facebook, twitter, deviant art, smoke signal, can on a string---Whatever it takes!

THANKS

Thanks so much for checking out my page! I'll be updating with behind-the-scenes info and expanding on any questions people send my way so keep coming back
