I am looking to make this issue 52 pages of cool comic art, pin-ups, interviews, industry tips and cosplay photography! This magazine serves as a voice not only for the guys who've been in the business a while, but also the ambitious new creators as well. Think of "BAM" as a preview book for the independent comic book creators, artist, writers, Cosplay models and more!


But I need money for printing cost. The amount of copies made will depend on the amount of money I make from fund raisers. If the goal is not met I will put the money we did make toward the book and you will recieve your purchased rewards, when the donations are transfered.
The magazine is pretty much completed, the main challenge at this point is money for printing cost and promotional tools.
 
 Lets talk rewards for your contribution!

 
 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 
What's International Shipping?
Just add $12 dollars to your order!
I have no money but still want to help!
Awesome! Thank you! Please just tell all your friends. Spread the word via facebook, twitter, deviant art, smoke signal, can on a string---Whatever it takes!
THANKS
Thanks so much for checking out my page! I'll be updating with behind-the-scenes info and expanding on any questions people send my way so keep coming back

story:
The Mighty Jambo may well be Britain’s premier jam-powered crime fighter but that doesn’t mean he’s got it made. After foiling what appeared to be a simple robbery he finds himself in the eye of a storm! Now Jambo and his sidekick (just don’t say that to his face) The Astonishing Cheezar must battle mysterious ninjas and all manner of super powered thugs hired by The Sinister Quichara to make sure that the not-so-dynamic-duo never intervene in one of her schemes again!

Can they survive the onslaught? Will the city be saved from evil’s clutches? Will Jambo and Cheezar ever stop arguing? All you need to do to find out the answer to all/some/none of these questions is chip in a few quid so we can get this book printed!


The Mighty Jambo is the creation of George Beedham, who is 27 years old and lives a double life: By day he’s a mild-mannered office worker and by night he’s a comics drawthor (author who draws). He has been drawing people being kicked in the face for over ten years! He also has a degree in Interactive Design from Liverpool John Moores University. He currently lives in St Albans with an award winning artist (who is also his long suffering girlfriend) and their cat (neither of whom read his comics).

Ok so as you can see from that handy icon to the right, 800 of your American Dollars (500ish pounds... I can't get this thing to show british money I'm afraid) are needed to get this thing off the ground. This should cover getting 100 books printed and shipped to the UK (where Not Regret Studios is based) in order to launch it at the MCM Comic Expo in May this year.

 

 

So what's in it for you?

  • The obvious thing is a 100 page full colour collection of the first four issues of The Mighty Jambo. All the artwork from the original issues has been used but a lot of the early stuff has been resized and recoloured so it would work in this format. You can either treat this as a pre-order service and pick your copy up from me in person at a convention or I'll send it out right to your door!
  • You'll be helping to back a creator owned British comic... And at the moment, creator owned stuff needs all the help it can get!
  • All the money raised by this page will go straight into funding the project. Even if we go past the goal (fingers crossed) the money will go into promoting the book or getting more copies of it printed. Most importantly: you'll be able to see where your hard earned cash is going!
  • Then of course there are the perks! Take your pick from any of the options over there, look at all that stuff! 

 

Update: All contributors will now receive an exclusive desktop wallpaper in a variety of sizes!

 

Can't chip in yourself? Don't fret! You can still help out by mentioning this campaign on your blog, website, twitter, facebook, deviant art, tumblr or any other place folks might see it! We can't get anything done without your support so please spread the word any way you can!

 

Don't forget to keep an eye on this page and the main site (http://notregret.com/jambo/) to keep up to date on the progress of this project and any new perks we might decide to offer!

story:
From paper to people

“WALKING STORIES” -  T-shirts with a unique mission and design policy: they present artworks-stories created by illustrators and comic artists from all over the world, bringing them from paper to people.  Each T-shirt comes with a little card shortly telling the story of the artwork while the back of each shirt features the artist’s name, proudly yet unobtrusively bringing it into the world.  And, since we want to provide a stronger support for the artists, starting with the next edition 10 - 15% of each sale will go directly to them.


Long lasting material and thoughtful design

To make sure that our stories can walk around for a loooong time, feeling comfortable and still looking great, after long searches we have chosen an amazing quality fabric from the “Arula” in Austria. We tested the fabric by washing and ironing it several times and we must say – it is keeping its good shape no matter what. For some more information about the fabrics, click here.

Apart from the storytelling, the shirts themselves also are works of art– their original cut with the adjustable sleeves is a creation of the fashion designer Liene Dejus. The fine unisex cut looks fabulous on boys, girls and anybody else.


After Liene has done her work – decided on how will the shirts look, our marvelous seamstresses from Ugāle bring them to life.

All illustrations are hand-printed at our open silk-screen studio “Luste”, conforming to the highest quality standards as well as using environment-friendly water-based inks.


First edition was already made - why are we here?

“WALKING STORIES” is the second child of the “LUSTE EDITION” project. The first one - “Luste Edition #1 - I Hope you like it” presented works of seven artists from different countries and was well received by people in Latvia and abroad.

That inspired us to continue and grow. But since most of what we earned with the first edition was used to cover the production costs, we cannot really give it a go just on our own. Therefore we are here, looking for your support in order to be able to raise funds for the sewing, printing and transportation of the fabric for the new shirts. 


What we use and need money for.

Most of our current and planned expenses (around 40 %) are related to the production and future development – ordering and transportation of fabrics, sewing and printing as well as the building of a network. Around 30 % goes to people who are putting a lot of their time, energy, knowledge and skills into making it all happen. 15% covers VAT and other similar lovely and unavoidable expenses and at last, but very far from the least – starting with the new collection, 10 - 15% of each sale would go to the artists.


So, to give it a kick, at this point we need your support for production costs. How exactly do we plan to use the money? Check our IndieGoGo cake tray below!

There are already so many T-shirts in the world, so why to produce even more? 

Well, by doing what we are doing we definitely are not reinventing the wheel, yet we still believe that our shirts are special and different. Because of their quality and because of their mission.


Quality –we produc e the shirts our selves from the very scratch, starting from an idea of a cut and looking for the most suitable fabrics and finishing with an accurate sewing and printing work, using environment-friendly inks. We also care for the aesthetic quality, meaning – the shirts are designed not only to last for long, but also to look really classy, thus they are not just T-shirts, but rather a fashionable good quality garments to supplement your wardrobe.

Mission – art of illustrators and comic artists mostly stays on paper and is seen and enjoyed mostly just by particular groups of people. Well, we believe there are so many great characters and stories so worth to be told to the world and meet people they would otherwise never meet. By producing and wearing WALKING STORIES we are promoting art and artists as well bringing some joy and topics for a discussion in the streets. 

Walking Stories - DESIGNS

For better resolution of the designs check here.


Perks

Leporello



Gym Bag


Stretch goal


Our current challenge is to make the “WALKING STORIES” walk, meaning - to provide all the necessary resources to enable the process of production and marketing. Dreaming of the future, in the next potential Luste Editions we would like to cooperate with animators and very young artists (children) in order to create great stories for original design sweatshirts with a removable hood, in other words - fabulous fine cut hoodies, showcasing wonderful works.  


Future plans

If everything will go well, we plan to invest our time and energy in the creation of an international network for artists and other creative people who would like to cooperate not only in the context of “Luste Edition” project. We plan to organise workshops bringing together people of different disciplines – animators, writers, anthropologists, photographers, designers etc., in order to develop new and exciting concepts of stories and storytelling as well as sustainable design approaches.
www.lusteedition.com
